review_body: White sands is just the place to stay if you want to drop your baggage and hit Waikiki or the rest of the Island. It's close to everything, yet not overly priced. The rooms are cozy and the bed will make you feel like you're on clouds. The Air Conditioning is so awesome and so is ceiling fan. The staff is friendly and you don't get the touristy hustle and bustle of Waikiki but you feel the island style of Hawaii.

I have been at White Sands for 4 weeks due to flight cancelations back to the mainland, and it has been so enjoyable. It has a very local Hawaiian feel, with a very pretty tropical pool area. All of the rooms have recently been redone, also in the local Hawaiian motif. The location is really convenient to the beach, stores, restaurants, and the staff is super friendly. All of this at a reasonable price!

My sister and I had a week at White Sands 9-16 March 2020 (just as covid-19 was threatening the world....). From the moment of enquiring to checking in the staff and David the manager in particular was super helpful and welcoming. We arrived early in the morning and were able to check in straight away for a small early check in fee which was much appreciated and reasonable since we basically had the whole day ahead of us and it was good to settle in and shower before heading to the beach. The rooms are recently refurbished and kinda kitsch which we loved. Really keen and fresh with an old fashioned island vibe. Location was great 2 blocks back from the beach and with Dukes Lane 50 metres way we had a direct line to the beach.The pool area is small and all that you need with the BEST sun loungers I think I've ever experienced. Wide and soft and plenty of sun or shade. Free coffee and ice all day long, free newspaper, there's a bar being built but no kitchen or café not that you need it. In the room there's no tea or coffee making facilityor utensils or plates etc, but there is a fridge for your drinks. But really this hotel is all about value and location.

This hotel is conveniently located a block away from International Market Place shopping center and 2 blocks from Waikiki beach. I spent 3 nights here the weekend before the Coronavirus lockdown began and was given a spacious room facing Nohonani St. on the 2nd floor. I arrived early at 11am and tried doing early check-in but the front desk was demanding $50 so I opted for free luggage storage instead and returned in the evening after doing some sight-seeing. The king bed was very comfortable, the free WiFi internet was fast and the bathroom was well stocked with towels and toiletries. There was no bathtub and the shower stall's shower head was positioned really low and couldn't be raised. The TV had plenty of channels, in English as well as foreign languages. Transportation-wise, this hotel is very well connected to most landmarks with a direct bus, such as 19/20 from HNL airport and downtown, 42 to/from Pearl Harbor, 2 to/from Diamond Head, etc. There are plenty of restaurants and convenience stores along nearby Kuhio Ave and aforementioned International Market Place has free Hula performances in the evening in the central foyer. A good choice if you are looking for a budget hotel in Waikiki and don't want to pay a lot in resort fees.

great value, nice clean rooms and the staff are the best I have ever dealt with. they went out of their way to accommodate us we did also use the luggage storage as our flight was later in the evening we went shopping and touring all day and returned for our luggage and shuttle pick up for the air port

Don't stay here; find some place else and pay the higher resort fees! Some staff nice; a couple of them not so nice. Parking sucks and not guaranteed your entire stay. Stalls are small and guests don't know how to park; they need a good valet that know how to reverse into small spaces to park cars. No standard amenities, like a coffee maker in room; kitchenette, but no dishware, glasses, utensils etc. Shabby looking hallways. Not enough towels; had to go to front desk for extras; had to ask room maids for toilet paper and kleenex; our stay was 4 adults for 3 nights. Emphasize, pay the resort fees and stay somewhere else!

Location on this hotel is awesome. The staff was super friendly and helpful. They let us hold our luggage there prior to and after our stay so that we could enjoy the downtown location. The rooms are clean comfortable and very inviting. This location also has the advantage of a very nice pool. Security deposit and resort fee.

Loved the room, the cleanliness, the staff and the location! I highly recommend parking at the parking garage instead of the hotel. It’s very small and easy to back into another car. It is $5 more, but totally worth it.

This small hotel is by far one of the best of the area, clean, quiet, gorgeous, every detail made our stay a dream! From the staff to the cleaningness of the room, decoration, etc. It is considered a 2-star hotel but it is better than other 3 and 4-star hotels we've stayed at. We saw a couple other hotels around and even price wise this was the best bet. Thank you!

Clean rooms, liked room that have pool view but this time waterfall view. Rooms are being updated and more will be available soon. Staff is very friendly. The rooms and pool area are kept cleaned even with workers the pool and other area's were kept neat and clean.

This hotel has been recently renovated providing a unique Hawaiian experience that is welcoming & quiet. The hotel is located convenient to Waikiki & within walking distance to the beach, restaurants & shopping. The staff is very accommodating for making guests’ stay comfortable. Reasonably priced for its location, it’s a hidden gem.

This is what a lot of the hotels were likeSmall boutique style and they have a charm of their own for sureLove how they have mixed old and new hereNice furnishings and comfortable bedA few things however the inside connecting door in our room to the next was super thin and you could hear everything next doorThe carpet Is old and stainedEverything else in the room is spotlessNo coffee maker in room but pay for coffee bar in the lobbyNice big quartz countertop in the room with sinkFlat screen tvWhisper quiet air con as well,as ceiling fan Small table and chairs inside and small table and chairs just outside the sliding door that leads to the pool  Nice little pool area with comfy loungers and tables and chairs and it,s private from other buildings  Nice clean bathroom ,shower only  Microwave and small fridge plus there is a safe in the room  The only dealbreaker for me was how you could hear everything in between the two rooms other than that this is a good property in a good location Staff were super friendly

Not far away from the International Market place and it takes only 10 minutes to the Waikiki beach. Only the shower was not hight enough for tall people. Very clean, nice little pool and a friendly little hotel between all the other hotels.

This hotel suited our family of 4 just as we anticipated. Our vacation was budgeted and this allowed us to be in the heart of Waikiki without blowing our budget. It’s a hidden gem for sure! Renovations are ongoing but you can see from the photos it looks great! The staff was super friendly, kids enjoyed the pool and I loved the sunblock and aloe dispensers at the pool! Kids enjoyed seeing the word of the day at the front desk each morning as well. The front desk checks out go pros and while we didn’t need a camera, my son had his, they still let us borrow a selfie stick which was kind. There was also ample closet space and a safe in our room!I wish I had taken more photos to share!My only complaint was that the a/c in our room did not work but we slept with the balcony door open for the breeze every night and were actually quite comfortable. Beds were definitely doubles so next time we visit we’ll spring for a suite! We’re easy going travelers and we had no major issues!!Please note: there are no elevators so if you can’t do stairs be sure to request a lower level room. Mahalo!! We’ll be back!

Excellent place to be near things in the quiet without outside noise. It is centrally located and only two short blocks fro the middle of Waikato’s. The building is on a quiet street an there is no outside noise in the rooms. It is clean, pleasant and the staff is always willing to help.

Kudos to David and Sunshine at the front desk, they gave great service and were very friendly. The GM Romeo was also very nice as I met him in the lobby. I have stayed at the White Sands a couple of years ago and I was not impressed, but the renovated rooms really looked great! The lobby and pool area were also renovated and it looks like a little oasis in the middle of the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. The friendly service, the beautiful renovated rooms and hotel really made my stay enjoyable. I will be back!

This will be a cute boutique hotel but it still needs work and is under construction. The staff was GREAT. The room was super cute and big. The location is central but there is a bar next door and some local homeless that you may have to contend with if you return later at night. They have a nice pool area and onsite coffee bar that's open until 2pm. There was a kitchenette but note no dish soap or dish towel. The shower could also use a soap dish but hopefully they will sort this out before they are done with their renovation.

I booked this hotel as a cheaper option to spend one night before moving to our main hotel. As we were arriving late at night, we wanted to spend as little as possible whilst still being comfortable. White Sands fit the bill although I still can't get over how expensive low-mid range hotels are in Honolulu in terms of what one gets for the money. Friendly reception, easy check-in. Hotel seen better days with worn carpets and musty smell. Room was clean. Mattress way too soft. Quiet. Close to everything. All in all and ok to good enough experience.

Loved the calm happy vibe. Enjoyed my stay even with the patio construction underway. If you want a little peace while on Wikiki, this is a great choice. Mattresses are not premium, but I slept well. Apparently good enough for this travel snob. Staff great. Even without the hot tub (due to outdoor renovations) I would opt to stay here again.

Central location right in the center of Waikiki closer to the Ala Wai Blvd side. We went for a run every morning to either the Ala Wai Blvd side or the Waikiki Beach side. Perfect for exploring Waikiki as it is literally at the center. Parking was available along Ala Wai Blvd or parking lots which are close to the hotel.

just went back in feb 2020, we stayed there on one of our trips over to visit, now that we live here we use it as a staycation place. It is close to everything, beautiful pool area and rooms renovated. At times rooms are very reasonable, this stay only disappointed in that we never ended up with any type of housekeeping services, we had to ask at desk for towels, David (front desk) great guy asked if we had put up a do not disturb sign (which we DIDN'T) therefore our room should of been taken care of, the only thing they ended up doing is sending a couple of towels to our room. Parking is not recommended as there is no really affordable place to park there. My only other complaint is that the carpet really needed vacuuming.

This is the place to stay for a very friendly staff. Clean rooms that were large. On the ground floor next to pool with patio. not to much space to park on site, but other parking just across the street. Only steps away from shops, restaurants, with beach two blocks away.

Stayed here with my boyfriend and friend. We were very excited to see how cute this place was! The welcome desk had some games and magic eight balls upon check in - they also had a Christmas tree out front! The side of the welcome desk has free coffee, a cute record player, and extra suntan lotion and aloe for sunburn. The pool was lit nicely, surrounded by comfortable lounge chairs, and shaded by palm trees. We stayed on the second floor - there is no elevator, so we had to walk our suitcases up ourselves (not a problem for us but could be for others). I would recommend calling for a first floor room in advance if this could be an issue! There is parking. However, spots are limited, so I would call to reserve a pass ahead of time ($30/day). The rooms were clean and had a TV, air conditioner, and mini fridge. I would suggest asking for extra towels if you have more than two people, as we seemed to always run out! Also, their sister hotel (a block away) has a laundry room that you can use if needed!Overall, we were happy with our stay and would stay again, especially because the location is within walking distance of Dukes and other awesome places on the beach.

Feel like home. Resort style hotel with great service and atmosphere at super good location. Very good stay as it is quiet, comfortable, and bright room. Surrounding area is safe too. Suitable for solo and family vacation.

What a terrific find! Cozy and comfortable hotel steps away from shopping and restaurants and most importantly a couple of blocks to the beach! The staff were wonderful, especially Christianne and David. The rooms have been recently renovated and met all of our needs. The bed was comfortable, although the pillows could be better. Excellent wifi and coffee available at front desk. Pool lounges are amazing and they are in the process of upgrading the grounds to include a poolside bar, lounge and kitchen. Would definitely go back!

Lovely little hotel, quiet, clean, absolutely wonderful staff and close to everything in Waikiki !! We really enjoyed our stay (wish we could have stayed longer !) Bed was comfy, pool was great, pool loungers amazing - loved the decor and the "feel" of the hotel - homey and comfortable and a nice quiet place to chill out after a day at the beach or a night on the town. Will be back :)

We were very happy with our room at this small hotel. It was extremely quiet and spacious - including both a table and a desk along with a comfortable king bed. It's just a short walk from the bustle and hustle of Waikiki, with restuarants, shops, big hotels that let you walk around and peek, and the beach. Don't judge the rooms by the exterior views, which seem very ordinary and a bit downscale. All the workers were friendly, as well.

Well whats not to say , me and my drinking partner have traveled to a lot of different countries and places , ( she wants to seriously go to Afghanistan ) at my age no it ain,t happening , but the sands well we been going there off and on for a number of years and stayed there when it was the " old White Sands " , it was great , had character , then they did the reno , very nice and tasteful , location , well second to none , not on the beach , but yet close enough to the action , it,s just a matter of time before price goes up , book now , they got this hole in the wall pub next door, that looks sketchy and is so full of character , dodgy patron,s , any way , the White Sands is the place .In Canada , Alberta , unemployed !!!!

We loved it here. Boutique hotel feel (no commercial feeling), loved the special touches like record player in lobby, beautiful pool area with comfortable pool loungers, quaint and relaxed. Would definitely consider returning to this hotel.

I had a hard time deciding whether I should keep the secret to myself or be fair and write a review for this hotel. Finally my good feelings won and I just want to say what a beautiful place this is. I went twice in the past months, and was made feel like a member of family each time. As I returned the place was even more beautiful having been refurbished. I love that it is beautiful, feels very genuinely local, and is very quiet although just a couple of blocks' away from the beach and all the crazy tourist action. It still manages to make you feel like you belong there. The rooms are very comfortable, clean, there is free coffee available at the lobby or even in the room upon request, most probably the only uncrowded pool in Waikiki and the best hospitality staff in the islands. But don't tell anyone please.

Every year, my sister and I go on surf-cation to Hawaii. Unfortunately this year, my sister got rammed into by a newby surfer, and got pretty substantial injury (she will be is fine, she was seen by a doctor there and is also seeing a doc back home!). This left her unable to leave the hotel room for the first few days, unable to eat any solid food, and needing to ice her face. This was our third year doing this so we've stayed in many hotels in/around Waikiki but we could not have asked for a more genuinely caring staff than the ones here, especially David and Christianne at the front desk. David constantly asked if my sister was feeling ok, tended to our needs, made sure all the staff was aware that we needed to use their freezer downstairs (the in-room fridge doesn't have a freezer) to switch out the ice pack every few hours, provided us with a small spoon so she could eat. As for the facility, it really was a hidden gem. We've stayed in up-scale hotels like Surfjack, Sheraton and Alohilani, more comparable places like Shoreline before - but the White Sand's room was surprisingly large. Every room seemed to have been equipped with a large balcony or a porch space (on the 1F), free coffee downstairs, enough storage space, decent sized counter space with a kitchen sink and microwave (which helped with heating up soup once she can manage semi-solids) and even a table to eat on. It's not 'grammable' like Surfjack or Shoreline, nor do they have fancy/cute cafe like Shoreline, but it was everything we needed it to be. Clean, spacious, balcony, and close to everything. The only thing we'd ask as an improvement is perhaps a screen door on the balcony so we can air it out without worrying about the mosquitos, and perhaps water fountain/jug downstairs so that we don't have to keep purchasing plastic water bottles and adding to the plastic waste. But these are all easy fixes; what makes or breaks a stay is kind, dedicated, and caring staff and you won't find one much better than David! Also room tips: Don't stay on 1F if you care about privacy. They don't seem to have an elevator (or were we blind? We couldn't find one) so don't stay up high if you have walking problems. We stayed in 2F and it wasn't a problem at all!

Thank you for a vital contribution to my pleasant travel experience to Waikiki. As a lone traveler, the location, staff friendlies and overall atmosphere is always important to a successful vacation. White Sands contributed to this very well. Perfect location, nice rooms, decent pricing and a pool area to serve as a small lounge in the busy streets of Honolulu. Highly recommend

Renovated rooms and lobby are great, strong and quiet Air conditioning. There is one downgrade i do miss... the cooking range oven in the room. Maybe larger coffee machine would be nice. Also if anyone wonders about wifi, yes it was working alot better than before the renovations.

I was a little hesitant of staying because of the reviews of the previous reviewers but totally wrong. Pool area/ guest room/ bathrooms all updated and clean ! I would stay here and recommend it to everyone! There's a little waterfall by the pool area and the pool seats are nice. Overall, highly recommend hotel. The area is awesome was able to walk to the waikiki downtown the beach was a 7 min walk. Can not go wrong with this hotel. The staff is great very nice and helpful! The hotel rents out the gopro, boogie board, and other stuff to their hotel guest.They have a security guard in the evening and night so felt secured.The parking is not free just like other hotels but there is street parking literately 2min walk near the river.Hotel room and hotel bathroom is clean, updated. The rooms have tv, fridge, blow dryer, towels, shampoo/lotion/condition/ bar soap. This hotel has all the necessities a hotel provides, and for the price YES!Went with boyfriend and friends.HIGHLY recommend and will stay again.

If you like concrete and bamboo, the newly updated White Sands is for you. If you recall the open, flowery approach to the front desk, the abundance of greenery, and the warm, aloha spirit-----be prepared for a shock! The current White Sands is very clean, fair prices, comfortable beds, good location, with a polite, uniformed generic staff. The aloha spirit is gone!Our daily living was a challenge. In the remodeling, our once comfortable studio no longer had a kitchen, dishes, cutlery, table, chairs, or reading light. The rather useless tea wagon occupied space next to the small storage unit with three drawers. I gave the space to my partner and lived out of my suitcase. The new shower floor was very slippery with no place to put my soap or wash cloth.Our unit had a microwave and a refrigerator. The block for the local grocery store was demolished, so our choices were the ABC store or constantly eating out. There was regular morning coffee, period. Concrete and bamboo with some surviving greenery here and there surrounded the existing lovely waterfall. Gone were the lush surroundings that attracted the birds and their songs. Each once open lanai was now surrounded by bamboo fencing. It reminded me of Ala Moana Shopping Center, especially at night when bright lights banished the evening darkness and gave daylight all night.After returning yearly since the White Sand reopened, and writing gushing reviews, this is my final review. With a heavy heart and fond memories of a tropical delight that was once the White Sands, we will not return.

Upon arrival we were warmly welcomed by the friendly reception staff. We asked for a first aid, and the staffs were very helpful. The room was a little bit smelly when we walked into the room. The room was easily getting stuffy because of bad ventilation

Excellent place to stay for our weekend getaway. The staff is very friendly, the rooms are very welcoming and spacious, and it's in the heart of everything. I will definitely be staying here again for our next staycation.

Great small hotel to get out of the rush and relax in a small oasis of your own. The room was great but if you have walking problems keep in mind this property has no elevator or more than 8 parking slots on site

Me and my family went to visit Honolulu for the third time as we love this island so0o much. We have stayed in this property for the second time around and we still love this hotel especially now that it’s fully renovated you get your value for money. The main reason for us choosing this hotel is because of their location. It is so convenient to walk around waikiki and come back to the hotel to freshen up. Lastly, we love the team members here who assisted us from check in to check out. Special Thank You to Elvie and Doug for assisting us. We shall see you guys soon again. Mahalo! :) - aNa

For the price, you can’t beat this location. We stayed in the suite and it was quite spacious. The pictures speak for themselves and this by far has my favorite decor. Most 4 star hotels in Waikiki are outdated but this 2 star hotel is certainly updated. You can exit the back gate with your room key which leads you directly to the International Marketplace where you can easily access the beach, Cheesecake Factory, or other shops from there. Parking is limited and you would have to park at Aqua Skyline at Island Colony for $30/day on the next block but once you park, you can easily exit the back gate and stairs to walk across the street to the hotel. But to reenter, you’d have to walk around the block to get your car. There is also a small parking lot directly across the hotel which I didn’t notice but other guests used with no problem. Not sure of the price. Also street parking with meter. The pool is nothing spectacular and next time I return, I would get a day pass at another hotel. Walks are so thin you can hear everything outside but that didn’t bother us.

My partner and I stayed here two weeks ago and it was absolutely wonderful! The staff was super friendly and really helpful. The room was posh (includes free, reliable WiFi). There's complimentary coffee in the lobby (and a pool-side bar in the works!) The outdoor pool oasis was lux (there's even a waterfall!) and it's open late, so you can have an evening dip after swimming in the ocean. And the location was great—easy walk to the beach, restaurants, bars. Stay here! I really really want to go back already!

It’s nothing too fancy but a very convenient location and walking distance to the beach and restaurants. Also close to a lot of good shopping and great for pick ups on tours. Staff was very friendly and helpful on any questions I had to get around the island.

Back in September when I first started my search for a place to stay after 15 years being away from "home" I stumbled upon this property online. I liked what I saw.....everything reminded me of my childhood and what old Hawaii was all about. I took a chance ...booked the room for 5 nights and was not at all disappointed ! Although the property was being renovated the room was great the pool was useable and it was near everything I wanted to do and see. The staff was so wonderful and I was treated like Ohana... So....naturally..when I went back in October I needed to stay there again and had an even better experience. New lobby....pool area complete !! This is my new home away from home !! Mahalo nui Loa for a wonderful experience ! ❤I will be back !

location was good but lacked a few facilities no bar or restaurant etc door banging due to windy location is an issue late at night its back from the main strip but pricing reflected this. staff were very helpful and and always available

We will definitely return to this kitschy gem. Our room was recently renovated, very clean and cool as a cucumber!The friendly desk and cleaning staff were very helpful. Just a few minutes to the beach, with a great poolside lounge, comfy patio chairs and cold beer next door!

I can’t express enough how great it was to stay at White Sands Hotel. A few days before our stay in Oahu, the Airbnb we were supposed to stay in had cancelled our reservation so I was desperate for another place to stay. I’m so glad I found White Sands Hotel. The room was clean and comfortable, and the entire building felt incredibly homey. Christianne, who works the front desk, was by far the best part of our stay here. She allowed us to check in 4 hours early, gave us an upgraded room, and made us feel like family. We will miss her the most and will definitely stay at White Sands Hotel again the next time we’re in Oahu!

The hotel was cute and quaint. Perfect distance from the beach. The best part of the stay was the staff. Christianne specifically really made our stay extremely welcoming. Her hospitality made us feel right at home from the moment we arrived until the day we left. I can’t imagine our stay without her! Overall, Everyone was great! Will stay here again the next time I visit Oahu!

Great place to stay, family friendly and close to everything. Special shout out to Fe and Christieann who always helped with navigation and ideas of where to go and what to do with the kids. Walking distance to Waikiki beach, lots of places to eat and the city bus stops. Neat and tidy rooms, the kitchenette didn’t have much in it however that didn’t concern us. Recommend.

We have just returned from a wonderful 8 night stay at the White Sands Hotel. Renovations are almost complete with just the spa and bar areas left to be finished ( I believe). The rooms are nice and modern with good sized balconies and comfy beds. The location is ideal - right in the middle of Waikiki. 5 minutes walk through the International Marketplace to the beach, and close to all the bars, restaurants and shops. The staff were all lovely - in particular Christy Ann who was so helpful and provided the best customer service, give this lady a raise! The pool area is so relaxing and peaceful, with great pool loungers and nice tropical gardens and waterfall area. Can't wait to return!

The hotel is currently under renovations, but the room I stayed in was finished, well decorated, had a nice split style AC and comfortable bed. I'd totally stay here again. Its in the heart of Waikiki right out the back of the International Marketplace. Be aware that the hotel doesn't have any parking, so you'll have to park around the block at another hotel.

Room is newly remolded, beautiful view of pool, no phone or clock in room, room did not seem to be quite yet finished, requested king got two double, was told that's all they had, booked in advance, received a family emergency 4 hours after check in so had to leave, no refund of any type even though nothing was used in room, charged for amenity fees even though we were told at checkout it would be waived, called and was informed she was not authorized to refund but would give to Douglas the manager, never heard back, with remolding going on, front desk is basically in hallway, not very pleasant, at check-in gave her our id she printed out the room but had wrong name on it, got corrected but someone could of been charged because details were not correct. We have stayed there before and that is why we booked a one night instead of going home late that night since we do live in Hawaii, very disappointed that they didn't seem to care whether things were handled properly.

Stayed there for one night. It’s still under renovation so check-in is in a room on the first floor. The grounds are clean. Hallways are a bit dated and tired looking. But, the room was updated and comfortable. For the price, it was worth it. Rooms don’t have irons, ironing boards, hair dryers, etc. Think of it as a slight step up from a remodeled Motel 6.

This is a great location with in walking distance to the beach and main spots on Waikiki beach. I was in Honolulu for 4 days 3 night and need something that was close to everything as I wanted to maximize my time there. the bus stop is very close to the hotel so getting to and from the airport was easy. I had a queen size room, it was clean and it was very specious, had a fridge, a microwave and a sink. They are currently going through the remodel so they didn't have a main lobby but that's not an issue. The staff was great, friendly and helpful. The pool area is nice and clean. I would definitely stay there again

The staff was very friendly and the room was clean. Good location - just a few minutes to the main spots at Waikiki beach. The pool was under renovation but the pool of the nearby sister hotel could be used.

We got a room last minute at this hotel after missing a connection. Upon arrival, we did have to use a secondary entry around the back due to renovations but, but the night porter made up for that quickly. We were offered a great room at a good rate. The bed was king size and very comfy. It had a good quiet air con and I slept like a clubbed baby seal. The next morning checkout was without fuzz and the bus to the airport is only minutes away by foot. Unfortunately we missed our flight as it was overbooked, but we returned to the hotel and we were greeted in a similar fashion. We even got our same room back!I’m an airline pilot so my hotel experience is great and varied, and I would 10/10 recommend this place for the budget conscious traveler with an affinity for proper rest!

This is a fantastic hotel. They are undergoing renovations at the moment, but most of the rooms are renovated and are beautiful. We were not affected by the renovation at all, and reception has been relocated, but it didn’t make any difference to our stay. Very good rates for a lovely hotel in the centre of Waikiki. Stay here for sure. Thanks to lovely Christianne (spelling?) who was wonderful and helpful during our stay.

Stayed here for 5 nights and the location was by far the best asset. Room was nicely decorated and the beds were very comfy! However the room was lacking minor luxury’s like a kettle and phone... as well as the shower was tiny and barely functional, took around 10 minutes for the water to heat up and even then the water pressure was very weak, got wetter outside from the humidity.. as well as the air conditioner caused the room to have a funny smell... the staff were lovely and more than happy to accommodate and assist us in anyway they could. This hotel was renovating during our stay so everything was a bit of a mess with construction everywhere, however it was very well managed, everything was still clean and there was no noise! Worthwhile staying for a cheaper alternative close to all the action.

As per title. Communication seems to go through their ‘sister (parent?) hotel’ Aqua Sands (which is a short walk away). Pretty unprofessional. I was promised the deposit will be returned in 2 weeks. Since I live outside of the US, my means of chasing them to get this done is also limited. STAY AWAY. I would highly discourage going here. On top of all that, the hotel was a construction site while we were there.

We stayed here for a few nights before heading to north shore. So happy with the experience and customer service. Within walking distance to everything in wakikiki which was great. We went to north shore for a few nights and came back to the same hotel and the lovely lady at check in upgraded our room which rounded off our Aloha experience! Thank you a white sands hotel !!!

I enjoyed my stay in beautiful Waikiki while staying at this hotel. I thought the staff were super friendly, the remodelled room was cute, clean & comfortable and the hotel is near anything you may need (international marketplace for shopping & entertainment & restaurants, ABC store for snacks/drinks, blocks from the amazing beach, a bike or shuttle ride from the Ala Moana Shopping center and several bus stops were near). If you're high maintenance, this may not be for you because it's not a Hilton. I'd definitely stay if/when I return.
user_name:
Deirdre D
San Diego, United States

review_body: I added the "with potential" because they are in the middle of a massive remodel. It should be very nice once complete but for the time being it is kind of a mess.There isnt parking that I could find so we either had to find something on the street or pay to park in a garage. Parking on the street can be risky because of the neighborhood, however parking along Ala Wai Blvd. Wasnt bad as long as you could find a spot.There isnt a phone in the room but it was clean and well cared for. Beware...shower is tiny. There isnt a lot of room for any type of movement.

Still under construction not on Expedia site! Night Manager was great and helped for hours on phone move to New location. No security on entrance and not a good area. Do not know how they get ratings and pics definitely not the same!

Man there was a lot of construction when we were there. BUT, the staff are very friendly, and the little pool is fun. The rooms are quite nice, with big balconies. First time in Hawaii, this was a great place to stay. Very happy with it.

The hotel was still under renovation when I was there in third week of May, the surrounding was a bit messy but the room is newly refurbished, quite spacious and clean, and comes with a balcony. It is value for money especially when it is located within easy walking distance from the beach. There are plenty of eating places around and the international market place is right close by. The hotel also provides a complementary shuttle ticket for visits to Ala Moana Centre.The hotel reception staff has been cheerful and helpful, although she couldn’t find my booking done with agoda, she was able to help resolve it and got me check in early. The room has a small kitchenette with a microwave, but do note that there is no cutlery provided.

I was really surprised at how lovely the rooms were decorated. I had a single room with a king size bed, small kitchenett and a desk. It was comfortable and roomy and all I needed. The hotel is close to everything, shops, the beach, great food places etc. I thought the free shuttle service to Alomoana Mall was a real bonus and a big plus for the hotel. The staff, particularly Bev and Christiana, were amazing and so helpful. In fact (and I hope she doesn't mind me saying this) but Bev really helped me out of a tough spot. On the morning I checked out I actually missed my transport to the airport by 2 mins and Bev, without hesitation, offered to take me in her own car as she could see how upset I was. She is an incredible women and such an asset to the company you guys are lucky to have her. And then she wouldn't even take any money from me for the ride I was so humbled and thankful to her for her kind generosity. I will definitely stay there again next time I'm visiting Honolulu. Thank you Bev, Christiana and all the staff at White Sands you guys made my trip very memorable ❤

We arrived late at night to find that the reception area of the hotel was boarded up and no longer in existence.After trawling our suitcases across the other side of the hotel we were greeted by a miserable man at reception who was most unhelpful. Our room was on the third floor of the hotel and had no lift access. I lugged the suitcases up three flights of stairs....it’s lucky I’m young and fit!! The hotel corridors were in serious need of a face lift and the door to our room could have been broken into by an old lady in a wheelchair! The only acceptable aspect of this hotel was the interior of our room which appears to be newly refurbished. As for the outdoor spaces, the pool was merely a puddle in comparison to the images advertised online. Our balcony overlooked the parking area and main road which seemed to attract the local alcoholics and addicts. This hotel has a lot of work to do before it’s facelift is complete for “summer 2019”.

One night awaiting our flight to Molokai. This is a older property in the process of renovation. We were upgraded to one of the renovated 1 bedroom suites. Charming retro Hawaiian decor. Fairly comfortable bed-and husband VERY picky about that. Nice lanai, great AC, but no elevators. SUPERB CUSTOMER SERVICE. The best thing is the location-2 blocks from the International Market, lots of restaurant options, and the beach. Hint: walk though the IMP and you'll be at the beach. If you walk you are just walking around the block. Highly recommend you overlook some of the more negative reviews.We would definitely stay here again.

I have stayed at White Sands several times now: before and during the renovations. It is just amazing what they have done to the rooms: very tasty, comfortable and modern rooms, with a retro feel to it. Above all, the rooms are very quiet, which is unique for such a central location in Honolulu. Everything you need when it comes to shopping, food and the beach is within walking distance. If you want to go to Ala Moana shopping center, you can make use of the complementary shuttle service. The central courtyard/garden/pool adds to a very relaxing atmosphere in the bustling city, and it is nice to sit on your own terrace or balcony. On top of it all, the management, staff and reception is so friendly and helpful! Hard to get better value for money. Looking forward to staying there again after all the renovations are completed!

Amazing Central hotel within walking distance to everything we needed. 5 min to the beach & shopping and helpful staff at front desk- what they couldn’t help us with they had friends at a nearby hotel who could! Quiet considering how close to town it is! Only wish would be a kettle in the room for a cuppa in the AM

Excellent value for money, this small, tastefully re-decorated, secluded & friendly 3 storey hotel with balconies, was quiet, comfortable & clean with a great pool, free coffee in the re-located lobby ( due to renovations which weren’t a problem) & steps away from restaurants & 10 mins walk from Waikiki beach. Close to buses, trolleys & free shuttle to the Alo Moana mall. Didn’t need to use the AC as there was often a breeze especially at night & the 28 steps to 3rd floor weren’t a problem ( no elevator & outdoor hallways)- wifi speed excellent too.

Excellent location, newly renovated rooms with a pool and daily service to the rooms. We stayed 3 nights but would choose to stay more if time allowed. They are a no-frills hotel who help you out and leave you to it at the same time! Great check out with Christie-Ann - she’s so lovely and friendly we had a huge laugh as we were leaving! Definitely recommend even in the middle of their external renovations!

Ok so they are renovating and you have to pick your rooms, but we spent 21 days there, left for a week then returned for another five nights. Thoroughly enjoyed our time there.Room itself was ground floor (basically there are three two storey blocks surrounding garden and pool) and if you are old like me you need a ground floor room and preferably a pool view room.The staff were great. The manager couldn’t have been more helpful and the lady we booked the room called Christianne , was so friendly we would not mind getting to know her better.She gave us a really good rate and better than the agencies.When renovations are complete it will be a smashing hotel. I just hope the price does not go up much (god Waikiki is expensive)The position is terrific. Just off Kuhio it’s about 100 metres to the international marketplace shopping centre (beautiful but pricey) and if you travel around by bus as we did then you can pretty well get around anywhere. The stops are about 150 metres away going in either direction. Also the hotel is part of a group that runs a free shuttle to the beautiful Ala Moana shopping mall.The hotel pool is definitely swimmable but not huge. We used it frequently.

Hotel is awesome. People are great. Location is 4 minutes to Waikiki beach on walk. Go here, save money and be happy. Housekeepers are nice. Ok. If you've got any needs to be pampered by stupid things like a marble front desk. Yes they have it. Don't need it. Are under remodel. But people hold it down. Go there.

I’m disappointed for me the price quality is not good. That’s expensive for what it is. A lot of noise because of the renovation. You can hear your neighbors like you were in there room. The key of my room didn’t work 3 times, I needed all the time to go in the reception. I advice against this hotel.

Although this is a small basic hotel, the service was really outstanding, responsible and friendly. Loved the front desk staff! It is currently under construction but the hotel posted signs ahead of time about water turn-off times, etc. so we had plenty of warning. Unless you stay in the hotel the whole day, it is not a problem. The best thing about this place was the location: it is in the heart of everything! Across the street from International Market (a big mall), ABC convenient stores and around the corner from the super popular Marukame Udon restaurants and tons more. There is also a tourism office across the street where we booked our day tours. It is only 15 minute walk to the beaches. I would definitely stay here again!

This hotel definitely exceeded my expectations. Clean, quiet, friendly staff and great location to many attractions and to Waikiki beach. 5 min drive to great hiking spot Diamond head. Tons of restaurants close by including the International Marketplace that has a lot of options. Best location for everything and it also has a convenient little lot for parking which you have to pay for but is cheaper then anywhere else. Christieann was a great staff member who was very helpful and sweetest person. She made fresh coffe every morning for us and would personally follow up how our vacation was going and if she can help us with anything. She would call my parents mama and papa. I absolutely loved her and she played a great role in my good experience. Will refer this place to all my friends and family and I would certainly return here. Thank you so much !!!!!!

The hotel is currently renovated. All the rooms are ready to accommodate travelers. The pool is clean and nice. The rooms are quiet and it is very close to beach. It will be a very nice hotel when it will be finished. For the room, we have requested a king size and we got a double bed. The kitchen is new but empty. You need to wait 2 mins to get the hot water in the bathroom but they are very small details for the price paid. We recommend this hotel.

Great value, highly recommend! Really clean, roomy, and good location. Staff were all welcoming, friendly & helpful. Kitchenette has microwave & fridge but no plates, cups or cutlery so have to allow for this if wanting to eat in. Possibly this will change once renovations are completed (?) but reno's were no issue for us. A pleasant basic 'no frills' room for a very fair price, we would definitely stay there again.

We arrived late to this hotel and were frustrated and disappointed to find out it was under construction! After our first night in a room that had a few shortcomings, we were moved the next day to a renovated room which was better. We understand the need for renovating older hotels, so we stayed with an open mind. Two huge positives were the location, which is a short walk from both the International Market and Waikiki Beach, and secondly , all of the staff to a person were extremely nice and accommodating. Price was reasonable and beds were comfortable. We learned that even some of the staff had similar frustrations due to the construction. Staff indicated that renovations should be done Summer of 2019.

Stayed here beginnig of march. Room nice. Staff nice. But hotel in middle of renovations. Not warned of this and paid too much for the noise of drilling and water turned off ect. They were digging up the floor in next room. Not going to be finished until May.

My wife and I travel the world full time, and we always look for hotels that feel more like apartments than hotels, and White Sands definitely fits the bill. The rooms are decorated really tastefully with custom fabric print headboards and very comfortable beds. The furniture is so comfortable and higher quality compared to what you find in many hotels in the area. The quality of the rooms and the friendliness of the amazing staff make the White Sands one of the best hotels in Honolulu, especially at this price. You will not find a better deal for such a great location and higher quality finishes. And you definitely will not find staff this friendly at any other hotel. As someone who spends a lot of time in hotels all over the world, I can say the White Sands is absolutely top notch.

When we booked the hotel the website advised renovations finished end of January, end of feb and still going. Some days noise and water being cut off all dayso if your looking for a sleep in or lazy day some days weren’t ideal. The rooms were cleaned daily and fresh towels supplied, the staff did open the door on us twice when we advised not to come in. Room amenities said room safe + coffee available, these were not in the rooms. Also no cups, plates or anything so if you are wanting food in the rooms, buy utensils. Noise is very much an issue, you can hear everything your neighbours are doing and also in the hall - we had quite a few nights where people were coming home late and you can hear everything in the hallways. The security of the building I found a bit uncomfortable, anyone from the street can walk in, walk up the stairs to access the building and walk down the hallways where all the rooms are.The beds were okay, my partner found them very uncomfortable and pillows were very very soft and the bed made a squeak with every movement. The balconies don’t get any sun so we found drying beach towels a bit difficult and the balconies are towered by other buildings so you have lots of units looking down on you, privacy is not a thing. The location is great though, so close to the international market place so easy to get everywhere and lots of food options. The location is easy to get around and bus stops are close by too so overall it was comfortable to stay

Friendly manager and staff. We enjoyed our stay here at the white Sands Hotel. Clean rooms and the service was excellent. I would definitely recommend this hotel if you are visiting Honolulu Hawaii. They truly have the Aloha spirit

The hotel staff is incredibly friendly and go out of their way to make your stay comfortable. The location is amazing, just a few blocks from the beach, shopping and tons of great food. The room itself was perfect! Our room was recently renovated, and very clean, quiet and comfortable. There is free wifi in the room contrary to older reviews. There is also a parking lot located right in front of the hotel where you can get $18 per day parking, which is the cheapest we found during our stay though, the lot is not affiliated with the hotel. Overall an excellent experience!!

I'd just like to say I had a great stay with the white sands Hotel! Awesome service from the friendly staff at the front desk, always had a smile and were more then willing to help with anything we needed! On top of that, the room was really cosy and hospitable, really like the set up of the place - would be more then happy to stay there again :)

White Sands Hotel is situated only 10-min from Waikiki Beach (it's faster if go through International Market Place). Close to ABC shops, Food Pantry Shop, Marukame Udon Noodle and bus stop. No restaurant facility on site but there are plenty of restaurants nearby.Hotel is situated between high apartment buildings thus even if it's windy, you can't say. When we were staying at the hotel, it's under a refurbishment: the garden looks like big working place, the welcome desk and entrance were moved. We knew about it beforehand and it was no problem at all. What was more important we had really nice room, equipped with fridge so if you want to buy fresh fruit it's easy to store them. There was a free wifi at the time when we stayed.All the staff - receptionists, room cleaners are excellent: always greet you with "Aloha" and they are happy to help you (we're changing the room and it wasn't a problem at all).Highly recommended if you are not "all inclusive hotel" person.

It will be a great place to stay when the remodel is done in the summer. The rooms are nice and comfortable. Small and charming property. If you don't want to haul your luggage up the stairs you might want to request a room on the first floor. The staff is very friendly. The pool was a little chilly but it might have been due to the remodel. Great location a couple of blocks from the beach. Just walk through the International Market Place on your way. Reasonable rates. Hopefully they stay reasonable after the remodel.

I stayed here for 4 nights and it was great. Clean rooms and friendly staff. Even with the construction going on the staff was very accommodating. Always giving us ideas of good things to do while there. Great location to good food around

When we initially arrived to hotel they did not have the room available that we had paid/reserved, after moving a couple people around eventually they placed my wife and I into a room with one small double bed. There was two occasions during our stay that members of the staff (not even housekeeping) walked into our room without knocking thinking it was empty. The AC didn't work, cable didn't work, and internet didn't work. Also, there was a strange leaking sound coming from the ceiling. Be aware there is construction currently taking place on the property. Also, saw a couple cockroaches near the lobby and pool area. Stay away from this place.

We are Waikiki short term rental owners and we booked this hotel when our property was occupied. This was our first stay at this hotel. Location is great, personnel is accommodating and renovated rooms are very nice. Surprisingly location is very quiet during the night, which is rare for Waikiki. Currently the building is under renovations, but it did not bother us as it was only weekdays and during regular work hours, when we were away anyways. Excellent value. Definitely will go back there again. Thanks for the great stay Douglas & Marianne

If you book a room here make sure you pack a hard hat, ear plugs and orange safety vest. This hotel is under a major renovation and is filled with construction materials. The front reservation entrance is boarded up and no guest parking available on site.Booked 8 months ago for a seven night stay at a set price and guaranteed a newly remodeled room. Instead we were given same room as last year for 2 nights only as demolition was scheduled. Our view included an empty koi pond, gaping hole with plumbing for unfinished jacuzzi, and orange backhoe and rubble. Received an email 5 days before our stay with no mention of the construction. No communication from management and biggest insult was paying a resort fee for this mess! Left after one night. Welcome to Paradise.

We were 3 couples who checked in late and given 3 rooms that were worn and outdated+++ and lack of detailed cleanness. All 3 rooms lacked adequate kitchenette items. We should have asked for alternate rooms or facility but were concerned that we could be sent packing. The room did have comfortable beds, hot shower, and working air conditioner.

This place is under construction! Booking .com stated construction would be finished by the time we would arrive,not so apparently January is the completion date,but by the look of things I would say months after that,so we get a newly renovated room it says kitchenette I’m sure kitchenette means different things in different countries but come on,this place had no kitchen sink,no glasses,no cutlery what so ever,no milk,no sugar,uncomfortable beds in my opinion,fitted sheets which did not fit!,something sharp in the carpet! Shower took 10 minutes to get hot,no exaggeration!,brand new paint on deck getting scraped by deck chairs,even after 40 years for a renovation it is done super budget,ok so the room did have a nice bathroom some small toiletries,small fridge,microwave,new carpet and wall coverings,pool was good among construction site! Staff were polite,location good very central in Waikiki,I recommend spend more stay else where :)

This hotel is in the perfect location! It's walking distance from several tourist attractions and 2 blocks from Waikiki beach. The staff is amazing and very accommodating.I will definitely stay here again.

Do not be fooled by the ads on the booking website. There are major renovations being done on the hotel at the moment which I understand would cause some disruption however this is not mentioned in the ads or in the confirmation email.We arrived at the main entrance only to find out you had to walk around the block to get in via the rear entrance, Wifi is only available in the reception area, no tea, coffee or milk in the room, had to go down stairs to get more towels as not enough in the room, no lift and to top it off cockroaches in the reception area. Luckily we were only there one night,

Great staff, polite and accommodating. It is a shame that it is a deplorable property. It is filthy. I am attaching some of the pictures I took. I am only posting the mild pictures. The room was disgusting - filthy duvets, curtains, doors, fixtures, furniture . . . everything was dirty, with stains, broken, or with holes. AC had big holes, making it super easy for rodents and insects to come in. We were disgusted just to be in the room. The white color on doors and cabinets had vanished and turned into dark grey to charcoal color due to decades of dirt layering in. I got a refund and checked out. I have a question for the management: “Why would you want to sell a room like the one that I was assigned for $150 plus tax and resort fee? If you and your family would not stay in that filth, why make another family endure it?

For our trip to Hawaii we wanted an amazing pool, an amazing location, and we couldn't really care less about the rooms. We didn't want to spend much money, and White Sands delivered in every way. The room was super modest, not very stylish, but very clean. Loved having the kitchenette! The pool was BANANAS. The dude who cleans it is super passionate about his job and it shows. And it's beautiful, surrounded by gorgeous old tropical trees and plants. The location blocks from the beach and world class shopping could not be beat. I hope the pending renovation does not mean it will be unaffordable in the future because I would love to stay here again. Highly recommend!

The hotel is located very central with kust a couple of minutes walk to most shops, restaurants and the beach. The rooms were alright, very old interior, a very loud but effective AC unit, and not much isolation for sounds from the corridor and other rooms.The staff were very friendly and helpful. The WiFi didnt really reach our room on the second floor. Big minus.

My wife and I recently stayed at this central Waikiki Motel and although initially unsure we were genuinely surprised with how good our stay was.The entire staff including reception, maintenance and cleaning were great. The accommodation, although dated, was very serviceable. In fact we slept solidly every night in comfortable beds with very little noise from outside.We stayed for a week and noticed the extensive renovations that are under way and would possibly consider returning to see what the flash new rooms look like.

Yes this hotel is in need of renovation - but that has started and once completed I am sure the room rates will rise. However for now this is a very affordable comfortable hotel located right in the heart of Waikiki. The two rooms we stayed in (5 weeks apart) had everything that we needed (microwave, fridge and cooker) The bathrooms were fine and the pool is wonderful after the heat of the day. Yes it would be nice if there was free WiFI in your room but at least it is available near reception if you need it. The staff couldn't have been more helpful and I would happily recommend it to anyone wanting somewhere affordable to rest their head at night.

This place is awful, there are roaches crawling on the walls, internet does not work as well as the shower and they don’t even provide you with large size towels. The rooms are run down. Overall the worst hotel experience of my life!

As a budget traveler, I'm used to dated rooms, but this one really was in bad shape. It had multiple dark stains in the shape of an iron on the carpet, the bathroom vanity was missing doors on the bottom, the bathroom smelled of bleach, the room itself smelled musty, and the shower looked iffy enough that I wore flip-flops into it. To top things off, there was Wi-Fi only in common areas. Seriously? In 2018, no Wi-Fi in the room? Ugh.Normally I'd say you get what you pay for, but with tax we paid a good $200 for this place!The location was okay -- walking distance from Waikiki Beach and the Ala Wai Canal, with plenty of restaurants and shops nearby. And we appreciated the hotel's flexibility when we needed a late check-out.Budget spots in Waikiki seem hard to come by, but there must be better options.

I needed a place to stay while waiting on an apartment. This was the least expensive. The staff were friendly and helpful. It's located in Waikiki and a quick walk to the beach. The hotel is worn and could use some updates! I killed three roaches over the few days that I was there. There is no parking at the hotel, but you can unload. They will give you parking options.

We stayed here for three nights from 23 to 26 May 2018. Very Good location. No breakfast or restaurant in the hotel. Plenty of small / big eateries, grocery shops, malls & beach very close by. It’s a three storied building surrounded by skyscrapers all around. It has a small swimming pool with trees around. When one sits in the balcony (Our room was facing pool), one has a feeling of being in oasis in a desert.Rooms are slightly on the smaller side. Toiletries generally ok. Micro, cooking range etc available. Cutlery & crockery not of good standard. One day’s rent is deducted on booking as a deposit.Hotel does not have a lift (not given in the website). However, luggage were taken up to our second floor room by the staff. The corridor was stinking. Most of the gadgets in our room were dysfunctional. It took more than 24 hrs for all to come in line. However, I was given a financial compensation for the same (I asked for it). Hotel was planned to go for renovation. But that doesn’t mean that there should be stink or the gadgets would not work.Two of the front desk staff (both male) were impolite & also not helpful. In fact one did not intimate me an important message (about discount) for about 24 hrs. When asked, he started giving lame excuses. Also he totally forgot to intimate the staff that I would pay the bills in cash & not by credit card. This caused a little confusion at check out time, but resolved.The ladies in the front desk were helpful.Being a part of the Aqua group, this hotel had many free / concessions from many shops around. This was not told to guests. They just kept a small notice on the front desk. Accordingly we missed many such facilities. It is in the hotel’s interest & for their publicity that they should intimate the guests.All airport shuttle service providers touch this hotel for pick up & drop. WiFi is just in the lobby & not inside the room.Hotel has a luggage room where they keep luggage.Besides all these problems which I am sure are getting looked into during renovation, we shall stay here if we again visit Honolulu just for two reasons… great location and the joy one gets just being in an oasis amongst the skyscrapers

This hotel was perfect for me, non-glitzy, reasonably priced, very clean, a bit dated but well maintained, good shower stall with a line to dry things on, convenient location in Waikiki, quiet. Staff all friendly and helpful, both the front desk and housekeeping.  Bedding was good, a bit firm for me personally (sleep # 30). It's basically a U-shape with a courtyard in the middle with a pool, hot tub, koi pond, and beautiful landscaping. Surrounded by a solid wall so the only entry is the walkway by the front desk. 3 floors, no elevator, but multiple times, staff members offered to carry stuff up the stairs for me. Parking on site at standard Waikiki rates. (Spaces, also like many Waikiki places, are tiny!) Room 302 had a lanai looking onto the courtyard - I loved it!. I was even with tops of some trees which provided partial privacy from other lanais. Looking up, I saw high rises partly blocked by higher trees. Rooms on the outside of the U seem to face the privacy wall or, on upper floors, a parking garage. This room had a kitchenette with small fridge, microwave, coffee maker, and electric range. It was basically but decently stocked with dishes, flatware, a good knife, corkscrew, can opener, dish soap and drainer, and a few other basic utensils - everything I needed. I had to move the coffee maker to find a plug (or unplug the microwave) - not a problem for me. Coffee and fixings replenished every day. This room had a connecting door to the next with absolutely no soundproofing. When I mentioned that at the desk, they immediately offered to move me to a non-connecting room. I found that keeping my air conditioner running (set it to fan) was enough white noise to drown out most of the noise from the connecting room.

It was ok value and an ok ambiance cause we are a young hip family but I wouldn’t recommend for older couples looking for tranquillity.... no internet in the rooms so forced to sit in the lobby on your device when needed.... social experiment possibly?? Has a pool and rooms ok.

Good location is all, that is good in this hotel.Hotel is very outdated and dirty. AC was not working in the first room we got. In second room it was very loud and barely cooling. After looking into it I found out, that air filler was not cleaned for years, probably. Washing filter helped a little with cooling, but noise remain terrible. Mattress was OK, but because of AC noise sleep quality was not good at all.Parking space is very limited, but you can use parking at nearby hotel.They do clean rooms, but carpet is so old, that it does not help much.Stay somewhere else, if you can.

The room itself was nicer than I expected given the price for this location. I was very happy with my stay. The staff were very accommodating and helpful. White Sands is a 5 Star 3-Star-hotel, if that makes sense. Easy walk to the beach, which you can see from google maps.

Bit of a disappoint. We were first placed on the 3rd floor and when there is no elevator is quite a mission, not sure what happens when it rains as lack of cover as the stairs are external.Our room 330 was not very pleasant, the vent in the bathroom looked like it have never been cleaned, the cupboard doors in the kitchenette were either nearly falling off or were in a sad state of disrepair. The dining tabletop was a disgrace with various bits roughly hand painted.It did have a nice balconyI managed to negotiate a move to the bottom floor for the last 4 days but no electric jug was available and we got a toaster after some pleading.This room was a least cleaner although the cockroaches may have differed. You couldnt open the curtains as a lack of filter curtains meant no privacy at all in the room.On the good side the location was handy to lots of facilities and the eating places were near bye . The pink line trolley bus was just around the corner.Also David behind the counter was very pleasant and helpful
user_name:
Bruce M
Napier, Hawke's Bay, New Zealand

review_body: Hotel is in walking distance from the Waikiki beach. Around hotel is lot shopping possibilities. WiFi available in lobby only. There is no elevator, so you have to carry your luggage by your own (or your boyfriend) ;)You can refresh yourself in hotel pool. We enjoyed coffee in the morning in our balcony (coffee machine in room, complimentary cooffe refilled everyday).I would like to highlight staff at the front desk, which was very friendly and helpful.Mahalo.

This little gem Is about a half a block away from the hustle and bustle of Kuhio in downtown Honolulu. Three or four blocks from the beach, plentiful dining attractions all around, less than one block from the international market center. The lowrise three-story building is a bit dated, although they are planning renovations for summer of 2018. No elevator, so second and third floors guests must use stairs. The staff at the front desk and throughout the hotel are very polite, and accommodating, which is why this hotel deserves five stars. If our rating was simply based on the hotel building itself I would’ve rated about four stars but the wonderful staff puts it over the top. We stayed there for eight nights, enjoyed the pool, the tropical vegetation, and even the hot tub. I most likely would stay there again, even throughout any construction or renovation… This is a small hotel that works to accommodate you like a large one. Great for families on a budget, or just a quiet place to relax in the evening.

This place definitely needs upgrades- which they are planning on in May 2018. The staff here is so accommodating and excellent service! I would definitely come back just for that. The pool is pretty nice too. Definitely a place you could bring kids.

We stayed at this hotel as a beginning to move to Oahu. We were refugees of Hurricane Irma in the Virgin Islands and were trying to find housing in the area. This hotel needs a lot of work. The rooms are in disrepair and the carpets are filthy. However the staff does their best with what they have. Our first room was unacceptable and we told Doug at the front desk. He is one of the nicest, warmest and friendliest people we have ever met! He upgraded us to a larger room with a bigger refrigerator knowing the situation we were in. David and Katheryn were also very sweet and helpful. Doug's attitude and compassion allowed us to stay at the white sands a few extra days until we found an apartment. When this hotel completes the renovations I would strongly advise staying with them! They are let friendly and it is surprisingly quiet and peaceful. But take out those rugs!!! Thank you to the staff for helping us out. They will never know how much it helped!

First impression when greeted by front desk David... WOW. Friendly and most welcoming to arrive at the White Sands Hotel. Location is so quiet and close to the hub of supermarket , ABC stores, shopping and the beach. The room was spacious and clean. Older style hotel without the noise of too many guests surrounding your privacy. I believe this hotel has the best staff in Waikiki and Doug the Manager should be so proud if his teamMahalo White Sands Hotel. See you again soon!!!

On our return trip from LA to Australia we had a 3day stop over at the white sands hotel. We both found the hotel is very central to the main strip,walking distance to all shops and beach,hotel was neat with pool,rooms had aircon,safe,coffee machine.It’s a no frills quaint hotel,staff will help you,rooms are clean we will definitely stay here again ,for the price and location it’s a winner.

Beatiful hotel. Near EVERYTHING. Just two blocks from the Waikiki Beach, one block from all the malls and shopping centres. We got a room with kitchenette, so really helpful to press down the budget. We can cook there, reheat our meal there, so great.They also have a dvd rental (for free - included in the room), with a great deal of movies (and PS3 games as well). The check in and check out is really easy. The receptions are very friendly, they always greeted us.No Wifi in the room but there's a very good wifi in common areas. But there is one issue (and hasn't been resolved yet until I wrote this review). My credit card is charged for unknown expenses from this hotel. I've called the hotel and they say they will respond in 2 business days. Let's see how they manage this issue. Will give 5 stars if the issue resolve thou.

This hotel located center of Waikiki. Walking distance to go beach, shopping and restaurants. Good for people who wants to save money but convince. Staffs are friendly and nice. Many good points.I just didn’t like this building. Very old. A lots of ants in the room. A closet in the bathroom. I was happy just stayed there one night.
user_name:
Natsuko17
New York City, New York

review_body: Simple and beautiful hotel, Just a short walk to the main street of Waikiki. The room with kitchenette was big enough for us and it had a balcony with an amazing pool view. Its important to say that the internet only works at the hotel lobby. If we come back to waikiki, we will stay in this hotel again

Best spot, nice service from the staff made us feel welcome. Near to everything and nice rooms as well. We are going back there in december if there is any rooms available, which I hope because this time we bring all of the family with us.

My father and I recently just stayed for 10 nights and we enjoyed the quiet getaway from busy wiki. Its an older hotel, but has everything you require! The hotel staff are really nice and helpful if you needs anything. The hotel room we got was a two bed kitchenette, which worked fine for us, kitchen is a little small but no big deal. The rooms are out dated, but your in Hawaii, you wont be spending much time in doors and the beds were super comfortable and everything was very clean. Patio was really nice, we had our morning coffee each day. The BEST part of this hotel is the courtyard in the middle, it has trees and flowers everywhere as well the Coy pond, pool, lounge chairs and Hot Tub. The hot tub is a perk for night time after a long day, and each day we would end up at the Pool for a wind down before dinner. The hotel is situated on a quiet street but your a few steps away from many many bars and restaurants. The Coffee Shop 893 across the street is amazing for breakfast and coffee. Across the street as well is an Enterprise in case you wish to book a vehicle. Approx cab fair from the Airport was $35 American, plus tip. Two blocks away is the food pantry for all your grocery needs, and Dukes is 1 block down which has precooked meals for you to take. You approx 5 blocks from the beach, so less then 10min walk. The only downside is the wifi is not great in the hotel rooms, you do have to go to the lobby or pool desk for service.

The hotel is cheap a bit old but i enjoyed my stay. Depends if your fussy or not, if you would enjoy staying there. The staff are friendly Katherine on the the front desk was awesome, friendly and very helpful. Thanks heaps.

This was our 4th time staying at this hotel. We feel at home here. Douglas and Kathryn at the front desk were great and helpful. We have been advised that this hotel will be undergoing renovations this year and that kitchen amenities may become limited. In our opinion this would take away from the charm of this hotel.We truly hope they keep the best of what they have now, as we really enjoy staying here.

Awesome hotel, Awesome employees, Awesome housekeeping, Awesome maintenance. Clean room. Our fridge stopped working and was replaced quickly... bigger coffee makers would be nice. AC is noisy but it does the job. WIFI in the lobby or around the pool..

We visited this hotel almost everyday during our recent two week trip to Hawaii. It's a budget hotel located on a side street of the Kuhio Ave. The location doesn't seem that pleasant at night but is fine during the day. The room that I visited was old but relatively clean and large. The AC was functional and the mattress was decent. The kitchenette was nice and we made full use of it.The housekeeping service was unexpectedly disappointing. After a incident with them, we complained to the front desk and they took care of it quickly.

This is a sturdy older small hotel just a couple of blocks from the beach. It has a small outdoor pool with a nice courtyard. The hallways are a bit raggedy but the rooms are quite comfy and nice. Beds and bathrooms are fine. There is a small kitchenette with fridge, some dishes and there is a small safe. No lift but there are some ground floor rooms. Tiny parking lot which costs $25 per day extra, or you can park on the street where meters run till 6 PM. The staff is great and Jewels, in particular, was very helpful. WiFi only in the very small lobby. Very near all the businesses and restaurants. Great value .

* IF YOU NEED WIFI, DON’T STAY HERE *Rates are very low here, but you get what you pay for. We stayed at the White Sands for under an hour, and decided to get a refund and change hotels. The room was pretty dumpy, it didn’t feel like the safest place, and our room did not look anything like the photos on the website. However, our main issue was the wifi. Before booking, I’d read mixed Tripadvisor reviews about the wifi here, so – twice – I utilized the online chat feature on the White Sands website to ask whether there was in-room wifi. Both times, I was told there was. Unfortunately, this was false advertising and when we got to the White Sands, there was no in-room wifi. It’s only accessible from the pool or lobby area, which is not ideal if you need to frequently use the wifi, or want to use it late at night. Other Tripadvisor reviews mentioned that you could access the pool wifi from your pool-facing balcony – we could not. Fortunately, we were able to receive a refund with no issues. This hotel is fine if you need to stay one or two nights on a budget, or don’t need to use wifi. We ended up staying at the Ilima Hotel next door, and were happy to pay a couple hundred dollars more in order to stay in a much better hotel, with wifi. I would not stay at the White Sands again nor recommend it.

This was a good hotel for those on a budget. We were upgraded to a "Suite" that had a condom wrapper still on the floor of one of the rooms, A crushed Cigarette Butt on one of the seat cushions, dust everywhere and scuffs on almost every wall. The place needed a paint job and a all around renovation in order to stay current. It was not the worst place I stayed, however not so much what I expected in a hotel, more of what a private room hostel would be.

We stayed just overnight since the plane left early in the morning. Place is clean, well equipped with kitchen and coffeemaker. Beds ok, clean towels, in the middle of Waikiki. Good pool and friendly staff. Recommendable

Hotel itself is clean and an absolute bargain money wise. We landed at 6 and check in is not until 3 which was fustrating, however staff booked us in around 1 if I remover correctly.Hotel offers free movie rentals and wifi in lobby area which was a nice perk. Pool is small but well maintained, the spa is boiling but no jets were working, Staff always very friendly and happy to help. There is a night security guard from 10-6 which is reassuring. Rooms are clean a little dated but for the price you cannot complain. Air con sounds like a rocket taking off every few minutes so you could have it on and be nice and cool but not sleep or have it off and sweat!! Cute little hotel I would recommend.

Great little gem in the heart of downtown Honolulu. The staff are very good with your needs. The pool is refreshing. Would use again as it is close to coffee shops restaurants and of.couse Waikiki Beach.

This hotel is centrally located, clean and well-equipped, with a kitchenette and comfortable bed. It's not luxurious, but for the rate, it's a great value.The POSITIVES:-Convenient to the main action of Waikiki-Literally just 3 minutes on foot to International Market Place-Kitchenette with fridge, coffee maker, dishes & cutlery -Modestly-sized swimming pool and Jacuzzi; beach towels provided at reception-Laundromat on the property-Quiet at night-Very friendly and helpful housekeeping staff & reception-Many cable channels-Nice balcony overlooking the pool-Phone in the room, with free local calls-Electronic lock-box in room-Ironing board and iron-Plenty of storageThe NEGATIVES:-No wifi in the room (which was a surprise)-The air-conditioner was loud, emitting a roaring sound-No guide to TV channels-Housekeeping did not wash our dishes each day

My boyfriend and myself stayed at this hotel for 7 nights and had a wonderful experience. The rooms are very spacious and you can rent DVDs and games for free. There is a decent sized pool and jacuzzi which made our stay even better. The beach is a short walk away and there are many shops and restaurants within walking distance. Overall a perfect stay.

Before I chose to book @ White Sands I read some of the reviews, I was very skeptical about making this my final decision. But I'm glad I did, there's too many things to do in Hawaii to stay inside the room. The room was clean, house keeping stayed on top of cleaning and the location is great. Majority of things are in walking distance. Hawaii is just beautiful and free. I will be back withing two years.

Normally this is the kind of place I walk out of, but it really grew on me. Everything previous reviews said is true, the good and the bad. The room interior was in bad need of cosmetic updating, but the bed was very comfortable and the lanai was great place to hang out with coffee or wine. I talked to the front desk about the rooms need of cosmetic updating and I was told they are planning to renovate the rooms in 2018. I had a third floor room over the pool, which was surprisingly great. It was always quiet even when people were in the pool. I used pool which was clean and secluded from Hawaii crowd.
