I had it to myself one afternoon even though the hotel was full. Great location the staff keep the grounds very clean. The front desk was always nice. I would absolutely stay there again, it felt like home by the time I left.

We have stayed here every time we visit Oahu. The staff is always friendly and helpful. The rooms are clean and comfortable. Home away from Home. Location is perfect. One street from Waikiki Beach. Everything is within walking distance. We loved every minute of it. Can't wait until 2020.

What a great little hidden gem, within walking distance to the beach and all your shops and restaurants. Yes it is a little dated but very clean and the staff is super friendly. I would definitely recommend staying here. I just want to take a minute to thank Heather and save the best for last KEALA, you were so amazing!!!!We hate that we didn't get to tell you bye in person. Thank you for being so fabulous!!!!!❤️KEALA,we give you ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

The hotel is very well located, in the middle of Waikiki! Walking distance to beach, shops and restaurants. The staff was very kind! And the room is ok. Clean, spacious and a very comfortable bed! It is a very good value for money. I recommend!

Good: just around a ten-minute walk to the beach; only a block away from the bus stop, several restaurants and shops; they offer a free shuttle to Ala Moana mall; they have a pool if you don't feel like swimming in the beach; they offer free DVD rentals; and the staff are extremely kind and helpfulBad: the rooms are really old and run down--it sometimes smelled like dog pee; air-conditioner pretty loud in the room; the hallways have been sprayed with a really strong sweet scent to cover the mustiness; there is no wifi in the rooms that are far away from the common area

Great little (inexpensive) place for Kauai prices for a stop over until we could get into our Resort up in Princeville to stay with a beautiful view of the Ocean and walking in the sand.Lava Lava Bar for drinks and food onsite, decorated with colorful surfboards the waiters and bartenders were friendly and walking distance to a little shopping area for Coffee, ABC Store, Clothing and other resturants.

stayed here in April, staff was very friendly. room was clean, no bugs. only wifi in lobby or around the pool. No elevators limited parking. coffee maker toaster microwave and a few cooking supplies available in the room. dvd rental is available in the hotel. vending machines also available.

NO COCKROACHES! We stayed here for 8 nights and didn't spot one little beasty of any decription at all..We had lunch in the garden with a Brazilian Cardinal though..Don't be fooled this is a Budget hotel,but it's got a good front desk staff & atmosphere..A Tropical Internal garden surrounds the pool and offers a bit of privacy to poolside rooms,and the shadow past your room in the nite or at pool is the Security Guard on duty..Bed was comfy,good bathroom with quick laundry & ice handy..Street Noise was mimimal and Air Con not a problem as i set it @ Vent/econ/20c/Lo/Sleep..We had a Kitchenette as market only 5min walk away(food pantry).Hot plate a little slow to boil so i suggest you run water thru coffee filter on empty for hot water for a quick cup of tea..You are really in a good central location here and though only 3 floors,money saved here can be used elsewhere?Surveyors starting prep for rennovations,SO check when booking as upgrade of facilities is planned..There are NO ELEVATORS..

Four of us stayed for 2 nights before our cruise. 1 room was not ready til 4.45pm. Check in was 3pm. Rooms were OK. Bathroom was very old & rough. Bed was comfortable. The Staff were the highlight of this motel. All were very nice. You get what you pay for. It was cheap, it did us for 2 nights.

The hotel is in a good location and has a pool and jacuzzi. Also they are pet friendly with a fee. The staff is very nice but the rooms are terrible!! The throw pillows were filthy and hole in the walls had been patched but not painted. Mold in the shower and carpets were filthy. I made it one night then had to checkout!!

This hotel is in great location and very centrally located, close to shops and restaurants and only about 6-7 min walk to Waikiki Beach.The staff are are very friendly but the room we had (and I'm pretty sure it is representative of them all) was really pretty dirty, the stove top especially around he switches was caked in old cooking grime, I didn't feel comfortable using the plates or cups until we had washed them the shower seemed very dirty and the taps had what felt liked caked on soap buildup, personally I'm not in favour of shower curtains and this one did nothing to change my mind.The photos represented on the booking site reflected the room but it looked cleaner and more modern than it actually was. In this day and age I would expect wifi in my room and not have to go to the lobby and pool area to access it. We had a street side room and were woken daily by rubbish trucks emptying bins around 4am. The aircon was very noisy and couldn't be left on overnight. Over all I felt it was expensive for what it was and will not be re-booking there

This is not even worthy of 1 star. It was in a sketchy part of town, a bar right next door where the language was only swear words, it smelled like vomit. The the rooms were old, dirty and hot. Our shuttle driver asked us if we picked this hotel? We said no it was part of a package and he said that makes sense because you wouldn't pick this place. We were there with 11 other people and all of the rooms were like this.

The hotel craves for refurbishing! we had to switch the room because the first was very smelly (probably former smoking room). The wifi is available in lobby only. Parking is convenient and for good price. it is definitely a budget hotel, with very friendly staff and kitchen amenities.

This is a two star hotel. It is good value for the money. I got a senior discount on the Internet and the rate was $125 with all taxes for a room with a kitchenette. That alone was worth $20 per person per night. This is an Aqua run property so the things they could control - like the really comfortable bed with crisp clean sheets, and the friendly staff and the kitch Old Hawaii decor of the entrance were all there. What they could not control made the place budget. Old building. Wifi was in the lobby only. No elevator. But it did have a small useable pool surrounded by a some thin trunked 4 story tall palm trees. It was we'll run and had a good vibe.

This hotel looked great in the pictures. We were unpleasantly surprised when we got here. It is old and needs maintenance. Also, there are quite a few shady characters hanging around the street in front and coming and going from the backside of the complex. On the plus side, it had everything we needed and everything in our room worked for the most part (except the safe). I hardly ever give out poor reviews but this one is an exception.

So contrary to the date I indicated, I actually came here in 2015 on a school trip. The stay was amazing, forgo a view and fancy necessities we didn't need and it was great, use of the pool and spa were great and it was close enough to everything that it wasn't a struggle, but far enough so that it wasn't too noisy. The staff were amazing considering they were dealing with a group of about 25 teenage girls, would edinatekt stay here again!

Loved our stay of one full week! Service is amazing! You need help with a lamp or using DVD player-- immediate help!!! Pool and hot tub open til 10 PM. Loved how we could walk up outdoor steps back to room from pool instead of slopping water inside a fancy elevator only to find couples all in tuxes ready for dinner! Beautiful outside. Your pool area is like a tropical jungle. Rooms are good enough. Clean. Price is great!!!! We will return in a heartbeat!!!! We did not rent a car and saved a bundle!! Close to beach and restaurants ! Save money ! Do Hawaii right! No rental car is needed. Shuttle anywhere cheap!! Walk everywhere free!!!!

bathroom tap dripped constantly, faulty light switch in kitchen, hair blower did not work, glass door lock broken had to use a stick to jam door shut, we got one serviette, one sugar, one creamer package for 2 of us, very seldom got soap, shampoo or moisturizer. sheets were too small for bed and bottom could not be tucked in. cupboards were particle board, small holey torn towels, mold in bathroom, dirty carpet. fridge door rusty, I had to defrost freezer, seldom got dishcloth or dishtowel. kitchen counter top looked like paint over metal, it had peeled off showing rust. kitchen chair had hole in it and fraying. $50 fine for putting your thread bare beach towel on chair on deck, we liked the desk clerks, no comment on our housekeeper .The list goes on & on We prepaid $C4061.54 and on checkout we were charged USA$190.54 for extra fees, like wi fi which we don't use. I should have taken a tent and slept on beach.

2nd time I've stayed at this property, purely for the fact that it's in a great location (walking distance to the main shops and Waikiki beach) it's cheap and its clean accomodation. Yes the property is old and and the rooms dated, but Ive always found the staff to be super friendly and nice and the rooms clean and tidy. The pool is great to refresh on a hot day and gets plenty of sun to relax in.Lots of little bars and convenience stores around and would recommend to couples or groups of friends looking for a cheap and cheerful hotel with great location.

Brandon did a great job checking us in we were happy with our room. AC worked. Room clean. Staff was pleasant. Short walk to the beach. 3 yr old was happy. Less $ spent on hotel = more gifts bought for family & friends:)

If you are expecting five star luxury you are looking in the wrong place. However if you are looking for a very well priced, friendly establishment White Sands is it. You feel like you are on the set of a sixties Hawaiian tv show, we have a kitchenette, plus the usual, king size bed, large fridge, medium size tv (not tiny) with a PlayStation for DVDs and music, good cupboards and bathroom. As I said the building is old but the fittings are all functional. Just a short walk (50metres) to cross a Main street then through the International Market cross another street walk through a few shops and you are either in Dukes restaurant, Cheesecake restaurant, the Outrigger Hotel and you are on Waikiki beach which has everything you could want. It's a maximum 10 minute walk from White Sands. The staff here are so polite and helpful, the ladies who maintain the rooms are also fantastic, it is truly a nice atmosphere here at White Sands we are into our fifth week here, initially only booked for four but decided to have our other two weeks here, it has a small village feel about it. We will stay here again.

Large clean and good rooms, you get what you pay for. The staff is truly world class. Nice people with the guest in focus. Would stay here again. Location of the hotel is really good, just a small walk from Waikiki beach and in a quiet area.

Friendly staff. Fast & easy booking,quiet,comfortable ,near many of shops and access to many bus lines or tours on a trolley near access to the beaches,very helpful staff that will accommodate your needs , very homely feeling didnt want to leave

we got a clean 3rd floor room. 2 beds. There was dirt in some parts of the room but I did not mind them. Only saw ants on the lanai. There are no elevators around the hotel only stairs. Our room had a oven stove top microwave and a favorite of mine a big coffee maker. Other hotels have small coffee makers. The AC was a little weak and a little loud when on high. Wifi at the pool or lobby.

We spent 1 night there and the staff was super nice, the room wasn't very nice and clean, the smell was bad...It has a kitchenette, so that's positive thing. It was OK for that night, but I wouldn't stay there again.

This hotel is very run down although the garden area is beautiful. The hotel is on leased land, so the owner has not been putting money into it. Despite that, the beds were comfortable but the air conditioning is too noisy to sleep with on. If the screen door had a lock, I would have slept with the glass door open. Ceiling fans would also be a good alternative to the air conditioner. The kitchen was quite well equipped with a full size fridge.The staff was food and especially Brandon was incredible. The rates are very low for Waikiki, so it depends if budget is your primary consideration. I was here for 4 nights. There is no elevator for the second storey.

If I could give no circles, I would. We have been here for six hours and have already killed around a dozen roaches, one about 2 1/2-3" long. My one-year-old's feet are BLACK from the disgusting carpet. The mini-fridge is rusted - hope you are up to date on tetanus shots - the pressboard of the cabinetry is falling apart. The pool is far from balanced - foggy and filmy. I refuse to let my children in it. The shower is so disgusting, I think I'll just clean up at the beach shower. I am literally sitting up not able to sleep because this place is so revolting. We are only here because every other hotel was booked his weekend. I am now going to look to find a more suitable establishment. Deplorable.

I visited here in Honolulu a few times, and this was the worst hotel. We had a big group that had cancelled the dates on us, so had to move everything around last minute. So finding a good price hotel at the last minute was extremely hard. So when I saw the price and did my homework, didn't seem too bad of a place. Though you pay for what you get.. What you get is not worth it. I had a few other places that were just a little more, should of went with them. The little bit of savings was not worth it. Tacked on a resort fee I called about when I booked, and told me it was included. The rooms smell cause so humid here. Need fans. Was near the street so had cigarette and pot smoke come in our room. They did move us which was very nice. Thank You.. The doors slammed when people go in or out, so sleeping was out of the question. So not a pleasant experience here. Wouldn't recommend it, or come back..

Stayed for three nights at the start of September 2016. Upon arrival I noticed the pool roped off. I asked about the pool and they stated it was closed for a days maintenance. I did not note much activity at the pool and noted that it was closed for the next two days and on the day of my departure. So pool closed for three days that I know of. The White Sands feature is it's pool and internal area. I stay each year and the loss of enjoyment this year means I will be looking at other properties.The staff were pleasant during the course of my stay.

Been here 3 times now nice little low rise only 3 story note no lift but someone will carry your bags up for you but they will not carry YOU , or request a ground floor room , good location ,close to international market place , buses ,short walk to beach , i must have researched most hotels in Waikiki always come back here , not 5 star maybe 3 . swimming pool , Wifi limited .

This is a fantastic hotel.It is minutes from the beautiful beach of Waikiki, Google maps makes you think it is a lot further. There is a large supermarket 2 mins away selling all you need for the self catering option and is a lot cheaper than the express supermarkets. There is loads of great restaurants around the hotel. I would highly recommend cuckoo coconuts for food and entertainment.The pool is great and really quiet. The bbq is also a great touch.The staff are happy to assist with enquires and are extremely helpful. The free movie rental service was great with so many new films available.The free alamona shuttle bus was always on time and fantastic. I highly recommend this hotel

Unexpected stay caused me to find least expensive hotel. At about $100 is was ok. I booked and thought I'd paid via Expedia but still had to pay an additional $13 "resort fee" when I checked out. Room was clean. Desk service was fine. Surrounded by taller hotels, the White Sands is like a flash back to Waikiki is the early 1960s. Remote control on tv didn't work.

A smaller style hotel with only 3 stories but tucked back off the street, so nice and quiet.The rooms are a little dated but clean and very comfortable, and great value for money.The pool area was great and being a smaller hotel it was never crowded.The free wifi was fast and easy to access.Great location,only a 5 minute walk to the beach and shops.Staff were very helpful and friendly, even letting us have a room early to freshen up after our long flight as we checked in too early

The staff were amazing and helpful and helped me find a room during the middle of RIMPAC. However, on arrival, we were scared to death. It was incredibly over priced for what we got. It isnt in the friendliest of locations, thin walls, very outdated. you need to carry your suitcases up stairs. our door opened up onto a parking lot if it werent for the railing and small shrubs between, so there was a lot of noise from that. we had to turn off the aircon as it was soooooooo loud we couldn't even sleep. Although the staff were lovely, I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone. My advice, find somewhere else unless they update the rooms and make them a little more friendly.

A little sketchy. Never had a place to park. Had to drive around for 20 minutes to park. There lot had maybe 10 spots and adjacent lot next to it had 12 spots. Room was average and no wifi. Must have been 20 people in the small lobby trying to get some wifi. If you go outside avoid the area directly outside the hotel. Good thing your only 2.5 blocks from WWaikki.

Return visitor .Happy to stay here again.It is quiet .Cozy and clean .Limited parking so get a space because it is very convenient.Just a short walk to wonderful downtown HONOLULU. Very relaxing to end your night in the jacuzzi with a glass of wine.Right BRANDON ?It is quiet and calm at night. I always got a good nights sleep .There are a lot of places to eat nearby. I really enjoyed the just opened HOLOHOLO MARKET AND CAFE. Excellent variety of food with great coffee. Stay here.Relax .You may want to come back again. I will be back on DECEMBER 23RD for another memorable CHRISTMAS and NEW YEARS. My thanks to my OHANA at the WHITE SANDS . I miss you all .See you soon !!!

I had two nights booked and as soon as I rolled up on the property, I knew it would only be one night. The place has very limited parking that they charge $25 for. There are no elevators so if you have bags, make sure they are light. There is no wifi but I was able to tether my Tmobile LTE with my computer with no problem. The air con was cold, making the room very comfortable after being in the Hawaiian sun. The area surrounding the hotel is not nice. My view from my room was of someone's shirt and tennis shoes drying on their window. This place is a step above a hostel and just below a Motel 6 but charges 5 star hotel prices.

I picked this hotel based on 3 important factors: Kitchen, Price, and Location. All matched my requirements. So let's begin with #1 location: It is well situated right around the corner from the canal in a safe neighborhood - far enough from the busy Waikiki main streets, but very close walking distance to it and the ocean. There's a lot of restaurants and markets within minutes of walking. #2 Price: I paid way less than other hotels in the area (I shopped) for the quality of the hotel - it's not a modern or a luxury place by any means. Great news! No bugs were found. It definitely needs an upgrade, but the room, bed sheets, towels were clean. There was NO weird smell upon entering as some older hotels do! #3 Kitchen: Although it was a super small area, it did have some pots & pans, plates, cups, glasses and utensils available. The refrigerator was a typical mid size one, enough to fit two days worth of food for 3 people - I cooked breakfast everyday. The sink did not have a garbage disposer and they only provided a cleaning rag not a scrubber with dish soap with limited counter space to dry your dishes in the dish rack. I have to say though the staff was truly friendly and very helpful - they help me plan my sight seeing trip for the day by bus. I had lots of questions and each time they answered them quickly and they even resolved my issue (there was a water leak from the upper unit's air conditioning on our balcony) which they fixed immediately. The water pressure in the shower was fantastic. The air conditioning worked well. And the swimming pool was clean. Some Con's: If you are a light sleeper or noise sensitive, do not get any rooms that are by the entrance (I was in room 236), because it sounds like someone trying to open your room door throughout the night. Second, they do not have screens on their patio doors, at night I was worried to keep it open fearing bugs would fly in, which is too bad, since there was a nice breeze. The Wi-Fi was not very strong, but workable. No elevators, so if your bags are heavy you'll need to lug them up the stairs. Would I stay again or recommend this place? Absolutely! If, you are on a budget trip wanting to be near the heart of Waikiki this would be a very good choice.

We booked one night in a "One bedroom with kitchen" room for a layover in Honolulu based on recommendations for a reasonable hotel nearish to the airport. When we checked in we were disappointed with the condition of the room, but we were in a hurry to drop off our bags and go, and we figured it would be fine for one night. By nine o'clock that evening, I was checking Priceline and very seriously considering paying for another hotel.Our problems included the following:1. The room was in very serious need of updating.2. Our room #133 was on the first floor at the front of the building, the only room between the lobby and the main entrance - across the hall from an ATM and the parking lot, and steps from the smoking area outside. There was no soundproofing through the flimsy door and we were kept up ALL NIGHT by noise from people outside our door - from partiers returning at 2 am, to people trying to use the ATM at 3 am, to three tour bus loads of guests:tourists standing right outside our door waiting to load between 4-7 am. I told the front desk about this and they said they can't do anything about the tour buses. Smokers talking outside all the time and the noise from the cars in the lot.3. There was a set of sliding doors to a sad little patio surrounded by concrete walls. The sliding doors wouldn't not close all of the way at the top, which meant we couldn't lock the doors and that gnats were swarming into the room. There were wooden 2x4's on the rails at the bottom to keep someone from opening the doors, but between that gap and the flimsy front door, my kids were scared to be in the room, and it honestly made me nervous, too.So, good location and I can't speak to other rooms in the hotel, but we would never stay here again based on our experience. We stayed at Ilima next door at the beginning of our trip and would recommend that instead.

Summary:This is our strongest recommendation for White Sands Hotel. We are both seasoned travelers and there is no where else we would stay except here in Oahu. We enjoyed it so much that we stayed for two weeks. We were made to feel like a part of the Ohana (family). Oh, and respect the Alohaness, listen to the staff, get their advice and leave tips in your room for the room service staff. These simple social graces will be returned in kind with great courtesy and thoughtfulness.Internet is available in your rooms if you seriously need it for work. If you brought a laptop, show it to the staff and if you are staying for a while like we did, efforts will be made to get you in room internet access, depending on availability.Parking is a hassle, but parking is a hassle everywhere in Honolulu. Highly recommend using Zipcar in Waikiki. The location is only a 15 minute walk away and you walk through the beach to get to your car. Worked really well for us. For those trying to decide if a car is needed. Yes, a drive to North Shore or Makaha is well worth the cost, at the least until the train is finished.Special Mentions:Brandon, Clifton, Blake and Leilani and every staff member!Full Review:Fifteen years ago, I moved away from Oahu to the Mainland and beyond. I thought my stay at White Sands Hotel would be bitter sweet and I predicated that I would be annoyed by the Waikiki tourist traffic that as a local you simply avoided. It’s my first trip back to the islands and mostly I wanted to show to my partner the place where I became a man and share with her a large part of my upbringing. I was really worried that this was going to be hard living in Waikiki. Well, this hotel really showed their Aloha spirit.1. Free Room Upgrade. We had the floor that we requested and were upgraded to a pool facing room. 2. Wired internet was installed to make our cloud commuting work a bit easier.3. Onsite coin laundry was clean, well maintained and very inexpensive and never crowded. The cost included DVD rentals were a great treat too and you can get them on your way back from laundry. 4. The Spa (hot tub) works perfectly. To get lots of bubbles, press the button. The wildlife and waterfall was amazing and they are real versus planted yesterday at other resorts. When birds come into your room to check things out, you know you are in a special place.5. The kitchenette worked brilliantly and saved us 40 USD a day on breakfast. Seriously, Eggs & Things Waikiki now charges 20 USD for a waffle, local boy was shocked. Various small shops for Spam Musubi and groceries were next door. Larger groceries also within a slow 10 minute walk.6. Bus 13, 2, 6, 8 stops 2 minutes walk away from hotel. Very convenient. Double check with staff for best routes to take. Hotel also kindly calls for taxis and they arrive very fast.7. Free Ala Moana Center shuttle is available and there is a website to see where the shuttles are so that you can go to the stop without waiting too long. The staff, Leilani in this case was very knowledgeable.8. As any neighborhood of distinction on Oahu there is a set of Asian restaurants. All of them are good and they are all neighbors of the Hotel.9. Dance Club, and other adult entertainment is also conveniently located near the hotel.10. Safety was taken very seriously, and the security guards were nice. One even helped to watch our groceries as we returned our Zipcar. From Partner: 11. She loved the free good quality lotion, and shampoo and conditioners and soap. We goth had long hair and so had to ask for more than the standard number. Had no problems. 12. Room was very very quiet since its on the Canal side and our room faced in to the courtyard. 13. The Air Condition worked really really well. It was loud for the first 5 mins and then it was quiet. The vents were also very clean. We only used for two really hot days. Otherwise use the windows and the lanai and let the Trade Wind do its cooling. 14. Its a slow 10 minute walk to the beach through Duke's Lane. 15. Breakfast on the Lanai is a must.16. Safety Deposit Box and Ironing kit were in good shape.

Great location, great value for the price, and an overall great place to stay. If you are a luxury traveler looking for a 5-star resort experience, this is NOT the place for you. However, if you are like me and are looking for affordable, clean, safe,and superbly located lodging with a SUPER friendly staff, this is a great option in Waikiki (and only 10-15 minutes from the beach). The great: Amazing staff; shout out to Blake and Brandon for the "Aloha Spirit"; pool and hot tub surrounded by beautiful flora and fauna (plants, trees, waterfall and pond with koi); kitchenette in room with sink, 2-burner stove top, small fridge, microwave, plates, utensils, pots/pans, coffee maker, and small breakfast table with 4 chairs. cold A/C; plenty of hot water with great water pressure; comfortable beds with three pillows each (LOVE THAT!); a lanai (patio) for enjoying morning coffee and the outside (we had a pool view and was worth the extra fee); amazing location: close to affordable dining options with many different choices, close to shopping, and close to beach (10-15 minutes to Gray's Beach/Sheraton Hotel Beach. The Good: A dresser to put away clothes which I do when I stay at a hotel for longer periods of time; a large closet with plenty of hangers to hang clothes; a safe in the room; a nice surprise--usable drawers in bathroom to store toiletries/keeping counter clean; TV with Play Station (to use as DVD player); free video rentals, part of resort fee (we watched a movie every day at the end of our day); although we were near the pool, it was never loud or annoying; don't pack soap, shampoo, and lotion, the hotel provides plenty and it worked well; plenty of outlets in every area (except for right next to the bed) but at least we had several outlets to charge phones, cameras, itouch, etc.--no fighting over outlets. They have coin operated washer and dryers (and a vending machine for laundry soap). Knowing this, pack lighter. I washed and dried (and bought two packages of soap) two loads for $7. This was very helpful after hiking and getting mud and sweat everywhere!Let's be realistic: In some ways the rooms and hotel are dated. But ask yourself, "Am I in Hawaii for a designer hotel experience or for the natural beauty?" A bit dated, but the room was spacious, clean, comfortable, and affordable. Parking is VERY limited and costs $25 per day (in addition to the daily resort fee of $10/day), but I always had parking every day without issue. I felt more relaxed knowing the car rental was safe in the hotel parking lot. The kitchen is handy but you will not be cooking gourmet meals in your room. The electric stove top runs hot and you only get one small frying pan and 1 small pot with limited cooking utensils. We stuck to eggs and sausage and milk and cereal for breakfast which saved us TONS for the week. The coffee maker was older but it worked (here's a hint: buy coffee at the Food Pantry, but either bring or buy coffee filters for a 12-cup coffee maker). There is a Food Pantry about a 7 minute walk away. It is in Waikiki so be prepared for pricey food, but still cheaper than eating out every meal. No tub, only a shower, but the shower has a hand-held shower head with multiple water flow options. Let's no forget: great water pressure with lots of hot water. Many people have complained on reviews about the "loud" A/C unit. It is a window unit and it was not very loud at all for a window unit. Trust me, I have been at hotels that had units that sounded like jets taking off. I am just thankful that the A/C unit worked and kept up nice and cool. There is no free wifi in the room, but usually got it when sitting on the lanai. But again, why are you in Hawaii? Not to play on electronic devices, but rather to explore its beauty! The Bad: I do not have any negative comments for this hotel. I loved it here and would stay here in a heartbeat. It was our oasis at the end of each busy day. I highly recommend this hotel for budget travelers who are looking for that imperfect gem that makes any travel adventure better.

Excellent location, walking distance to many attractions including Waikiki beach and on bus routes to the others. The staff are cheerful and friendly and very helpful. The rooms are clean and ours included a kitchenette. The grounds are beautiful with a pool, hot tub. Barbeque and lovely gardens which keep the city noise at bay. Very reasonable for its location in Waikiki.

Great staff, friendly and love the grounds. Rooms could us upgrades sorta outdated. Not enough parking and wifi is a must. Will tell friend about this oasis in the middle of busy Waikiki. Had a great time!

Location is very good, near ABC, stores and Waikiki beach. If you are looking for a reasonable hotel in Waikiki, maybe it's a good option. Hotel is old and there's no elevator but the room was clean! Wi-fi only in the reception and pool area!Reception staff are very friendly!!

We were very impressed with the excellent service provided by the staff. The room was very clean and we loved the intimate pool and patio area. The kitchenette had everything we needed and we loved that we didn't have to eat out for every meal. Also, the location is convenient to the beach, downtown, Diamond Head & the Aquarium. I highly recommend White Sands, especially to those with children. We will definitely stay there again!

First of all, the location of this hotel isn't quite your ideal location. This hotel does not have any elevators so pack light, hauling luggage up and eventually down three flights of stairs ain't fun. I stayed at this location for 5-day and 4-nights. I expected a good 2-Star hotel based on the online sales claims but its far from it. As I entered the room I immediately notice the stains on the bedding. The carpet was dirty and the air conditioning unit looks as if it hasn't been cleaned in months. The lanai (patio) furniture was dirty with bird poo. The pool and hot tub was far from being clean. WiFi works in the lobby and parking is $25.00 a day and they cant commit to your stall.

Location was excellent. Staff excellent. Nothing was too much trouble for them. Very friendly and helpful. Kitchenette was very helpful. Large bathroom. Extremely clean. I didnt mind being on the top floor (3rd floor) with no lift (keeps me fit). Swimming pool very clean and plenty of pool chairs and tables. Comfortable bed. Will stay here again.

Had a nice weekend at the White Sands Hotel! Nice room and Pool and Great Staff! Will definitely stay here again!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! We were on a staycation and went to a concert! The hotel is a small tree story building and very relaxing

It is very nice hotel and the staff is helpful, I arrived Honolulu in early morning and very tired due to time difference, as the check in time is 3:00 pm, I worried what I should do in the hours. The staff helped me and allowed early check in without extra charges. The location is goodm there are many convenience stores (ABC) and easy to get resturants too. With the good price I recommend this hotel

The white sands was perfect for budget accommodation, two blocks from all the action of the Main Street of Waikiki and three from the beach. The front desk staff were always courteous and helped us out with local information and tips. The rooms and bathroom was always clean and had a small kitchenette with a fridge for chilling drinks. The balconies mostly overlook the pool except for a few that face the street.We had a room and the third floor and my only suggestion is to ask for one on the first two as the wifi didn't work up there. It did if you had the device on the floor of the room. This is the only reason they loose a point from me as the hotel is advertised and was specifically chosen for the wifi as we weren't travelling with a phone. It is free however

I really liked the White Sands Hotel.It was not one of the fancy Waikiki resorts (It didn't even have an elevator to the upper rooms), but the staff were very friendly, helpful and professional, and the room was clean. The hotel was somewhat dated, but did have a charm of its own. But the price and location were great. My room had a small kitchenette, and there were fast food restaurants close by (Who can afford to eat out in Waikiki !!) The beach was only a couple of short blocks away, and there were old fashioned souvenir shops near by. (Although there were Pradas and Guccis and that type close by, I don't shop there). If you are looking for a great bargain, I would recommend the White Sands Hotel.

I stayed in a suite with kitchenette, queen bed and private lanai that was on the third floor. The room was extremely clean and prepared for our arrival and spacious enough to hold a queen sized bed, dresser and kitchen table without bumping into each other. The outdoor pool is surrounded by the hotel and is very private. The locale is ideal for anyone that plans on staying in Waikiki for a big portion of their vacation/business trip and allows for easy walking distances to everything you would want to visit. Christieann (the lovely wahine!) greets all the residents with a smile and much aloha and makes the stay pleasurable! She helped me out with recommendations for local spots and dining since it has been a while since I last visited. I highly recommend this hotel to those working with a budget and want to be close to all there is to offer in Waikiki.

My husband and I spent 10 nights at the white sands and we couldn't have been happier. Rooms may need a little update but we're very clean and spacious. Staff were fantastic, especially Brandon and Christie ann as nothing was too much trouble. The pool area was very clean and relaxing and loved that Waikiki beach was only a 8 min walk away but plenty of restaurants and bars near by. I would have no hesitation to stay at the White sands again or refer to others who are happy with a self contained hotel in a great location!

you think you've traveled back to a cool fifties hotel when you enter. the hotel has great ambiance and is a great budget boutique hotel. it needs a little updating, but mostly everything works. i like the fact that there is a two burner stove, frig, and microwave. they also provide pots and pans and plates and glasses and silverware. i especially liked the fact that i could buy some chicken and use their bbque to cook it. the front desk staff are especially customer service oriented. kudos to christianmas (probably spelled wrong) and brandon. also there is a dvd now kiosk that you can "rent" movies for free. the pool area is cool.jwhat made their review lower is that they have a hot tub which has no jets so for all intents it is just a warm bathtub. there is also no wireless in the rooms. they give you a modem with a cord to connect to your pc which is kinda awkward if you want to watch a movie in bed and you are limited to where you can use your pc in the room.helpful hint to the hotel -- it looks like you have the start of angels of the morning using the hotel for their business which isnt good for the hotels business.

Nothing but hood things to say.Atmosphere great, service really good, location perfect and staff as friendly and funny as you'll find anywhere. Just the right balance.During my days I met quite a few employees, amongst them the local front desk queen Christieann and sales manager Karen, and it was a real pleasure all the way through.Warm recommendations for anyone who wants to visit Hawaii, Oahu and HonoluluKind greetingsClaus Marquart, CEO

The one desk agent was the best, she invited me to join her singing group, and gave me tips and advice for the island. However the room was so hot and the AC did little to nothing. Nothing was done and it made it near impossible to sleep at night. Traffic was loud and watch out for the tweekers, seems to be an issue on the island.... other than that i would recommend visiting the island but finding a different place to stay, sorry

This hotel is in a great location - a few minutes' walk away from the beach but not on the main road so not much traffic. Close to bus stops if you're heading out of Waikiki for Pearl Harbour or North Shore or wherever.For the price you can't complain much. The rooms are a bit dated and the air conditioning is noisy, but the room is very spacious and they provide you way more pillows than you'll ever need. I could also hear the neighbours getting a bit intimate so keep your voice down if you don't want the whole corridor overhearing your conversation.Would have liked to have wifi in the room but there is in the lobby. The front desk is open 24/7. As always, how much information you get depends on who happens to be working there at the time - Brandon and a couple of the ladies were very helpful, Clifton not so much.If you are driving it's cheaper to park in the small lot across the street instead of at the hotel.

We stayed here when we got married and honeymooned. The location is central to everything and very close to the beach. The parking is a bit tight but luckily we had a small car. The staff were great. We requested a room change the night we arrived as there was a crying baby in the next room and we couldn't sleep. The staff moved us to a quieter part of the property immediately at no extra charge.

This hotel has location going for it. Just a few blocks to the beach. It is surrounded by all types of restaurants, shops and souvenir shops. The center courtyard pool area is very nice. Everything was clean. It is far enough off Kuhio you do not hear much traffic or construction noise. Whoever installed the carpet did a terrible job. They forgot the nail striping so the carpet goes up the wall. If you book a "city view" be aware it is the buildings across the street and parking area. The parking area is where the smokers do their thing. Upon check-in we were told there was a complimentary shuttle to/from the mall. We called from the mall and asked where to pick it up. The front desk did not know and suggested we ask the Concierge desk at the mall. She provided a general vicinity of the desk. We took The Bus which was $2.50 each instead of searching in the mall. After walking several miles and taking the bus back we decided to use the pool. They were out of towels until 30 minutes later. Wi-Fi is only available near if not in the lobby. No idea what the extra $10 a day resort fee covers. We read the mixed reviews and decided to book anyway. Our travel agent would not book the reservation as they received too many complaints. We had booked a return stay from a trip to New Zealand and cancelled it. This hotel was a huge disappointment.

Didn't want the "resort" scene. Wanted to get out and do our thing. Great for that.About 5 blocks from Waikiki Beach. Perfect ! You're with the city residents, workers, and businesses. Very quiet, very helpful front desk, small facility, and adequate rooms.Lots of local shops, restaurants, sights in the area. Only 3 stories. Very clean and good beds. If you want to plan your own fun - give them a shot.

Had stayed here 10 years ago when it was under a different ownership.... Sad to see what has happened.... Part of the problem is that the whole area of kuhio is undergoing a remake and is in transition... Just needed one night before an early morning flight.... Kind of sketchy early in the am on the street there, they have security though to help combat this ...... Room I had was a mixed bag... Newer bed, a/c, tv... Furniture/kitchen bathroom should be condemned, including the patio... Staff was friendly which was nice.... Grounds still looked o.k..... Hopefully that area will comeback, and then the owners may put some money into it.... Until then, nah.....

Stayed at the White Sands Hotel in Waikiki with the family including our 20 month granddaughter.Absolutely the best experience we have had in a hotel in 20 years of traveling!The staff went above and beyond, with many thanks to Christine Ann, on the front desk!We will always make this our vacation spot whenever we go to Oahu again!Highly recommend White Sands Hotel.The pictures available of this hotel are true and what we were expecting.A personal thank you to the entire staff for making our stay so pleasant and accommodating with our youngest traveler!Mahalo,Janice

For a To me - From me for my birthday I stayed at this hotel and in Waikiki for 4 days! Nice location and quaint oasis in the middle of the city! 3rd floor gave me exercise with only stairs, and kitchenette nice to keep fruit and drinks for beach cold!

This hotel is very accommodating the people at the desk extra friendly they have a box where you can rent movies to watch in your room free of charge they do have Wi-Fi however it is only available in the lobby the swimming pool is very clean and the atmosphere is very nice I definitely recommend this place

I find it hard to say anything negative about this hotel at the price and location. Our pool view room with kitchenette was sizeable with a balcony. The kitchen was adequately equipped to self cater although irritating to English people they provide a coffee maker but no kettle so tea water has to be microwaved (common in the USA). There’s a safe and good storage space. I didn’t feel it was dated; it was clean and bright, call it homely maybe.The staff are so welcoming. The pool area is large with plenty of shade and seating. Yes the wifi only works in the common areas but we found we could just about pick it up on our balcony. Yes there’s a service charge but every hotel has one in Hawaii. It’s low rise which makes it feel more relaxed than a lot of the area.There’s a good supermarket a few minutes’ walk away and you are only a block from Waikiki beach. It seemed very quiet at night. If you are on a budget in Oahu, try this place. You don’t need a car though the hotel chain shuttle included in the service charge is a bit erratic. It’s generally quiet at night but there were a lot of young excitable Chinese staying there who tended to yell at each other up the corridors and across the pool.

I have been going to Hawaii since 1964 and stayed in all types of hotels. I do not like any of the high rise Waikiki hotels, just too many people, too much time getting to an from your room. The White Sands is clean,extremely reasonable, outstanding location, quick in quick out which is so important. Front desk is incredibly friendly, helpful and has your back. I will always stay there no matter where I have business on Oahu.

The positives: the location, it's close to everything. The staff did seem friendly but we did our best to stay out of the hotel because of the...The negatives: it's outdated and gross. We had a roach that came to visit in the bathroom each night. Our air conditioner was rotting as well as most of the hotel. We did not expect to pay for parking but I guess that is the norm in any city. It was cheaper place to stay but I would have paid a little extra for a nice place,

I've staying at White Sands Hotel in Waikiki, while working a block away, for the past 3 weeks. Myself and 5 other coworkers have been enjoying our stay here immensely. The staff are very helpful and kind, especially Christieann. The Hawaiian word of the week is a great touch. The location is excellent, about 2 blocks from the beach. The pool and hot tub are very enjoyable. There are bus stops very close and if you need a cab the hotel can call you one easily. Overall, this a great hotel and I would definitely come back here and recommend it to anyone visiting Waikiki.

I read the reviews but since we didn't have a car we figured we would try it. The place is nice, good location. We got a shuttle from the airport, it wasn't from the hotel but it took us there. You have to ask the guys at the airport with the shuttles & some take people all over the place in Waikiki. Wifi was only in the lobby but we have noticed that's common unless you are staying at a major brand hotel over here. Nice little bar behind the hotel, you can go in & out the back gate. We would def stay here again.

I did not expect a 5 star hotel, since I was not paying for one. My standard room had a king bed, mattress was not bad. The second floor lanai overlooked the pool. I had a microwave, frig, coffee maker. They do have rooms available with full kitchens. Free newspaper, the internet was not very strong in my room, I usually went to the pool. The place could have cleaner, my only complaint. Location is very good for everything, one block to The Bus. The surcharge, unfortunately has caught on every where, Las Vegas, is even worse!!!

I found this hotel through reviews on Tripadvisor. The price was right, location excellent, reviews good.The staff was very friendly when we checked in and when we asked questions at the front desk. Helpful with things like getting towels for the pool or help with directions.The setting is very pleasant. Flowers overhead great you as you enter. The pool area has palm trees.The rooms are nice. Beds were comfortable. Dressers were clean. Bathroom looked newly painted.Kitchenette was laid out nicely. Fully stocked with pots, pans, utensils, glasses, plates, silverware. Fridge, electric 2 burner stove, microwave, coffee maker (with daily coffee). We had a nice table for eating or lounging. It is fixed to the floor, but was nice to have.The shower, as with many places I have stayed, was showing its age. It was clean and pleasant to use. Cabinets in the bathroom and kitchen were dinged up a bit, but again clean.We enjoyed our stay.Very close to the Ala Wai canal. It is a nice place to walk with fewer people than near the beach.Wifi is free, but only available in the lobby and out by the pool.

Looked good online but was quickly disappointed upon arrival. There is about 8 parking spots in front of the hotel which ISN'T FREE!! If you can find a spot (good luck) it costs $20 to park there! We had to park across the street where it costs $35!! On top of that there is an extra $11 cleaning fee for the room so plan on an extra $50 you weren't planning to spend. Aside from that the hotel is old and kind of, well... gross. There were a bunch of questionable people hanging around on the streets outside and a drunk guy standing by the main entrance with beer in a paper bag. I wasn't aware honolulu had a ghetto area but it does. My recommendation; spend your money somewhere else. In fact, don't come to this area at all, stay on the other side of the island or on another island all together

They do not tell you parking is $30/night and their convenience fee is $10.75/night applied at the hotel - it is not included in any fare/taxes/fees that you pay through the booking site. The room is mediocre but nothing so bad as to make us leave. The area is very busy and crowded, looking forward to getting out of Honolulu - just a 15 min drive north puts you away from people and in the beautiful palis.

Stayed here last October..A lot of great places to eat nearby and a great pool . Great view of the mountains and only blocks from the beach . A market with anything you need nearby.Old school Hawaii in Downton Waikiki .... LOVED IT and just saw you on Hawaii Five O ...They know where the Ohana is. We look forward to staying our next time back.

Frequent guest. Stayed from dec 23 until jan 5.Nice.Clean Quiet.Good ,friendly staff.They always remember me and make me feel like OHANA,A pleasure to talk with them on a daily basis.I will be back here by JULY 4.Do yourself a favor and stay here.Time well spent.Thanks from STERLING LAHACH in LAS VEGAS.

The plus points were:Location Largish roomsVery good front of desk staff - arranging taxis, room change on request, late check out etc this is where the 2 points are givenThe minus:Very tired and rooms need refreshing Smells in corridor Our toilet did not flush efficiently and needed twice flushing Loud AC unit Views aren't greatVery expensive for what it was although granted it was a peak time and location was good

Last minute trip with my daughters to Hawaii and I searched TripAdvisor for a couple of days trying to find a place close to the beach and in the heart of Honolulu. White Sands fit the bill perfectly. The hotel was clean and nothing fancy. We just needed a place to wash the sand and salt off at the end of our day. The front desk staff were very friendly and helped us choose between a couple of activities that we were wanting to do. The only downside I had was the limited number of parking spaces at the hotel. I wound up having to park my rental car in a parking garage a couple of blocks away.

So, you think this hotel is a great deal? Here are the facts:In addition to your room rate, the hotel charges a $25/day "resort fee." The fee is non-negotiable, and is supposed to cover pool towels, internet, coffee and shuttle service. But- the internet only works in the hotel lobby, the coffee is just the standard make-you-own coffee in the room packets you get standard in any other hotel. The "free" shuttle service only goes to the Ala Moana shopping mall, not to the airport (unless you pay for it) There is no breakfast or coffee in the lobby. And- they'll tell you there is parking at the hotel, but when you check in you discover the hotel charges $25/day to park. My room was old but OK.

We chose White Sands as we didnt want to pay the big money for a hotel in Waikiki, we are not into resort style hotels only require clean room and a comfortable bed. White Sands did meet this criteria, yes it has seen better days but the location is very convenient for Waikiki, the bus stop is located around the corner and not far from food pantry. We had a room facing the pool with a small kitchenette which was useful for making our own coffee and a light breakfast each day.The pros tho no wifi in room which is pretty of the norm in hotels these days despite budget, only offered around pool and common areas which okay I know you are holidays but with family at home nice to keep in touch.Also there is a pub next door to the hotel, police seem to be there every other night, and one night were actually searching a car in the car park of the hotel, as i am a smoker and there is no designated smoking area at the hotel you have to go out onto sidewalk so i witnessed alot of going ons from this pub. It was a little off putting but on the whole didnt really worry us.Would i stay here again probably not i think i would pay a little more now that i have been and sussed the area out myself.The staff on the whole are helpful and polite.

The location is good, the bus route is on the next corner and the main strip is a few minutes walk. The rooms are tired, but the friendly staff keep them clean and everything works. Free wifi in the lobby, but not in the rooms is a minus. Kitchenette is a plus. Beds are comfortable without being luxurious. If you're looking for luxury, look elsewhere.. If you want location and value for money, this is it.

White Sands is an older property, very well-maintained. Rooms include kitchenette. About half the rooms face the pool/patio/courtyard, which is nicely landscaped with plants and waterfall. Waikiki beaches are a short walk, and many stores are nearby. The staff are especially pleasant and helpful. Not a luxurious place by any means, but very nice. The beds were particularly comfortable. Free wifi around the lobby and pool; nearby rooms also pick up the wifi.
user_name:
nycjcb
New York City, New York

review_body: We ended our first trip to the islands with our stay at the White Sands hotel. It was just what we needed! We were NOT looking for high-end lodging just a clean, quiet place to sleep, close-ish to the airport but within walking distance of downtown (parking downtown is OUTRAGEOUS! ). The room had plenty of space for the 2 of us at a reasonable rate! As a bonus, the staff were friendly and accommodating to our questions. I would recommend this hotel for anyone who goes on vacation to see the sights NOT sit in a hotel!!

Great courtyard but all but a couple of rooms are dumps. I have stayed in room 250 and 350 and they were very good but the other side of hotel stinks and I can't believe they could rent for over $50 a night. They had said we would have room 250 and gave us the one in the very front which was a disaster. We paid a little more and went to The Imperial Hotel and it was 100% nicer.

We traveled to Hawaii on 18th October 2915 to attend a wedding so we looked and found white sands hotel.We had read the reviews and although some were negative and some ok we still decided to book it.When we arrived in the small hours of the morning we were greeted by christiana and we booked in and were given our room keys, upon which we went to the room and found it to very comfortableWe had booked for 21 nights so we were there, the hotel itself is dated as it was built around 1965 and does require an update, but it all truth the staff were brilliant they were courteous, helpful and always had a smile on their face, The cleaning staff were helpful and diligent the pool and ground staff always said good morning and were respectful,.As for the hotel it is dated and does look a bit run down. But it was clean and tidy and what you would expect for a budget hotel, the good thing about it is location,it is only 5 minuets walk to the beach your just off the main drag with shops,buses market ect, and every so often Hawaii five O use the hotel for scenes in the show.So a a British traveler I feel some hotels including white sands get a bad review, because of expectations of travellers if you want luxury then book moana surf rider or Hawaiian Hilton, and you will pay thousands, if you want a decent base for your holiday, and have more spending money in your pocket, then hotels like white sand are good little hotels.Just another small point we travelled in a party of 6 and there was issues with room allocation but you know what they went out of their way to help and it was sorted next morning and they waived our convenience fee so to me that shows a good hotel that listens to its customers I would recommend this hotel because it's a central base of operations in Waikiki and is value for money, good staff friendly and polite.

We spent 3 nights at the White Sands Hotel and found it to be more than we expected. We booked it on-line based only on description and photographs. The price was good compared to all the high rise hotels in downtown Honolulu. White Sands has obviously been there a long time, but is well maintained and exceptionally clean. Some of the room décor is quite dated and there are a few minor maintenance issues like chipped paint and worn carpets. Overall, though, we felt it was a good value. The pool was cleaned religiously each morning and the staff was all very helpful and friendly. The only reason we don't rate the hotel as overall excellent is due to the age of the facility and the few maintenance issues we described above.

This is an older property , probably from the 1960's, that is only a few blocks from Waikiki. Rooms are spacious and have a kitchenette with refrigerator and microwave. My room had an extremely comfortable king size bed. Property has no elevator.I think rooms here are quite a bit cheaper than nearby hotels. I paid $101 for a room before a convenience fee of $10 and taxes of $14 were tacked on.Most nearby hotel properties are now highrises. This property is one of the few remaining three story old timers.

We booked using a third party company. The hotel was rated 2 1/2 stars. It really doesn't deserve that high of a rating. This is your basic motel and probably the most affordable lodging in Waikiki. The grounds are nice, the staff is friendly but the rooms need some updating. They have full bathrooms and kitchens which make it more like a condo, but the property is an older motel. The neighborhood is fine during the day but I didn't feel completely at ease walking around at night. I would have preferred to pay a little bit more money and stay at a bigger chain hotel.

There is no elevator so walking up and down stairs after a long day was not my idea of fun. There is limited parking so we ended up parking a block and a half away which was ok except if it was raining. The staff was always helpful and accommodating. It reminded me of an apartment building that they now turned into a hotel but the room was clean!! There was a small fridge, micro and hot plates so that was a big help warming up leftovers for the late night hungry teens. The walls were a bit thin. we could hear our semi loud "neighbors" talking through the bathroom walls, so we closed the bathroom doors lol Other than that the hotel is in a good location. Late evening shady characters hanging around the bar but nice to see security when we entered the hotel...ohhhh no wifi except in lobby...kinda funny i thought lol

There is no elevator at this hotel so do not bring a lot of suitcases or you will be tired out going up and down the stairs. There is a hotel in front of this property so the only time there is sun shine is in the morning.

Friendly & helpful staff. Walking distance to Waikiki beach, Kalakaua Ave (where all the main hotels, restaurants, shops are located), historical sites, museums, actually a really excellent location.Room was quite (even though it was right next to main reception) large with full facilities, large fridge/freezer, fully equipped kitchen, comfy bed, clean bathroom, free wifi.Pool located among very pleasant surroundings and pool towels always available.I would definitely recommend this hotel to family and friends.

The Hotel was a Little Dated but very clean, the staff were very helpful and the area around the pool is wonderful, with the palm trees and waterfall, the Hotel is about a 10 min walk to the Beach, about a 5 min walk to good bars and shops,Overall the Hotel... Very Good we would stay at it againArea..Good..but just a little far every day to walk to waikiki beach (about 10-15 mins)Very good Holiday would do all over again next year...Whitehouse Family

No bugs. Comfortable bed. Clean towels and bedding. But that's where it ends. The carpet was filthy-had to wear my slippers the entire time. Mold on all vents and air conditioners. We planned on staying 5 nights. Couldn't do it. Checked out after one night. With some cleaning, this could be a great deal. Front desk staff was very nice and helpful. The area is dark at night. We are locals and this location made us nervous at night.

Motel style accommodation, located 3 blocks from Honolulu’s main Kalakaua Ave. Tired and in need of having some time and money spent freshening it up. Arrived early morning, check-in not until 3pm, however bags held and were able to change and wander around until then. Rooms basic, clean, but the air conditioning noisy and wifi only available at reception-pool area. Would have been better with one of the rooms facing the internal pool area that have terraces. Staff most helpful.

CHECK-IN: Christieann & Kathy were amazing concierges. My party of 2 checked in without problems & payed for 4 nights of parking. It was 25$ a night (expensive!) but worth it since parking is hard to find. One of the people we were with lost their wallet so they had no ID but Kathy was very understanding & checked them in while we figured things out. LOCATION:It was great! Walking distance from everything! About a block from the beach & many delicious restaurants & shops. Public trans accessible, near a park that is beautiful to go for a run. Near the freeway so makes it easy to get around by car. The Waikiki beach nearby was calm & great to snorkel in. There is also a free Hula show in the evenings there. AMENITIES:All of the usual stuff a hotel would provide & more (towels, soap, dishes, nice kitchenette, table, pots, knifes, cups, wine glasses, fully stocked with dishes & dish soap). The room was very clean & the AC worked perfectly. The balcony view to the pool wasn't special but a nice place to have breakfast or just sit & enjoy the weather. The pool area was well kept & they had pool towels. There was nice vegetation around the pool & jacuzzi. They even had a grilling area! Wifi in lobby & pool area was weak. Complimentary DVDS and PS3 games (PS3 in room with one remote). STAFF:Wonderful, just great & friendly service!! Very approachable & always happy to help. Both Kathy & Christieann had a lovely demeanor & always upbeat with a good sense of humor. They were also great with directions & good advice on which places to hit up. They help out with event reservations & tips on where to get cheaper stuff. OVERALL:Good price for a good experience. Mainly used the place to shower & rest since we were always upnabout. We would definitely recommend & will use again in the future.

Although the rooms were all that nice I did have a nice experience here thanks to the wonderful hostess Kathy who was really nice to let me stay even though I had lost my I.D. and I always had a warm welcome Christieann upon leaving and coming back. If I ever do come back I know I will come back to the White sands hotel.

When was asked to put second card down for $100 I found i had very little left on my card as they took what was owing on room which we were told we could pay at end of stay. We were using another card to pay for room which they already had the no. when we booked so they had no permission to do this.It took a lot of encouragement for them to transfer money back which took four days to return to account. When I packed my bag on the afternoon before we left, the cleaners did our room after that. I did not padlock my bag till next morning when leaving nor had any reason to check it. When I got home I had six items I bought missing. I would strongly suggest you padlock your bag at all times.

White Sands Hotel was an an unexpected fantastic experience, we stayed with my husband for 14 days, none was less good than the other.The lovely large clean bed, with soft pillows. The cleaning very well done. Free coffee dailyWe love the balcony overlooking the pool, aswell we enjoyed a lots the BBQ and the pool itself. All this surrounded by a tropical garden.The silent nights (except for the air conditioning, but it was the least important)Free use towels.Free shuttle to Ala MoanaVery friendly staff and excellent service.And all this wonder to very few blocks from WaikikiWhat else can you ask for?Thanks to all who work in this hotel for making our honeymoon/ vacation a really FANTASTIC EXPERIENCE

I loved my stay at the White Sands. Charming low rise hotel smack bang in the centre of Waikiki. A peaceful oasis to rest from the bustling streets of Waikiki. Super friendly staff with helpful local knowledge. It felt like staying on an outer island with a tranquil atmosphere but you were right amongst everything Waikiki has to offer. Clean rooms and grounds make for a relaxing and enjoyable stay. Hope to get back in July 2016 for another great visit.

After a 9 hour flight we couldn't wait to get to our room. We were on the second floor (there is no lift) and after lugging our bags up we found our room. It's a decent sized room but it hasn't been refurbished since the 70s. The room was dirty and stunk like a smoker's haven. My eyes were stinging within minutes. We put up with it for the night we'd prepaid but promptly checked out the very next morning and found somewhere else.

We stayed at the White Sands for five nights from 2-7 August, like a few others, our room key didn't work, we were required to ask for assistance each time we returned to the hotel. Friendly and willing staff seem to be a general comment, I agree on this point. The area surrounding the hotel is a bit dodgy. As you leave the main entrance, you face a high-rise apartment building. For the entire length of our stay, there remained a heaping stack of discarded eviction-type furniture. The neighborhood itself looks a bit "rough around the edges" and is in desperate need of a clean sweep and perhaps more community interest in its appearance. Management or property owners seem oblivious to the property's needs. I wouldn't return based on the surroundings,

I stayed at the White Sands with my partner a week before Christmas. We were given a room in the corner that faced the pool area. We had a small balcony, a nice fully-equipped kitchenette, and overall a very pleasant stay.Very clean. This is a beach hotel so occasionally there will be sand in common areas.There is nothing fancy about this hotel. If you are looking for luxury, room service and that kind of stuff, you better go somewhere else.This is the perfect place if you want to relax without spending the big bucks.Planning to go back next December!

Positioned perfectly for everything. Nightlife, restaurants, airport, Waikiki beach - everything! Very well priced considering you get a pool and airconditioning - cheap actually. Beds are a good size and reasonably comfortable, and the bathrooms are spacious enough. The cleaning staff could do a better job though, and in my book that filters up to management. I wouldn't go so far as to say it's dirty (unless you dropped something behind the bedside table and then moved it. Don't do that by the way). Somehing that does make this place more than it is structurally(it's old and theres no elevator) is the staff. Christiann is an absolute gem, that makes a sunny day sunnier. And he night watchman Rogie is a helpful hand and a generous soul that'll look after you. The staff alone will make yo want to come back. I enjoyed my stay here, I hope you do too.

This motel was likely built in 1960 and after 55+ years of use shows serious sign of overuse and lack of maintenance and upgrades. Securing every last dollar out of the fixtures and fittings before the place is fall down or is demolished seems to be the management's strategy. The positives: location--the property is within walking distance to anywhere within Waikiki--(beaches, shopping, restaurants), front desk staff are friendly and watchful of comings and goings--important given some of the characters one sees on the nearby street. Negatives: Rooms are dated and the the furniture is dilapidated (think used Marriott Hotel furniture). The air con is noisy and the cleaning is cursory--a quick tuck of the sheets is about it. It was an OK hotel experience but would I stay again? No. Instead I intend to save up and go upmarket next visit to Hawaii. This hotel has potential and could be a fun & funky 1960s era place, but that is obviously not the current owner's vision (or lack thereof).

We got a room on the third (top) floor. There are no elevators so we had to carry our luggage up the stairs. Luckily we only had a carry on size luggage. The walls are a bit thin because I could hear the couple in the next room arguing at night even when I had the TV on. The AC, when on full power, gets pretty loud but provides a bit of comfort. There is a kitchen, which we didn't really use much. They also provide a shuttle to the Ala Moana mall but because the shuttle goes to other branch hotels it fills up quickly. We waited over half an hour and when it got to the hotel it had only 3 spaces left. We ended up walking which took around half an hour. The majority of the front desk staff was friendly and helpful. There is only wifi in the lobby area.

Overall, this is a lower end hotel. Parking is extremely limited near the hotel, so discounts are provided for a deck several blocks away. While the hotel is only two stories in height, it does not have an elevator, so bags must be carried up exterior stair cases. Our unit's kitchen area was quite dirty and greasy and cabinets were showing signs of rot. While the location was near Waikiki Beach, the street was populated by unsavory characters such that there was some concern about safety. Wi Fi was available in the lobby area only.

The people that worked for the hotel were really friendly. During our stay the electric cards went down and I could only ask the workers to allow me into my room. However, they were always there when we needed them and didn't charge us a nightly fee. The room had a kitchen and was in great walking distance to everything I needed in Wakiki. Would stay here again...

Honolulu in August is not the cheapest place to visit. The White Sands Hotel though offers a reasonable budget alternative.It is not a luxury hotel, but it was comfortable and adequate for a stay of 5 nights. The first impression, having arrived late and jet-lagged on a Sunday evening was of palm trees, a nice pool and birdsong. It definitely was not a bad first impression.Whte Sands Hotel is conveniently situated between the canal and the main avenue. It is a quiet setting, but close to night life, restaurants and shops and only a few steps away from a bustling Chinese street market that is well worth a look. If you like to walk, you can follow the canal all the way around to the beach at Waikiki. The conference centre is around 20-25 minutes walk away - a very pleasant walk.Rooms a fairly basic apartments. Small, en-suite bathroom with complimentary toiletries, a balcony (which, in my case, overlooked the pool and the palm trees) and a small kitchen with microwave and refrigerator plus all the basics crockery. It all looks just a little rundown, but everything worked fine.The highlight of the room is the bed. It was a very comfortable double, piled high with cushions and pillows: definitely first class!The hotel has no restaurant. I bought ready-prepared meals at a nearby 7-Eleven and heated then in the microwave for breakfast. There is a coffee percolator in the kitchenette, supplied with excellent local Kona coffee to accompany your breakfast.The hotel does offer free WiFi. This seems to work best close to reception. I had a room close to reception and got usable reception all week, a colleague elsewhere in the hotel never managed to get the WiFi to work. I did notice that a lot of people went down to reception to use their smartphones.The reception staff were very helpful. Although the hotel is definitely no frills, I found reception excellent, helping me with my (lost) luggage and getting an urgent change of clothes and arranging a taxi.

We stayed here in March. It was pretty great! We had the one bedroom with the kitchen on the second floor overlooking the hot tub. It was a little dated, but clean. The beds were comfortable, AC worked great, the kitchen was nice and saved us a lot of money eating out. Had a full sized fridge too. The lanai was cool and very safe and our daughters (2 and 4) loved going out on there and watching the birds and the people below. Lots of tv channels and there was a PS3 as well as a dvd rental kiosk at the front desk. A couple of times the key system malfunctioned and we had to wait a few minutes before maintenance could open it or rekey it for us. Also, parking is very limited. We had a rental car and paid for a spot in their lot. It's not assigned parking and a few times the lot was full when we came back from doing something. The staff park there occasionally so you have to go ask them at the front desk and they will move for you. Other than that I can't say anything negative about them.The front desk staff is great, super friendly. I can't remember the woman's name but everytime you go buy she greets you with "Hello Sunshine" and would give our kids popsicles. She was great! The entire staff was. We extended our stay 3 days and they gave us the same rate we had booking a month earlier. The pool was clean and the hot tub was nice too. You wouldn't think you'd use one in Hawaii but it was still nice. The place has a more long term stay, family type feel than the bigger chain hotels on the beach, like Hilton or whatever. It was nice. A few blocks from the beach, half a block from the canal. Clean, affordable, family friendly, recommended! Side note- (One day tree trimmers came to work on the trees in the courtyard there. It was pretty neat to see them hand climb up the palm trees way up there to trim and prune. Our girls had a lot of fun watching them getting around up there! Some of those trees are scary tall.)

We got a great rate by calling their reservations number and all their staff were very helpful. There is a nice pool and wifi in the main lobby area. It's in a good area, right down dukes lane to the beach. I had a good experience here and for the price and location we will stay here again.

Upon check-in, we were told that their key system had been broken for 2 weeks that we needed an escort every time we go into our room. The system seemed to be fixed after a half way through our stay, but we had to switch keys once after that and the problem with one of our keys at the end. The room was clean and because of the loud A/C, we didn't hear much noise which was nice. The staff there were all nice and helpful. I hoped that they could waive the 'convenient fee' upon check-out because it was such inconvenient experience with the key issues.

First, this hotel looks a little dirty so I wasn't expecting it was nice. I stayed on the 3th floor and it was actually super comfortable and nice room! Really clean and wide inside. They charge resort fee. You need to pay that when you check out. But our room key was broken or something so we needed to ask the front desk to open the door every single time. Because of this problem, they didn't charge us any resort fee. Some stuff are really friendly. They always smile at us. I would definitely choose this hotel again!!!

Arrived a day late and got an upgrade to a room, kitchen, bathroom and a gorgeous view of the pool area, which had palm trees, waterfall and a Jacuzzi, a beautiful oasis in the middle of hotel tower blocks. All the staff, especially Christieann, were the friendliest, we have ever encountered, so pleasant and helpful. The hotel is old fashioned but quaint, and we really enjoyed our stay here.

Stayed at the White Sands Hotel for a week and found it to be a small, quiet, friendly hotel, which was close to the heart of Wakiki - but in a quiet street just far enough away from the hustle and bustle. It is a older hotel - but it was clean - the room was a good size and the kitchenette was a bonus. Had a lovely pool view room in the nice garden and only steps from the pool and spa and barbecue area. The free WiFi worked well while relaxing by the pool or in the reception area. The staff were friendly and efficient and made us fell welcome as soon as we arrived. There were several nice places to eat just a short distance away - our favourite being Madame Udon - just around the corner, where there is always a line, but don't be put off cos it moves quite fast and the meals are worth the wait. There is also a food panty a 5 minute walk away where you can stock up on essential items. The Royal Hawaiian Centre is also a 5 minute walk away and have a cafeteria type eating place and also some free activities. Waikiki Beach is 2 blocks away and an easy walk from this hotel. I would recommend this hotel to anyone on a budget or not fussed about paying for the luxury of having a view of Waikiki Beach.  Monika

The pool area was nice and the location is great in Waikiki. Next to a lot of shopping, nightlife and food - as well as a 10 min walk to Waikiki beach. Great if you don't plan on being in the hotel a lot. The walls are very thin. I could hear the people fighting in the next room as well as anyone in the hallway. I thought it was kinda creepy in some way but lots of normal looking people were staying there. I chose it because it was cheaper though so in this case - I got what I paid for!
user_name:
April D
Green Bay, Wisconsin, United States

review_body: I recently spent 4 nights at the White Sands with my 16 and 19 year old sons. My wife was unable to join us on the trip so we opted to stay in a budget hotel.The hotel is just across the street from a long souvenir shopping street with many vendors selling the standard Hawaiian souvenirs and about a 5 minute walk from Waikiki Beach and many dining and entertainment options. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean if old. The bathroom was a bit small with a small shower and not much storage space for toiletries. I would recommend this hotel if you would like to be in Waikiki and are on a budget.

We have been here two days and we still don't have a key to our room. We keep getting told they are fixing it. But so far nothing.
