The pool area is actually more comfortable to sit around than most hotels - lots of umbrellas and coconut trees. The room had a small kitchen which is very handy. The place was clean. The staff was very friendly.We will be back for our next Waikiki adventure!Mahalo White Sands!

First and foremost the staff was excellent, above average!!!My room had a broken down sofa, the mattress needed replace as it was broke down. The room itself needed a lot of up keep. Over all I guess I got what I paid for.

White Sands Hotel was our home away from home. The staff was welcoming, friendly and very helpful. Special thanks to Christieanna for greeting us every morning and making us feel like family. The pool and pool side was cleaned everyday. Our room was immaculate, comfortable, safe and quiet. A big thank you to all the housekeeping staff. The oasis by the pool side makes it worth the stay. It included a fountain with fish in the pond. Beautiful greenery and Hawaiian flowers. The rooms could use some upgrades but well worth the price to stay. We had a kitchenette which was perfect for morning breakfast or quick lunches when you didn't want to eat out and save money. If ever returning to Waikiki we will definitely want to stay again. Many thanks again to all the staff. Aloha!!!

I got a room on the 3rd floor facing Nohonani Street. The room was bigger than I thought it would be and, despite what other reviews say, I found the street side to be very quiet. The parking spaces are small, but so is every parking spot in Honolulu. I rented a convertible and was able to fit it in the lot without major issues. Almost every hotel in Waikiki charges for parking so this was no surprise to me. Staff here were very helpful and welcoming. The downside is that there is no elevator but after a coupledays we got used to the stairs.The location was awesome. Just far enough from the beach to avoid the noise of so many people, a mini flea market less than a block away and many restaurants and shops nearby. Even the zoo is only about 6 blocks away.I plan to stay here on my next visit.

Would I stay here again? Absolutely!Staying here was a delight. Making the reservation was a breeze. They were sold out on their parking spaces, but no problem--there was plenty of convenient parking across the street at their sister hotel.There were three three-story buildings encircling and cozy, private courtyard with pool. Our particular room had three twin beds and a small kitchen. It had a delightful retro feel--a throwback to a time when hotels had individual personality.The staff was amazing! Always cheerful, helpful, and positive. No matter what I needed, they were there with a great attitude and a solution. Christianne and David at the front desk, the bellmen, the housekeepers--they all made us feel welcome and valued.

It was our fifth trip to the Island but first to this Hotel. After staying in larger Hotels on our previous visits we chose this hotel because it was small and had a nice pool and Garden area.Plus was centrally located. Two blocks from the Beach. Plenty of Shops and Restaurants nearby We had a pool view room with kitchenette, which was well stocked.All the staff were friendly and helpful.The only downside was that the air-conditioning was noisy.We will definitely be staying at this Hotel on our next visit

Me and my wife booked a last minute Waikiki trip and had to save a bit on our hotel. We choose this hotel because it was 2 blocks from the beach. We didn't expect much because it was so inexpensive. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We checked out at noon and didn't have to fly home until 10pm so the staff let us store our bags and even gave us an empty room to shower and freshen up before our flight. They have security and the hotel was quiet and safe. The cove the pool is in is nice and quiet. Rooms are old and outdated but the beds were comfortable. Housekeeping did a great job. Overall we got what we payed for and a bit more. At first we didn't like it but by the end of our 8 day trip we were very pleased. It's a cheaper hotel but if your looking to save a bit on your hotel this is a good place to start.

Our second time staying here... right in the heart of Waikiki. Easy walk to shops, good coffee cafes, restaurants, clubs, and the beach! (just 2 blocks) It's not the Ritz but it's clean, affordable, friendly, good maid service, a self-serve laundry room, sunny pool area, Internet, a BBQ, hot tub under the palm trees, $25 parking (not bad for central Waikiki), a koi pond, lots of greenery and terrific front desk staff. The water pressure could be a little better in the shower but other than that- we love the place. Feels a bit "old school Waikiki" and we like that. No waiting for elevators. All easily accessible. Tucked off the street a half block from Kuhio Ave. Really-- this is wonderful. Like I said it's not the Ritz or anything fancy but if you want a nice comfy place and you'd rather spend the money you're saving on tropical drinks and puupus, THIS is the one to check out. You're sure to experience the aloha spirit from the front desk staff of Cristianne and David among other very, very nice people. Mahalo, White Sands!

I used to like this area but it's now loud, they allow large parties by the pool, they no longer have a hot tub, and they advertise that they do, this should substract from value, their parking is $25 a night and it's build for migits and their smart cars, and if your an inch over the line they complain. Rudely and aren't polite at all.. They made a promise to me and my newly wed wife that they would have something special for us ready in our room, well... here it is... and i'm not seeing anything special but bunch of noise and customer service people who really just want your money.' The last few times i have traveled here the experience was great and i thought it would be even better now that i was getting married and on a honey moon.. We are planning on bringing our two 10 year old daughters with us next time to Hawaii in June as we travel here numerous times per year... Unless the hot tub comes back or the price drops and customer service improves we won't be coming back.. this place has gone down hill fast.Phil Granere - Returning Frequent Customer.
user_name:
Philip G
Salt Lake City, Utah

review_body: We live in Honolulu but entertain in Waikiki often and at times like to stay in Waikiki. The White Sands is like stepping back into they good old days of Aloha in Waikiki. Love the casual Hawaiian feel and ambiance. The staff is friendly and upbeat. Love not having to wait for an elevator. An Oasis in Waikiki.

I stayed at the White Sands 2-9 March, 2014. I was delighted with the place. I wanted a budget hotel but in Waikiki, and didn't wish to pay extra hundreds for marble floors and thick towels. White Sands was perfect. The building is a 50s style, 3 flat, walk up, with a central courtyard and pool. The room was adequate and comfortable, with a lanai overlooking the pool and trees. The strong point here is the staff who are friendly, warm and helpful. I would especially like to compliment Christieann at the front desk who treated me like family, Jason who gave me a great room overlooking the pool, and Rosalina who kept my room clean and always said Hi. Internet router costs $9/day extra, but was high speed and no problems. You can walk to everywhere in Waikiki since the hotel is smack-dab in the middle. Food pantry is 2 blocks away with sashimi a wine to bring back and enjoy on the lanai. Seaside Restaurant is less than a block away with a great and cheap breakfast.OK, it's not fancy, but this is the kind of Ohana place I like for economy, friendliness and location.

I just stayed here for a week, March 4 to 11, and I was happy with the White Sands. I just read the review previous to mine, and I disagree with many things that reviewer said. Yes, the property is old, but clean. There is no elevator but it's only 3 floors. It was likely built in the 1960's back when the whole neighborhood were all 3 stories and folks didn't complain about a couple of flights of stairs. These older retro hotels are all disappearing fast, this is one of the few left that are not sterilized high-rise boxes hundreds of feet in the sky.The previous reviewer mentioned there was no a/c, untrue, there is a/c (but not in the bathroom as he stated). It's not totally quiet because it's located in a city, but I was never bothered by noise from the other rooms, because the walls/floor seemed to be concrete built. Outside noise came through open windows (which I had open to enjoy the tropical air), but with most rooms facing the pool, it was quieter than other places I've stayed that charged more.This hotel is an oasis that is stuck between high rises, this hotel is the way it should be!Rooms came with Kitchenettes, flat screen TV, 24 hours of complimentary wi-fi (only accessible in the lobby or pool area)... but damn, you're in Hawai'i and get off that device & have a blast!Overall, the staff was great, the rooms were clean, my bed was comfortable, the week I was there, they had a tree-trimming company trimming trees for 3 days, so during the day it was a bit loud at times... but the maintenance only was a 3 day affair.Come to Hawai'i, grab a cheap room (I paid $112/night + tax), reserved 4 days before arrival. I was happy with this place - it ain't the Ritz, but spend the extra money on fun stuff!

We made this unfortunate selection through Hotwire after viewing the reviews on Trip Advisor.Believe me, this place isn't close to a four star. This dump was built back in the early 1960s and they have not spent any money to upgrade it.The fact that this is a part of the Aqua hotel chain was another confusing issue for me. Aquahotels are known for good value with decent accommodations, and I've stayed at three of theirproperties with no problems. The property is completely open to the elements with no protection from street noises or weather. There's no sound proofing and no insulation. There are no views and the propertybutts up against a huge parking garage. The parking here is expensive and extremely limited. The only in room Internet they have is expensive. They were too cheap to install wi-fi.  There were bugs in the room and the bathroom. This is a three story property without an elevator!The small mattress is old and lumpy and the pillow is too. The furniture is old, well used, and tacky.There's no Air Conditioning in the bathroom, just two open windows. The shower stall is small and the commode runs constantly. The lobby is hot and humid and has no AC, the pool is small and overcrowded.There's mold in the shower, and the bathroom tissue is so cheap that it makes the tissue from HNL airport seem luxurious. The carpet is old, dirty, and worn out. The rooms are small and cramped.They were charging $120 a night plus $20 in tax last Friday evening. Shame on Aqua Hotels for taking advantage of the heated Hawaiian market, and not spending anything to improve this hovel. The room clerks like Jason and Christina are friendly. Christy Ann was also helpful.The people here is the only thing management got right.

This is a cheap option if you don't want beachfront Waikiki accommodation. It's pretty dated, a nice pool area but not too many other amenities.The staff were friendly, helpful and patient. They provided us with a crib and bedding for the baby, and were helpful with transport ideas.We stayed in the biggest room in the hotel apparently - a 1 bedroom suite with separate lounge/kitchen area with a double bed. The kitchen was old but well set up. The bed was comfy. The suite was on the ground floor right by the hotel entrance and street so a bit noisy and we didn't feel 100% safe.Worthwhile if you want cheap, but if you have a few extra $$ I would consider going all out for a beachfront Waikiki experience.

Nice Hotel, very good value for the money. Staff reallY fantastic, if you go to Honolulu stay there!!! Very close to the beach, many channels to choose on TV, awesome pool! Free Wifi! Nothing else to say, strongly recommended! Go there u won't regret it!Daniel

We enjoyed our two weeks at this cosy hotel with exceptional caring staff. Uncrowded pool, lounge chairs under palm trees and the sound of the waterfall made it very special. Do we plan to stay there again -- you bet!

We stayed at the White Sands for 1 week in February 2014. This hotel is excellent value. The location is great - a 5 minute walk from a super swimming beach on Waikiki, minutes from shops, restaurants and public transit. And the staff is wonderful - friendly, helpful, well-informed. The hotel has a very cozy vibe, not "mass produced". The wing we stayed in was quite dated (about early 80s, I would say) but it did the job and at any rate, it was immaculately clean. The bed was comfortable and kitchenette adequately stocked with plates, etc. Could've used a teapot...Our only complaints were that they were a bit chintzy on shower soap (we ran out the last day) and although we always hung our towels to indicate we'd use again (green), most days they were changed.We would stay there again.Sharon Moren

We spent almost one week in Honolulu in this hotel and there is nothing to complain about.Actually we mainly used to hotel just for night sleep as whole day we were out on trips. Anyway we stayed in clean room with basicaly equiped kitchen, noisy air-condition and bathroom. Beside this the hotel has a great location - walk distance to Waikiki beach, or to shopping streets.

well this property is quite a contradiction. it is only 3 floors in 3 buildings surrounding a plush landscape, "lava rock" waterfall and lovely pool. There is no elevator, no room service, no bar, no restaurant, no fitness center & the units themselves are old and faded. U have a kitchen with coffeepot, microwave, small refrig., stove top and pots/place settings for 4.They are slowly getting upgrades from their recent affiliation with aqua and lite hotels. To me it is my home away from home when we r in waikiki. Christianne and Christine know where to go, do and get everything or they will find out. u are part of the family from the 1st visit and after a few times it is hard to know we r not family. this was our 3rd time. last year we were here in feb and there were 5 units of us in the same places as last year. we all like the rooms we have for different reasons but it is just 1 big family, even among the guests. In the early part of the year it is the Canadians and northern states of the us that you will meet the most going south for winter. In July it is the Aussies or Kiwis running north. In sept/oct it is an interesting blend. This is not the least bit fancy but it is down home hospitality that overcomes all it's shortcomings. In a sea of concrete and steel you will find the oasis of the white sands, with it's friendly, affordable atmosphere. It's best assets are the great pool, koi pond under the waterfall, quiet grounds, cooking facitiies and top notch staff. we will be back in July and Oct this year. There r things that could be improved but for me I go back for the ohana welcome and peaceful grounds, It is 3 blocks to the beach and just 1/2 block to shops and restaurants.

No elevators , bathroom , rooms small and very old ! you can hear the noise from the next room and the hall !Well you get what you pay for ! :(The personnel is the only great about the place , very nice and ready to help you with anything!

The staff here knows everybody with many repeat guests. The location is just a few blocks from the beach. The rooms are in need of a makeover but it is a good value for a few days in Hawaii. The staff is the difference.

The White Sands was exactly what we were hoping to find for our first trip to Hawaii: a clean quiet room with kitchen, lots of space, and our own deck overlooking the pool. We loved the greenery, the koi pond, and the privacy. The ambience was exactly our style: kindly and helpful staff, peace and tranquility (after a busy day enjoying Waikiki) and security. We had our privacy yet connected to the little world of White Sands. Yes, it is older but well maintained and clean, clean, clean!

I am a foreign language professor (female) who attended a conference in the area, and I wanted a cheap, but safe hotel. I was very pleased with White Sands. it was cozy, with a lot of families coming and going. I felt safe there, and the personnel at the desk were extremely nice to me and to everyone, especially Christie Ann and Jason. They went out of their way to help me find excursions and stowed my suitcase for a day while I waited for a late plane back to my home. My room was very clean, the air conditioner worked excellently, and I had all the amenities (coffee, soap, shampoo, lotion--in my room, and access to snack and beverage machines) that made my stay very comfortable. There is a souvenir market at the end of the same street as the hotel...about one and a half blocks away. The beach was about 3-4 blocks away. Great eating places were all around. I highly recommend this hotel. I saved a lot of money, and brought home souvenirs that I wouldn't have been able to afford had I stayed in the ridiculously-priced luxury hotels.

Stayed at this hotel during the last day of our week-long trip to Hawaii. The other hotels in Maui and Big Island were very good to decent, so our expectation was modest. However, we were shocked the moment we landed on the property. This is downright shady to say the least. Adding insult to injury was the $25 for parking per night. Yes, you read it right, $25 for parking!! I do realize it is close to the Waikiki beach, but it's not that close too (requires substantial walking to get to the place). So, please stop robbing your one-time customers (I don't think people are going to return here). Rooms are dingy and horrible too. And what the hell is the pool view? It should be called the bath-tub view. Not recommended at all.

I live in Hawaii and last night stayed this hotel for one night since my house was fumigated for termite control. I checked in about 3:30 pm and rested in my room. Just before I went to bed about 12:00 a.m the door was knocked seriously. I asked who was that and somebody said "security". I put on my clothes and opened the door. It was guy with uniform and looked at me skeptically. "Did you register for this room" he asked. I said "yes""Where are other two guys?" he asked rudely . I said " I did not understand what he was saying "He kept talking about some other guys living here earlier. I said there was nobody here but me. He asked me to show my ID and I did . He said " you did not register for the room". I said I did and checked in this afternoon. He said " pack up everything and go with me." He was so skeptical . I really got mad about him. Looked like he did not trust me and I'd better to go down to the front desk. He was clearly wrong and nonsense, I went down the front desk and a clerk searched my name according to my ID and my name was there. He was little embarrassed and the security guy said " we are sorry. We got wrong number" I said " it is ok" but it was so uncomfortable. I'd never had such an nasty experience and please be careful guys.

The hotel was perfect for our 4 nights in Waikiki. The beach, The Duke statue, Hyatt Resort and Spa, Royal Hawaiin, restaurants and shops are only a short walk away. The pool was great. 7 feet deep so I could dive in. The staff, ChristieAnn and Jason, and others were fantastic. The room was large with the kitchenett. No smoking on the whole property, which is nice! We brought oatmeal packages, granola bars and dried fruit from home. Everything is pretty expensive in Hawaii. A pineapple $6.00 Delicious for breakfast. The jug of fresh cold ice water in the lobby is very nice. Mahalo. Would recommend it for the us midrange travelers..

My parents and I stayed 6 nights at this quaint and charming hotel in a very desirable location. From the car/bike rentals, to the local grocer/farm markets, to Waikiki Beach and shopping, everything is within 5-15mins walking distance and further attractions were accessible by bus/ trolley stops around the corner from the hotel about 1 1/2 blks away.To our pleasant surprise the hotel room kitchenette was complete with plates, glasses, utensils, pots and pans, which provided us with a cost efficient solution of eating in instead of out at least once or twice a day. The hotel rooms are a little outdated but, provided us with what we needed; a place to sleep, shower/change and watch the news/ movies on TV at night. Coffee is provided once at the beginning of the stay and free WIFI is accessible in the lobby and by the pool, which was good enough.Front desk was also very friendly and knowledgeable! Blake and Christieann were very helpful in letting us know where to go or what things/ sights there were to do. We would definitely stay at White Sands again and would recommend them to our family and friends. Next time, we'll ask for a poolside view and for a room on the 1st floor.Until next time... Mahalo White Sands!Mae Jamoyot and FamilyBC, Canada

What a nice friendly hotel with staff that was helpful when we needed anything. Room wasn't modern but it did have a bed, sofa sleeper, kitchenette with a small fridge, sink, dishes and coffee pot. It met our needs. Close to everything yet quiet. Does need a new bed. Liked sitting on the lani in the morning to drink a cup of coffee while doing a little work overlooking the pond and pool. Hot tub said it was out of order till 01/30/14 but there was no sign of maintenance work being done. Good value for the money. We would like to stay there again.

We were very pleasantly surprised to find this older hotel right in the middle of Waikiki. It sits among tall condos, a charming oasis with real character, beautiful pool area with waterfall, and the greatest and most accommodating staff, especially ChristieAnn at the front desk. The staff was very helpful, informative, and the people were so diligent in keeping the grounds perfectly groomed and cleaned. You're about 2 blocks from the ocean, and the location is ideal with plenty of shopping and restaurants nearby. We would definitely come back. We truly enjoyed our stay and were sorry to have to leave.

While I agree with other reviews about the staff being friendly, this hotel is in desperate need of upgrades. The second we walked into our room, we were hit with a smell I cant quite describe . . . it was not good. The concept of the room was good - kitchenette, bed, loveseat, bathroom - but very outdated. Not sure if the smell came from the old curtains or old carpet or what it was but even air freshener had trouble covering it. The bedding was old which would have been okay but the sheets did not fit the bed and we woke each morning sleeping on the mattress itself. We asked about an upgrade and the staff advised that all of the rooms were the same. The location is definitely a plus - excellent - a quick walk to all the action on Waikiki. If we hadn't paid in advance, we definitely would have looked elsewhere.

the white sand hotel it was a blessing i will go back every time im there love you guys great in walking distance of everything. you have to see it to believe it. the staff was great very helpful and took care of me.

The front desk staff is amazing which is the best thing about this hotel. The entire hotel needs a rehab. The room smelled like cat urine, the carpet turned my socks black within an hour. Wifi is only available if you sit at the pool area. There is a coffee maker in the room however they only provide coffee the first day and then you must pay $1.05 a day to buy more coffee. The shower head was mounted very low in the shower so my husband who is 5'10 would need to get on his knees to wash his hair. The room has an old window air conditioner so it is extremely loud. There are a few channels to watch T.V. in the room. The bed was not comfortable at all. Overall this hotel is old and needs some love. If you are paying around $50.00 a night and just need a place to rough it, then White Sands is for you. I am by far not a high maintenance person, and I have stayed at some dive places but honestly this was one of the worst experiences I have ever had. Dark, dingy, mold in the shower, poor bedding, no elevator to help with luggage. The spa which was roped off is not a built in one rather an after thought. Luckily we booked the hotel and airfare separate so the manager was nice enough to refund us so that we could go to another hotel. We stayed down the street, paid a few dollars more a night for a clean, updated room with twice the amenities.

We enjoed the hotel very mych. Rooms are clean and kitchen equipment enough for cooking at home. A nice balcony with a view over the aquarium with goldfishes. A perfect choice if you don't like un-personal hotels with 40 floors. One disadvantage is that the Internet access only is available in the reception are if yu don't pay extra.

We stayed here in mid December 2013 and really loved the hotel. White Sands is an old fashioned style hotel - low rise and with surrounding a pool. It is refreshingly different to the glut of high rises ion Waikiki. The rooms are basic but with lots of room. Staff lovely!. They don't have many car parks but we had no issues. It is a short walk to the beach but this wasn't a problem

If you are disabled, though, there are no elevators so you will have to ask for a room on the ground level. And parking is somewhat of an issue. We stayed here in late July/early August of 2013 for just a few nights, before going on a cruise and then stayed at a different hotel when we came back, and we wished we had just stuck with this one. Everyone was so friendly and helpful and the hotel and the room were fantastic. It was a little more expensive than the second hotel we stayed at in Waikiki, but I think that little bit extra was well worth it.The street the hotel is on is not exactly pretty, so you will want to get a room with a view of the pool area. The pool area is gorgeous! Lovely palm trees, plants everywhere, a little waterfall with a koi pond at the bottom and benches to sit at. We had a little balcony and we loved sitting there amidst the trees. There's a barbecue by the pool for anyone to use. As for other amenities, there's a laundry room on site. The room was clean and it had a little kitchenette. Not very spacious, but not too cramped. The location was perfect, just a few blocks away from Waikiki Beach, right down the street from the International Marketplace. Parking is not very good though, there are a limited amount of parking spaces in front of the hotel, which are available on a first come first serve basis, and for which they charge you $25 per night to use (but it seems this is common of hotels in Waikiki). No disabled spaces offered.This hotel is ideal for anyone who would rather spend their time in Hawaii in a place that has a real Hawaiian feel. Very gentle and relaxed, we were happy to stay there and will be happy to stay again!

I stayed here from December 21 until December 30th of 2013. Everything was clean and I felt the property was safe. It is a bit of a walk to the beach but each circuitous route took me through new shopping areas I hadn't found the day before. The desk personnel, especially Christieann, was very helpful in directing me to places I wanted to see and helping me find great local restaurants that weren't in the guidebooks, etc. I would recommend that anyone looking for a reasonably priced, convenient hotel while in Waikiki book a room at the White Sands.

This is a nice hotel in the right location and with excellent staff! Spacious room and all you need is at hand. Only 10 min to beach and 2 min to supermarkets and shopping. Would recommend this to anyone coming to Waikiki to stay.

We make sure to stay at White Sands every time we come to Honolulu. It is clean, conveniently located, reasonably priced and most especially we love the staff. Christie Ann, Cristina and Rogie are excellent in friendliness, service and professionalism. We also loved having the kitchenette which is always well equipped. The only down side is the internet is really slow and spotty. All in all, we love the White Sands and look forward to our next stay.

It's not like your regular hotel on the mainland. The open-air lobby is chill and the building are more like low-rise apartment buildings surrounding the pool. They had to get a guy to come install a cable modem just so I had the internet. But it had a full kitchen, the bed was comfy, and it's centrally located. If you're expecting a Holiday Inn, you'll be thrown off. If you want convenience and don't want to pay a lot, this place is great.

This Thanksgiving time visit was even better than in years past. The waterfall covers the city noises, and koi swim around two fountains. Often at night, after a busy day, I would sit by the waterfall and just enjoy the water, the fish, and the tropical greenery. Yes, my room is always clean and comfortable, but the folks who work there make the White Sands a special place. Not brand new and super modern, but warm and friendly. I always feel the hospitality of a long ago Hawaii and am never ready to leave. Ellen

74.00 a night is not a bad price for one night. The room was also clean and the decor was just like a 5 star hotel. Also having a microwave and a fridgerator was convenient. I'd stay there again BUT next time I'm bringing some ear plugs! I didn't get a good night's sleep because some thugs across the street were yelling at each other and playing their boom boxes at 3 am!

Aloha , we stayed at this little gem from the 22nd to the 30th.The hotel is close to all the happening spots in Honolulu for a fraction of the price. The staff are very helpful and always go an extar mile from Atte Rosalind who made sure our "house " was cleaned every day,Blake at reception,Sister Christianne and the rest of the staff at the hotel. Before booking a trip with the tours ;ask at the desk ; most of the trip-tours that were charging 50-60 to see the island could be done by a 2.50$ bus journey.Mahalo Mahalo for taking care of us. We had the best holiday ; felt just like we were at home, we are already planning the trip for next year, sofia and shemi esq

I had a great experience at this hotel! If you are a high maintenance this place is not for you. There are no elevators in the hotel, If you are staying on the 2nd and 3rd floor you have to carry your luggage up the stairs yourself. We didnt mind.This hotel is quite old but the price and location were wonderful. The furniture and the bedding was old but clean. The carpets in our room were clean. Our room was right above the front doors of the hotel so we heard everything from the bar next door and anyone on the street, but we did not mind we still got our sleep.If you were needing Wi-Fi to work well in your room, you will not find it. We love the back pool and the waterfall it was so relaxing. If your flight is booked for later then your checkout time they have a luggage room as well we had the pleasure of getting to use the towels and pool during this waiting period. The front desk also arranged for our shuttle to pick us up to get to the airport on time.The front desk staff Christeann and Jason were very kind and friendly. I will be using this hotel again in the future!
user_name:
Francine O
Burnaby, British Columbia, Canada

review_body: I have to say this hotel had mixed reviews, so I was a bit apprehensive. However my experience was wonderful. I loved my room #202, as soon as I opened my balcony , they waterfalls were right in front of me, and the sound was so relaxing. I had a nice little kitchen, which was supplied with all the utensils( steak knife, butter knife, forks, spoons, wine opener, can opener). All sizes of plates including cereal plate, and tea cups. Two different size pans, and frying pan, where you can make omelets or anything else you need to fry. All the workers there were friendly and helpful. The only thing is in my bathroom there was a steep elevation to get to the shower, I really mean very steep. It was not a problem for me but might have been a problem for an elderly or obese person. There was hand railing to hold on to help you up. The only thing I would like to suggest, is that you add a sign "Please hold on to the railing when going up and coming down the shower." Just so no one forgets, otherwise its very easy to fall especially when you are wet after the shower. Another thing is I highly recommend a "do not disturb sign" for the door, most hotels have this sign and it is a big help when you don't want a maid knocking on your door when you are resting.But I immensely enjoyed my stay at the White Sands, the location is perfect, the hotel atmosphere is cozy and friendly. I would not hesitate to stay here again when I come back.

We stayed here on the first lag of our honeymoon and the room we got was pretty disappointing; the walls were dirty, the furniture old and weathered and the florescent lighting was horrible. A fresh coat of paint, next bedding and better lighting and I'd have given this place 1 more point. The pool area was nice, however we had originally asked for a room with a pool view and we got a room with a view of the wall and a hallway to other suites - so people were constantly walking by which didn't make for much privacy. When I asked to move rooms the front desk did not make it very easy and I was given the ring-around so we opted to stay put - even though I know there were other empty rooms. There seemed to be a bit of a falseness to the good manners and kindness of the front desk, as we were only treated well after we checked out at which point we were asked to fill out a survey and told that we would get a nicer room the next time we stayed. So there is some obvious reward for loyalty here where returning guests seem to get the better rooms. The one staff member at the front forgot to book our shuttle to the airport after she talked us out of taking the city bus (which would have been much cheaper) and she never called the shuttle for us so we were stuck taking a very expensive cab ride. One positive was the manager was sympathetic to this and paid for half our cab ride. The location is great, so if you're not planning on spending a lot of time in your room and are on a budget - then this is a good option. One other warning - the walls are thin and we could hear our next door neighbor's television set pretty clearly.

I booked this for the decent price and location, and that is what I got. It is clean, but old. The staff is very friendly. The room itself is very outdated. The bed covers look like they are from the 60's, and one has a burn mark.
user_name:
Stephanie Y
Boston, Massachusetts, United States

review_body: Its one of the cheaper near to waikiki beach. We have rented moderate room so we could save some money so our room was without pool view and above the laundry, maybe think about paying more for different view. Generally hotel looks and probably is very old. On one hand you see age dirt in the carpet, walls etc. it looks really old on rusty on the other hand you see staff all day cleaning and vacuming those places. Staff on reception is very warm, helpfull is the better of this hotel. Also you have to pay for wi-fi and parking. And our aircon was not working.

We have stayed at White Sands a number of times and have never been disappointed. The willingness of the staff to "go the extra mile" makes White Sands a great place to stay. The location is excellent - the hotel is a short walk to the best food market in Waikiki and is in close proximity to a number of inexpensive eating places. This is not five star accommodation, but it is not backpackers either. The rooms are clean and comfortable. Try for one on the ground floor - there are no elevators.

I've been staying in this hotel for 5 nights, and the price was pretty good. The room was clean and big, it has the kitchenette (fridge, microvave, oven, but the most important - they had ice in the freezer!), I think the place was very safe, but you need to pay 2$/day for using the safe inside your room. The bathroom was ok-not perfect but not bad as well, there was no tub but just shower, which was pretty big. Nice thing was the extra closet, iron and good tv and a . The bed was very comfortable. There is a grocery store just next to the hotel.The staff is friendly and helpful!! The outside pool is avaliable and looks nice.It was like 10 minutes walking from the waikiki beach, so it could be better, but the recreation area - pubs, restaurants was really close, as well as bus stops (next block). The internet connection doesn't work in rooms, you need to go downstairs close to the pool, anyway it was really slow and you need to extra pay for it.The building is quite old and haven't been renewed since ages and the walls are pretty thin, so you can hear your neighbours sometimes. There is no elevator but just 3 levels.So it is not very luxurious place but its enough good if you are going to spend just the nights in and go out during the day. Anyway, the price is very good and I would recommend it.

We had amazing time here, this place exceeded all our expectations. I would highly recommend the first room on the ground floor on the left hand side from the pool - very neat, refreshing shower, coffee maker with complimentary brand coffee, well functioning aircon for those hot Honolulu nights, there were even extra extension cord by the fridge, which was very handy. I have never slept so well in my life, very peaceful room. We also had a pleasure dealing with a friendly young man in the reception who's customer services skills were second to none, he even passed on the landline phone so we could call the booze cruise company to book our maitaj cruise! Best of all this place is only seconds away from the famous Tavern, and other happening places such as Tsunamis, where you can meet friendly locals, enjoy nachos, popcorn and drinks. We will be staying again next year to catch up with our new Honolulu friends, and hopefully we'll be lucky enough to get the same room by the pool!Aloha!

The staff at White Sands makes you feel like family. Christieann even asks about family that didn't return! The hotel is centrally located, right off Kuhio, and close enough to walk many places. There is parking for those with cars, and only a block walk to The Bus stop for those without. Kudos to the entire staff. Mahalo and aloha! Kat

We just stayed two nights at this hotel, and had a wonderful experience. The staff is really nice, very full of Aloha!! I can't stress enough how wonderful they were to us, and so sweet to my son. My son even got a hug from the cleaning lady. The room was not only large, but clean, and even had a stove top and pots and pans. The pool was clean and just the right temperature. The bathroom was pretty large. Central location. A/C Just absolutely excellent, I will be happy to go back any time with my family.

White Sands is a nice, reasonably priced, hotel/motel in a truly great location. Travelers who do not require luxury of Waikiki resort hotels can stay just steps away from all the glamour (well ;)) and from the iconic beach. The whole Waikiki district, Honolulu Zoo, and even Diamond Head lighthouse area are in walking distance. People who do not mind longer walks can make it even to Honolulu Historical district on foot! (Really. And you'll get the genuine real-Honolulu experience). There is an Enterprise rental office across the street so getting a car is easy. The location, however, equals a lot of trouble with parking. The hotel offers some parking spaces but they are both limited and IMO expensive (smthg. like 25 USD per night). If you are extremely lucky, you can park for free on Ala Wai just behind the corner or for a better price (1 USD per hour) at Honolulu Zoo. The hotel is also close to TheBus stops including services to the Airport and Pearl Harbour. We did not use taxi while in Honolulu.Service was very good and the people in White Sands helpful. We arrived before check in time and were allowed to change in the bathroom and to leave our luggage at the reception. Our room featured a kitchenette (I did not remember that from the reservation and was nicely surprised). The balcony with pool view was also very nice. Internet was not free but the price was not too high and there was a with free wi-fi Starbucks just behind the corner. Our stay was great but we got a little surprise in the form of a nice cockroach spotted in the bathroom the last day (of our 7 days stay). Until then, I had no concern about cleanliness, so this little guy really surprised me. Anyway, I think that was just a irregularity and White Sands deserves a recommendation.

Great central location.Terrific staff - really friendly and very helpful which is what makes this place. It's an older hotel in need of freshening up (coat of paint and some new floor coverings in corridors would help). You get what you pay for so don't expect the decor to blow you away or have luxury. We were booked into a 'city' view room, but when we saw it we asked for an upgrade to pool view because the city view outlook was a concrete wall. The room we upgraded to was fine - much nicer outlook (which lifted my flailing spirits). So my advice is book a pool view room. Everything worked - good - showers and doors intact. Its only a 3 storey building and we were offered help with our luggage. Would definitely go back. Lovely staff.

The location of White Sands is perfect.. easy flat walk to Waikiki Beach, eating places, the market and shopping. While the buildings are older (and so is some of the decor) the roomy units are kept very clean, kitchens are well appointed and the beds are fresh and comfortable. Staff are super friendly and helpful with willing suggestions for sightseeing. We found Manager Lendy and Receptionist Kristieanne especially delightful. The setting is super pleasant with well kept and attractive grounds and pool. The new flat screen TVs are great.This was our third stay, and if, like us, you would rather spend your additional tourist dollar on travel and sightseeing rather than somewhere posh to sleep, I don't think you could get better value for money. We will be back again next year.
user_name:
Sylvie W
Auckland Central, New Zealand

review_body: Stayed at this hotel in September for a week. This is the worst place we have ever stayed in. The only reasonable thing is the location. The beds were dreadful, doors fallen off vanity in bathroom, shower so low you had to duck down to wash your hair, balcony tiny, no lift, stairs outside so you get wet if it rains, charged extra for in- room safe, pool area looking rather neglected, no umbrellas around pool and not many lounges at pool, sheets on bed only changed once during the week, shower not cleaned daily, paid for a pool view and could only glimpse it through the bushes, looked at brick wall instead, room next door had a couch but we did not, and then to top off the experience we were charged twice for our room and had to wait 2 weeks to be reimbursed the money! If you can afford to stay elsewhere DO IT!

I loved the Tender Loving Care that I received from all Staff members, including check-in with the lovely Hawaiian gal; Christieann, maintenenance men who helped with internet hookup and various special requests I had, and afternoon/ night crew who were also very very friendly. The hotel had a warmth to it that I can only describe as 'Old Hawaiian Style'. The pool was very nice: warmer/ cleaner than other hotel's I've visited. The vegetation, rivers, waterfall, and topography were lovely and enchanting. The rooms were large condo-style and had all that I needed to feel as if at home.I would stay there again anytime if my travel led me to the area.

Our first time in Hawaii and were very scepticle about the hotels in the area, however, we were pleasantly surprised. The front desk staff, Jason & Christieann, were very friendly and helpful in making suggestions to activities and eateries in the area and how to get to them. Rooms were clean, roomy and comfortable. Sure, the furnishings are older, but, in good shape. Housekeeping staff was very friendly and helpful when needed. The courtyard around the pool is beautiful, better looking then some other hotels in the area. The waterfall and tropical landscaping is good looking and pleasant to be in. I was impressed that the staff kept it well kept and clean. Staff was constantly sweeping and keeping the area clean. We felt very welcome and comfortable. Will definitely recommend to friends & family planning a trip to Hawaii. The price and the location are perfect. A couple of blocks from the beach, one of main streets at end of block, bus stop, groceries,or restaurants and bars around the corner. Perfect location for the price!

Back again for another year! Had another wonderful experience at the White Sands! Thank you to the staff for always being friendly and making my home away from home feel cozy and wonderful! Using the bbq to cook my Costco meat was really amazing, and cost me way less than going out to eat. I love to go for long walks on the canal and check out the fish and coral in the water.
user_name:
Gary H
Gresham, Oregon, United States

review_body: Stayed at this hotel 5 years ago when it was the Celebrity Resorts timeshares. Not much has changed. The put my wife and I in a room with two twin beds. We could have waited until another room was available but we were so tired we didn't care. The bedspread and pillows were fair, the bedspread had cigarette burn holes in it. The courtyard and pool area are are kept very well. The hot tub is closed and will not re-open.This hotel is in an ideal location and the staff couldn't have been better. The rooms on the 2nd and 3rd floors have no views whatsoever except for an ugly apt bldg.The shower did have mildew in it.

This is our second time at this property this year. Christianne and Christina greet each and every guest like you are coming home and they have known you for years-even on your 1st time. This is not a fancy hotel by any means. There is no restaurant, fitness center or pool bar, but close to plenty, out both the front and back door. They are just 1 block from the only supermarket in Waikiki. The rooms are old and dated but the beds are fine for comfy sleep. They have new flat screen tv's, and internet is available. The internet is good for 24 hours of use, over 12 days. quite cool esp when u just want to look up something local quickly. I think they are all units with kitchen facilities, both times we had a kitchen, although the layout is different in each of the buildings. It's nice to be able to prepare a meal or 2, esp when staying for a while. The grounds are lush with foliage, especially given all the concrete that surrounds the area. The pool is very nice-7 feet deep and lots of chairs to sit around. It there are only a few people at the pool at 1 time, it seems. we hang there all day, very relaxing. The new manager is quite a pip-full of energy and very cheerful. What emanates here is true aloha spirit, that makes you feel at home and truly part of their family in a very relaxed, laid back environment. Gives me a real warm fuzzy. We are booking our Feb trip before we leave.

I visit my son often in Honolulu and am always on the look-out for inexpensive stays. White Sands Hotel was great for my budget with clean rooms and super-friendly staff. Christieann's smile greeted me every morning! There is a small well-kept pool and common area with a "waterfall". I realize 'no-frills' isn't for everyone, and finding a good budget hotel in Honolulu is a crap shoot, but I think White Sands Hotel was exactly what I was looking for in cleanliness, hospitality, location and price. Thanks to all for a great stay!

The hotel is outdated, the rooms are painted in white but look tired, the bed and the pillows are fair, bedspread has cigarette burn holes in, not so pleasant! However, friendly staff and great location! One block away from the beach and high end shopping!

The staff are friendly and courteous. The prices are excellant. The place is clean and great for long vacations with do it yourself laundry facilities. It is centrally located and in the heart of Waikiki.

We headed to Hawaii on our Honeymoon, and arrived as tired as could be to wait 45 min for a shuttle from the airport to the hotel. My dad had surprised us with the trip, and we were booked to stay at the White Sands Hotel. Which online, this hotel looks ok, but in person I was disgusted and wanted to leave Hawaii all together. We checked in and thought it couldn't be too bad...They booked us on the 3rd floor and sent us on our way. After about 5-10 minutes I returned to the desk to ask where the elevator was, only to find out there wasn't one! So, we had to haul all our luggage up 3 flights of stairs after traveling all day on our Honeymoon! Once in the hallway, we noticed a sour smell and more tears came thinking this can't be happening. We got into the room and there were so many stains I had to quit looking around! There was black mold in the shower, stains on the lamp, walls, night table, mattress, sheets walls, and more. The room smelled horribly, and there was a little twin rollaway bed in the room as well. It's our honeymoon, why would we need that? That doesn't count as a 2 bed room! After a horrible freak out and some balling, we decided to call him and let him know that we couldn't stay there. We returned to the front desk to inquire about anything else, only to pass by a Hot Tub that was boarded off, and had a sign saying they couldn't run it per the Federal Government. I thought that's a bad sign that there's no hope here! We get to the desk and they said that they could move us in the morning, but that it would be the same type of room. There was no way it'd be any better, so we stared walking around with our luggage at about 2am our time, only to find everywhere booked. No one local had even heard of The White Sands, and it seemed like people were living there..Finally, my dad found us a room at the Courtyard by Marriott. We told the front desk that we would not be staying there and we'd take care of everything in the morning. They were nice, but the place was NOT!!! DO NOT STAY HERE! Unless you don't care what you sleep in...

This is a great little hotel for the money,right in the middle of everything,shops,bars etc..The beach is just a short 1 block walk over..The rooms were a little dated,but very clean,( maid service everyday)..A nice little pool,right in a sun trap..Staff very helpful,with lots of good advice for the area.Would recommend this hotel again...

this is in a fantastic central location - it has very friendly staffIt is very very basic, the bathrooms need renovation (we had two rooms one on each side) - but suits the price they chargethe pool is suitable as there are not many around using it - great for a quick dip in-between activitiesmy only real negative - is that you can only get internet sitting at the pool - I was in the first room at ground level - two steps to my room & it disconnectedbut good basic price with wonderful staff

First of all, I would like to stress out, that I will recommend this hotel. I really liked the kitchenette, sink and microwave owen - this can save you a lot of money in rather more expensive Waikiki neighbourhood. The courtyard with the pool is great! The Waikiki beach and a lot of places of interest are nearby.What I did not like was the internet access. Even the WiFi near the lobby is not free. The rooms looked a little bit worn out. The A/C was noisier.

We stayed for 6 nights in this hotel after spending 6 nights in Kona on the Big Island (this was our first trip to Hawaii). This hotel was perfectly acceptable, but I guess we found it a little disappointing after having stayed in a one bedroom ocean view condo in Kona for a similar price (rooms are just sooo much cheaper in Kona than Waikiki).My husband choose this hotel as it was the cheapest he could find that included a kitchenette. He wanted to be able to prepare some meals to save on costs. In the end, we did not really use the kitchenette and both agreed that we probably should have not have bothered getting a kitchenette and instead stayed in a bit nicer property for a similar price (or perhaps spent just a bit more). I really have no major complaints, but the hotel is older (which we knew when booking) and the room was smaller than I expected (from the pictures online I thought it would be larger - but I think hotel pictures online have a tendency to be misleading that way).Pros:-Staff members are all very nice, particularly Christieann.-Waikiki location close to nice restaurants and lots of shopping-Relatively cheap rooms (for Waikiki)-Pool area was pretty. Pool was a nice temperature and well maintained (the pool is not very large, but from my research most Waikiki hotels generally have only small pools).-Rooms and grounds were all very clean.-Rooms have flat screen TV's with a good selection of channels (we were able to keep up with Breaking Bad!).Cons:-Small, older roomsAll in all, we had a pleasant stay, but I think I would try a different hotel for our next visit.

The hotel was somewhat dated, but nice people and a great value in Honolulu. It was near the International Market, the upscale shops, Margaritaville restaurant/bar, and Waikiki Beach. The flowers and shrubs give you an idea of what to see around the island and tiki idols in the courtyard were a nice touch! Books and games available on the deck seemed like I was visiting friends and the pool was small, but very clean and nice.

Great hotel to stay at for a great price. The rooms have kitchen areas with all utensils and such included. It's in a great location, tons of access to the bus stops. I stayed for 3 nights and would go back again!

My husband and I stayed for a few days in August at the White Sands and spent a really pleasant time there. The staff is friendly and always smiling. Cristina welcomed us the first day and made us feel comfortable for our first time in Hawaii. The team there knows the area very well and always recommends the best places! The hotel is greatly located and is quiet at night too. The pool area is beautiful and really calm. The hotel has an amazing Hawaiian vibe and I would definitely recommend it!

The staff at the White Sands were friendly and helpful. We were given a free upgrade on arrival and the room was clean and large with a comfortable bed and nice en suite. The pool and spa area was excellent but the location of the hotel was best of all just a short stroll to markets, shopping and dining.

A 3 star hotel. There is NO internet in the rooms ! they charge for internet in the lobby. Come on America you can do better than that. Good location. Easy walk to the beach, shops, public transport, food court & restaurants. Starting to show its age. There are better places for less $ within walking distance.

we stayed at this hotel for a week and really enjoyed our time there. the hotel is a low rise, which lended to the ambiance for us. the only drawback is that there is no elevator.we had a room overlooking the pool and were very surprised at how quiet it was, especially at night.the room decor is a bit tired but completely adequate. the kitchenette is thoughtfully laid out with everything you need. wifi is by the pool but we had no trouble accessing it from our balcony. there is a very small fee for this. the location is excellent, walking distance to the beach and just around the corner from the awesome food pantry.the staff are super friendly, especially christieann, and even the house keeper for our room, 210, was lovely.we will definitely stay here again...great value.
user_name:
Tessa R
Perth, Western Australia, Australia

review_body: We were looking into budget hotels in Waikiki and thought that this one would be a good deal. Checking in was fine and the location was pretty good. The room was horrible, very run down. I didn't even want to open the blinds because the view was so horrible and creepy, looking into an alleyway. I wanted to check out right away but we paid for the night. We booked another hotel for the rest of our stay. We could smell weed coming into our room the whole night, just making the whole experience even worse. Some of staff was helpful and nice but not all. Would not ever go back.

We stayed there for 12 days. The hotel isn't in a big building, which is pleasant, because kind of easier and faster to go out than big resort. It's a cosy place, with a nice yard with swimming pool. Although it's not beach front, it's pretty much in the center of Waikiki, that means a good location to go anywhere from there. What I apprecitated the most, was the very friendly staff at the reception.

This hotel had a pool - bonusThe rooms had air conditioning - bonusThere was no WI-FI - not greatThe rooms were a bit dated - depends if that bothers you.The staff were very nice, and very helpful.Good hotel in a good location.

We stayed here on our last night in HL, as a departure hotel.Had we known what it was like, we wouldn't have booked. Yes, it's "cheaper" for Waikiki in terms of rack rates, however if you were to walk into another better hotel or looked at last minute deals, you'd have got a far nicer room for a very similar price. Ie - we stayed at Aqua Wave when one of our flights were cancelled, and they had far nicer rooms for $120 vs. the $100 we paid at White Sands.This is not a hotel; it's a motel. Built around the 40s, the rooms are white washed and haven't been updated. Definitely felt like we'd gone back in time.If you're just after a cheap room for a night; and don't want to spend any time there, then this place is ok. If you're after a hotel where you can be comfortable and chill out in the rooms - probably not the place you want to be.Having said that service was fine, the pool is fine, and the room we had was quiet. Wifi is very expensive and not included in the rack rate.

This hotel surprised us as we have stayed at several more expensive hotels on Waikiki beach over the last 30 years, but had never stayed at a more budget friendly hotel like White Sands. We were very impressed in all areas, especially with the excellant staff members and affordability. The location is good and certainly walkable to all areas in Waikiki including the beach. The bus and trolley stops are close by if you don't want to walk around very much. The rooms are clean and functional. The bathroom was large and well lighted which I like. There was plenty of hot water too. The pool area and front desk area are very nice & quaint. Overall our experience was wonderful. Blake did an excellant job as the front desk associate. In fact, he provided superior service which we appreciate very much and didn't expect at this price point. He was always very helpful and willing to put fourth extra effort to make sure our stay was great. We look forward to seeing him again next time when we return. Christy Anne always had a beautiful smile on her face. The other employees were also helpful & friendly. Parking is the only concern that you may want to be aware of as there is only a small number of parking spaces available on a 1st come basis. Off site over flow parking probably isn't bad if the parking lot is full. I would recommend a smaller car as the spaces are small at White Sands. We had a car only two days of our stay and were fortunate enough to park at White Sands. We have stayed at so many hotels on Waikiki & this hotel gets a thumbs up in our book. We give this hotel a 10 out of 10 for a budget friendly hotel. It exceeded our expectations given the price we paid.

We had a pleasant stay in August at this property. We chose it for the size, cost and location. We have been to Waikiki before so a beach view was not required. The location is perfect for not being on the beach. Visiting family required both a car and ease of getting through Waikiki to Pearl Harbor, and the access to head that way was convenient. We were happy to have gotten a parking spot. The staff was pleasant, and quickly fixed a bad television connection. The common areas were kept clean. The bed was firm, but comfortable. It was nice to have a kitchen for fixing breakfasts and snacks. The lanai was a welcome spot to relax and look out at the courtyard and pool. Our room shared a lanai with the next door room and we were happy to have friendly neighbors.From reading other reviews, it seems as some rooms may be more updated. We were in room 340 and it was not. I would give this hotel 5 stars if it were not for two things. The carpet looked okay with lights off, but when turned on, it was extremely worn, stained, and did not feel clean when walking without flip flops. Although the bathroom was clean, the toilet seat really needed to be replaced. It was stained yellow and had bubble wear on the seat making it look very disgusting. We would consider staying here again if Waikiki becomes a destination.

I found this place very nice, comfortable room,. The Manager Lendy and her assistant Cristina was very kind and friendly. The lady Angela that cleaned our room was very nice. it was one block to the International market and close to Waikiki beach. When we arrived the room was ready so we did not have to wait. The room had every thing to our convenience. a kitchenette and a large bathroom with a large closet. The pool and the garden area was very tranquil, very relaxing place.t

Great location. Excellent service and all very friendly and helpful. Very clean and good value for your dollar and we really recommend a stay here for a nice quiet holiday and perfect for families.a big thank you to the staff on duty who gave us a room immediately on our early morning arrival after our long flight from Australia.

I stayed there for 3 days and its not too bad. You can walk to everywhere and there is a licensed general store just 3 doors down.The room was a bit mouldy in places like the bottom of the curtains but was generally clean.There is a pool that's fine for cooling off and the staff were friendly and helpful.Its not the best for families but better for couples or singles.I paid $150 a night and think that is about its upper limit.I would stay there again for a short stay.

Just as the title suggests, this hotel was 'fine' - not GREAT, not TERRIBLE, just fine; and when you're paying about $120 a night I suppose you can't expect much more (not in Waikiki at least). The rooms were a little older but the pool was nice and the location is close enough to the main strip but not sooo close that you hear everything. Three downers for this hotel: They don't offer free parking for their guests, so you can pay to use their carpark or there is a carpark across the road (from memory, the parking across the road was cheaper). Both have a tendency to fill up though, leaving visitors with cars somewhat stranded. Second - They don't offer free wifi and Third - we'd travelled from Aus to HI and had arrived that morning at about 10am. At the time of booking we emailed White Sands asking to have an early check in as we'd just be coming off a long international flight. When we got to the counter they advised us that unfortunately our room wasn't ready yet. Understandable but annoying.Apart from the above though there is really nothing wrong with the place - if you're the kind of traveler who is interested in going out and exploring and you're just looking for a clean, nearby place to rest your head at night (that isn't going to cost a fortune) then this is it.

We found this White Sands property in Waikiki after digging a bit in TripAdvisor. It had what we were looking for: close to the famous beach, a swimming pool and garden, reasonable prices and good ratings. When we arrived there for check-in, heavily loaded and with a baby, they changed our room on the 3d floor, street facing, to a ground-floor pool-facing room , which saved us the stairs and in fact represented a handsome upgrade. There were no baby-cots available, but a single bed in addition of our queen size was used instead.The room was excellent with a nice kitchen corner and an en-suite bathroom. The French windows open directly to the pool area. We discovered - too late - there was a BBQ gas fired fixture available there.The hotel is well situated in Waikiki, close to shops and restaurants and a 7 minute walk from the beach. A good run circuit around the nearby golf or up to Diamond point is a delight in the mornings.The pool is lovely, as surrounded by highrise buildings hidden in the garden trees. The staff is very courteous and understanding, providing us with free internet tickets and giving sensible advice about Waikiki. The room tidying and cleaning was excellent and included the dish-washing of the kitchen.We used the "speedy-shuttle" service to/from Honolulu airport and would recommend that too, provided at least 3 hours is foreseen between hotel pick-up and flight departure. It is a good value at 60 US$ return for 2 people and a baby.

Nice hotel, good value for price/location/service. Staff is friendly and helpfusmall pool but who cares you have the beach two blocks away.super well located. relatively quiet.rooms are clean, old style but it works with a small kitchen area too.only lousy thing: the WiFi is really weak, it works but only in the lobby area so it can be a bit of a pain at times.I will go back there. It is in the heart of Waikiki

I stayed in both White Sand Hotel and Waikiki Gateway on several ocassions. Overall, I would like the White Sand Hotel for they have a grill, a garden, and more comfortable bed. now bad things first: I think White Sand Hotel is pricy compared to Waikiki Gateway Hotel, Their rooms and furniture are older (some rooms). I don't like the some parts of the garden, some balconies. They look old and have molds. In one case, I got a couch, sofas that looks horribly old, with stains on it. I also stay in hostels in Maui before, and would say, their rooms are much newer, or look newer (for $40/day compared to >$100/day.)good things: they have flat screen TVs and kitchen on every room. Waikiki gateway doesn't. They have a garden with a grill. I don't care about ocean view that much. they have exceptional service. You have to cross the lobby every time you get out of the hotel, and the staffs always see and greet you.In fact, I make friend with one of them. So. I think White Sands Hotel staffs are super friendly. I also witness them one time, trying to resolve an issue with another customer, they are very patient.I remember Christian, cristina, John, and another guy who usually work in the afternoon. They are funny and cool people.
user_name:
Minh P
Honolulu, Hawaii, United States

review_body: The most outstanding part of this hotel was the consistently friendly and accommodating staff, particularly Christieann, Blake and Christine. Other staff members smiled, nodded, and greeted whenever walking by, and it felt genuine.The pool is pretty good, didn't use the nearby grill but other guests did and it's nice to have the option available.Room was clean, comfy and overall a good value- the kitchenette was useful and the security patrolled regularly. I would recommend this hotel to my family and friends, and would return myself. I also really liked the daily newspapers.Mahalo to all of the White Sands staff for their aloha!

It's not a super resort; it's not the best hotel in Waikiki; it's not oceanfront. But it's a good regular hotel (with almost no service), honestly priced (paid something around USD 100 a day), stayed 1 week, nothing wrong happened; reservation worked fine; would stay again, if prices were good. It's a little bit old and doesn't smell great either. Has a good pool and a parking lot. Right in front of it there's a public parking, but it's always full; you can also park on the street (ALA WAI boulevard), for free...but, again, it's hard to find a place (as it always is in waikiki).

we stayed three nights here, we arrived to early for check in they locked our cases away while we walked around the shops for a few hours we came back a few hours later very tired from our trip to find the room still not ready, was told it would be 3pm, we were finally given our keys at 3.30pm to find that there was no elevator, two elderly women were given no assistance with our heavy bags, one of the guests gave us a hand up the outside stairwell, the room was rather old and had an odd smell around the kitchen area, bathroom was very old and dingy, although it was close to the shops, at night we had to pass a local bar where there were drunks outside smoking and the police were called most nights very worrying, the one plus was there was one nice staff member on reception who when we left actually arranged for our bags to be brought down for us, I don't think I will stay there again, but for a budget hotel and location would be ideal for backpackers

Great place to stay. Everything is so close by. Example: International Market Place, beach, tour bus stop, shopping, pharmacy, photo, restaurants, grocery store. This time I noticed updates. New flat screen tv"s & remodeled lobby with fresh lemon water & beautiful flowers. The staff are all great & so helpful. Did most of my business with Christine & Christieann. Whenever there was a question with scheduling a tour or needing directions, Christieann was so very helpful. She deserves a special award. She is one of the reasons I enjoy staying there. A very warm, friendly person. Christine is special too. My girlfriends loved White Sands. It was there first time. Can't wait to return. I recommend this hotel to everyone I talk to. Kitchenette is a good feature. Love this place. joann_wood@yahoo.com

We loved the White Sands Hotel and will definately stay here again. We would also recommend this hotel to anyone. The hotels is older but has GREAT STAFF and a Beautiful courtyard !!! The staff was very courtious and helpful. :) The location was awesome your are near everything. I do suggest that when you make a reservation you request a courtyard view. I will post pictures later.

The staff at the Whitesands made our trip the success as it was. A Big thanks to Christieann who followed up helping us find a lost wallet and giving us advice on what to do while were there! The pool was a great place to lay down by and there was a grocery store to stock your fridge just around the corner.

Thankfully we stayed only one night. The men working after 10 pm were not helpful. We had to search for our rooms. The rooms were very dated and the top of the bedhead was covered in dust. The shower was dingy and the grouting around the sink in the bathroom leaked over the bench when the tap was turned on. Old fashioned coffee maker, did have dishes but where was the cutlery? The air conditioner was very loud and the curtain did not cover the whole window so light was coming into the room all night.

I booked this hotel through Hotwire's program where you see the price first and then figure out the hotel after you've already paid. I just wanted a basic and cheap place for my family and I to stay for 2 nights before we boarded our cruise ship and ended up being overall impressed with the what I got for the price I paid.I booked two rooms for a total of 6 people (3 people per room) and upon paying for my reservation through Hotwire, I called the hotel to confirm that the rooms we would get would be able to comfortably accommodate 3 people each. At that time, I was told on the phone that some rooms only accommodate two people (full size bed) and some can accommodate 3 people (1 full bed + 1 twin bed), so I requested that both our rooms had the 1 Full + 1 twin. The White Sands staff stated that this was not guaranteed because we booked through Hotwire instead of with the hotel directly, but they would make a comment/note on their computer to see if they could accommodate my request. At this point, I called Hotwire and all they would tell me is that my 2 rooms were guaranteed to accommodate the 6 people and I should call them if there was any trouble after I get there.When I showed up, I found that we got 2 rooms right next to each other and each room had 2 full size beds - so better than what we were promised on the phone when I called - a good thing!Overall, this hotel is not going to blow you away with awesomeness, but it's not going to leave you completely disappointed either. Dollar for dollar, I think you will be impressed. So, if you're a value conscientious consumer, I highly recommend this hotel. If you are looking for an ultra-luxury experience, book your stay at Trump International Hotel instead.Pro's:+The courtyard and pool area are absolutely stunning/beautiful.+The pool is sized well and plenty deep (7 feet)+The lobby has an open-air concept and is pleasant+The staff is very friendly and helpful+The rooms include microwave, refrigerator, stove, Kitchen utensils/plates/glasses/etc+Free Coffee+Flat screen HDTV+Great price relative to the rest of Honolulu+Centrally located - just about everything is within walking distance & bus line is nearby tooCon's:-There is no elevator and with 3 stories, this can be a huge hassle if you are hauling heavily luggage up exterior concrete stairs (in the rain)-No breakfast available, complimentary or otherwise-The rooms and hallways are dated and could use some renovation-No WiFi-Parking is limited and available for an extra nightly charge (instead of free)-Beds and pillows are below my expectations for comfort

The hotel had not elevator. the bed was comfortable.the room clean.the staff are very help and friendly. The hotel is close to all amenities.There's lots of outlets to charge electronics, anything that needed fixing was done within minutes. The small window AC unit actually works pretty good! It's definitely not some luxurious hotel. Even though it seems to be an older hotel and the price per day good

The room (140) had a very mouldy and damp smell like it hadn't been opened for months. There was a long brown hair on the bottom sheet and blood on the quilt cover. Yuk. I stayed for one night in June 2013.

I'd give this place 5 stars if it had an elevator. I book this hotel expecting something pretty seedy for the price I paid.The rooms are very clean, I had a kitchen that I had no idea I was going to have, and the beds are comfortable. I don't think there is one right angle in the place, so if you're in construction, you might cringe, lol. There's lots of outlets to charge electronics, anything that needed fixing was done within minutes. The staff is helpful & courteous. The small window AC unit actually works pretty good! It's definitely not some luxurious hotel, but the price is right, it has an excellent location, close to the international market, and walking distance to the beach. You can rent a modem during your stay, or pay to use the hotel wifi.

My husband and I stayed for 6 days at the White Sands Hotel.There are many things that we as a couple liked about our stay. The staff were a blessing and know matter if it was front desk reception or housekeeping staff all provided great service.This hotel is close to amenities.Even though it seems to be an older hotel and the price per day is a plus and staff are a 9 1/2 out of 10.Thanks to all the staff for you all provided great service.

My husband, 16 year old son and I stayed at this hotel in April 2013. We enjoyed having a poolside room that was equipped with one queen size bed, a single bed and a kitchenette. This was our second stay at this hotel, with the first being in 2008. They seem to be slowly renovating which is needed. Over our 2 week stay we only dealt with a couple of the front desk staff - Jason and Christie Ann, both were helpful and polite. A thank you to manager Paul, though, for phoning sister properties trying to find us some 24 Hour Fitness passes. We enjoyed the pool and were thankful for the laundry facility. Housekeeping was a little inconsistant, but I am aware that stayover rooms may get a deeper clean on some days compared to others. We also enjoyed the location, close to the Food Pantry, bus stops, restaurants and only a couple of blocks to the beach. Info: Wifi available in lobby or poolside for a small charge (for 24 accumulated hours) we got a signal from our poolside balcony on the second floor. There is also an option to rent a modem for your room (also a charge)Laundry - machines take quarters and there are 2 washers and 2 dryers (soap and dryer sheets available in a vending machine)In room safe (could not use ours as the key was missing) available for a small charge - we were able to use a safety deposit box at the front desk at no charge. Parking - $25 per day and is on a first come first served basis.Very friendly place. We would stay here again. Thank you White Sands!

The staff was very friendly and helpful. The locations was great. At an easy pace we were on the beach in less than 10 minutes. The room was about half the cost the other hotels near the beach. We rented a one bedroom room with a small kitchen. The room was clean, but very old. So don't expect to have modern furniture- it is well used. The TV's are nice. Overall I'd stay there again if I didn't to pay the $300 plus a night at other hotels near the beach.

We stayed at White sands hotel, and it was really good. We didn't have high expectations as it was pretty cheap compared to other hotels in that area. But our stay was perfect, it wasn't fancy or anything, but it had everything we needed, and the staff was very helpfull and friendly. If we needed anything Christianne from the front desk was very helpfull and always with a smile on her face - she was great!

Consistently clean, friendly and well located in Waikiki. The hotel has a small pool and hot tub. No restaurant, but close to many good places to eat. I recommend. Check in early if you need a parking spot as they are limited.

I'd like to thank the staff of White Sands Hotel for making my with my son a comfortable and fun one. The hotel is situated right in the heart of Waikiki. Walking distance 5-10 minute walk to the beach area. My son and I enjoy going to different breakfast place around the area....there's McDonald's and Denny's. Now if you plan on bringing a large suitcase, I suggest that you get the ground or first floor. The hotel doesn't have an elevator but the staff will definitely help you in bringing your pieces of luggage to your room. The hotel also has a nice pool that they clean everyday. My son enjoyed the pool so much that he didn't care about beach anymore. There's no Internet in the rooms. They are at poolside or lobby.

We enjoyed our stay at White Sands Hotel. The employees are very friendly and the place is neat and quiet. Thank you Christine for your great hospitality during our stay. It is worth every penny. It has all the equipment required for cooking your food as well, if you want to cook. I recommend this hotel if you are looking for a comfortable stay within a reasonable price, this is your best bet. Hope this review helps you. Thanks,Siva

So the staff are friendly and helpful. Location of the hotel is good - 2 minutes walk to shops, supermarket etc, 5-10 minutes walk to the beachfront, and the hotel is down a nice quiet street. I was upgraded to a pool view room, on the 2nd floor, near the corner, which was very very nice and peaceful. No lift though - thank god for the nice staff member who carried my heavy bags!!
