Room was a nice size, with good shower and bathroom. Kitchenette had everything you needed, and lounge area comfortable. ‘Dining’ table was a laugh - is it meant for children to eat on - the table was right near the floor?! Coin operated laundry was good. Pool was nice to have, and clean. Now for the big 2 negatives... 1: Cleaning staff - absolutely rubbish, one girl in particular. Everything wasn’t cleaned properly, which can be ok during my stay, but when I found snack wrappers in the bedside table drawer 3 days into my stay that weren’t mine, I was not happy! 2: Wifi - it wasn’t free supposedly, but I never paid, which is good. However it was just so bad, even when I was sat right by the rooter in reception! I know we are in Hawaii, but it is 2013!! The negatives aside though, I would probably stay here again, as was cheaper than many places in Hawaii, which is not cheap at all!!

Very average place that's a little run down. Good staff who are very helpful. Had been told that there was a hot tub here, but its been closed because of federal regulations. Is this a Hawaii thing as other hotels I've stayed at have hot tubs. The internet fee makes this place not that cheap.Noisy hotel or at least where we were located was. Didn't get sleep some nights.

Hotel was clean and tidy, well located to shops, tourist activities and the beach, staff were exceptionally friendly thanks Crytina and Christieann for all of your help and making our stay so easy and wonderful

The staff was incredibly accommodating. They gave us advice on the shuttle instead of a cab. The hotel is certainly centrally located but it really needs a complete makeover. We were given one of the so called "updated rooms" and all we noticed was new carpet. All the furnishings, kitchenette and washroom were old, tired and slightly dirty. The shower was perfect if you were 4 feet tall. The pool is smaller than anticipated but the beach is only two blocks away. The cost was low so my expectations were not high.

I have stayed here before when it was called Celebrity Resorts and preferred it back then to the Hilton, so I decided to book 2 nights here when passing through Honolulu.The hotel isn't going to please the fussy. It is old and a bit shabby and reminds me a bit of a hospital ward. There are no elevators so ask for a ground floor room if you can't get luggage upstairs by yourself. The rooms are spacious and have airconditioning and ensuites and that's really all I can say about them. Our tv was okay but the remote was not working so it was annoying to change channels, but we didn't complain as it wasn't a big deal for us (we were hardly there). I do have to say that the shower in our room had a dangerously high drop from shower to bathroom floor which caught me a couple of times but the shower itself was good - placed too low in the stall but nice pressure and heat. And look - the carpet was not that clean and there was a bit of a smell around the fridge area in the kitchenette when opening the fridge - but the bed was comfortable and we got a good night's sleep. So yeah - not a place for those who want perfection but not a bad place at all. We had a nice balcony area overlooking the pool area, which is really quite nice. The service was, and is, wonderful! Really great staff, friendly and informative. Good internet too if you are near the lobby - you have to pay but reasonable prices. That is what really makes a place like this stand out from the big, shiny hotels - the level of service is really good.The area is maybe a bit seedy (you can pass ladies of the night plying their trade on the corner and there is a run down pub next door) but it's nothing to be afraid of. The markets are very close by and it's an interesting walk all the way to the beach. I really like this area of Waikiki - would be walking close by the hotel at times even if I wasn't staying there. We did a car/hotel deal. This was great value except that the deal was with Dollar rental car. I wouldn't do that again as I didn't realise Dollar didn't have an excess you can pay with your travel insurance - you really do have to purchase insurance to be on the safe side, which was way more expensive than the car rental itself. Not the hotel's fault but I would not get this deal again - cheaper to hire a car and reserve parking at $25 a day.

Stayed at this hotel for 6 days in January. Not a 5 star hotel but very comfortable and clean. We had a kitchenette which was great so we didn't have to eat out at every meal. Everything including beach was within walking distance. Really nice pool and hot tub. Service was best we've experienced anywhere! Christianne at the front desk went above and beyond good service for checking prices of excursions. The street was closed off for traffic on a morning that we were supposed to be picked up for an excursion and she went out of her way to contact the shuttle for us and arrange a pick up place nearby. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Myself and my family have stayed here previously. It is a clean older hotel with no frills. It is centrally located close to buses, shops, restaurants and the beach. They have a lovely pool and I had room with a kitchenette on the mail floor. The landscaping is wonderful, the hotel staff front desk Christian can't be beat for the Aloha spirit. How much time do you spend in your room and how much do you want to pay for this?` This is a nice clean hotel with moderate rates and many of the people we meet there are repeats. Margaret & Families

Awesome service from front desk clerk, Christicann. Stayed at this hotel for 8 nights, with only reserving 4 nights to start. Due to a change of plans I needed to stay an additional 4 nights. Unfortunately the White Sands was completely booked for 1 of those nights but Christicann went above and beyond to help me find other accommodations for that night. She was friendly, extremely personable and provided superior customer service to insure that I had a fantastic trip.Convenient location in downtown Waikiki, easy walking distance to the beach, restaurants, shops, etc. Not a 5 star hotel but clean and comfortable with excellent customer service. Would definitely stay here again.

Considering the price of this hotel vs. other hotels in Waikiki, this was a pretty good deal. Basic accommodations, option for kitchentte. Even regular rooms have fridge, microwave and table. Sure, the rooms are a little dated, but clean and comfortable. Not sure who really wants to spend much time in the room in Hawaii anyway... The pool was nice, there was a little courtyard type area with a rock waterfall. A grill is available to use if you want to save some $$ and bbq. Wi-fi isn't free, but there is a Starbucks around the corner that was pleasant to sit outside with a cup of coffee, catch up on email and people watch. Overall a pleasant stay and great location!

If you are planning to stay in Honolulu, not to stay in the hotel, then pick this place....what I mean is that this is a place to crash 'n wash place, nothing spectacular, stay out late, sleep, get up, wash up then go out to explore the island. The staff was great. Location great. We got the best outta this little hotel.

We stayed here as part of our package and were not disappointed.Upon arrival, we were greeted by the receptionist who was super cool and laid back (Hawaiian style).Our room was on the 2nd floor and there were no lifts and after travelling for 24hours, dragging our bags up was not ideal but we were grateful for the room (upgraded) we were given.We chose the kitchenette option and were able to make our own meals as it came fully equipped.The balcony view of the pool was great and the room in perfect range to catch the wifi without having to go downstairs.The only negative point is probably the fact you have to pay for wifi but there is a mcdonalds round the corner which has free wifi.This s centrally located if you are gong to do more than the beach in Oahu.Transport links are great and you are right next to all the shops.I would say thought that at night it can get a little rough. Many prostitutes and drug dealers on the main road.My friends that stayed in more exclusive resorts did not come across the same type of people as we did despite being 10mins walk away. We feel that we got more of a taste of the "real" Hawaii.The staff were super friendly and our maid was fantastic. This was 5* service.Overall this is a good budget option and I would consider staying there again when back in Oahu.

I will bring my family again to stay at White Sands Hotel in Waikiki! Perfect location in Waikiki, it is pretty much walking distance to everything in Waikiki - shopping, restaurants, beach, activities, etc. Location is one thing good but the customer service of the hotel staff is another, This hotel has the Aloha Hospitality with great customer service from the management, front desk staff to the housekeeping team. They are on top of it making sure your stay in the hotel is A+! This hotel has kitchenette so you can cook your favorite meal and a laundry room to wash your shorts and t-shirts, travel light!

So we have stayed here 3 times in the past year...last being March 2013...9 nights and loved every minute...from arrival and a wonderful greeting to the same upon leaving our last night...this hotel is somewhat dated but they are updating as things sort of come to the end...hahaThe pool is the best in town...just hands down. Open later than most and also a BBQ for guests to use pretty much anytime...The rooms are cozy and cute...most with kitchens or at the least microwave fridge coffee maker and one we stayed in even had a toaster...TV's are being upgraded...our room had an older one that was on a mount on the wall so I could turn it to the outside and sit on the patio with a drink and watch a show!!! I thought it was great fun. Every single person who works here is just the nicest friendliest most helpful staff and we love them all like our own family....this hotel has the best location and you really couldn't be better situated for anything you might want to do in Waikiki...seems the word is getting out so make sure to book early if you want to check it out...they only have 90 rooms and I am pretty sure they are pretty full these days....we do love this hotel and all the staff and can't wait for our next visit in May 2013 for a full 2 weeks of comfort and happiness...thanks all of you...(you know who you are) for making our trips even better than before...we thought our previous fave in Waikiki would be our lifetime hotel but now we have found something even more suited to our needs.

I spent one, planned night here. It was exactly what I needed it to be - dinner, sleep, shuffle bags and out of the door in the morning. The room was basic with no frills of any kind. It was a quick walk to everying you could want to see in the touristy area. You'll get exactly what you pay for at this hotel.
user_name:
Justin W
New York City, New York

review_body: My wife and I spent an enjoyable week at White Sands. The facility is not new, but was well maintained, very clean and comfortable. They gave us a kitchenette which, for the reasonable room rate, was an excellent value. From check-in to check-out the "Aloha Spirit" of the staff made us feel right at home. We'll certainly book White Sands again on any future visits to Waikiki.

My original hotel had a plumbing problem and we were moved to this location, a block or so away. They had a ground floor room and nice handicap parking available just outside the entrance, which was very helpful to me. The location was close to all the things I had planned in the 2 1/2 days I had on Oahu. The little time we spent in the room was nice, comfy, and restful. Thanks guys!

The White Sands is within walking distance of Waikiki Beach, 24 hour fitness gym, Teddy Bear World, the International Food Court, great restaurants, and all transportation. The pool and area are pristine and fun. There are adequate lounge chairs and tables and chairs to have a snack or your own lunch or dinner at the pool. There is a karaoke bar for drinks and pupus right next door and a little grocery store for breakfast and lunch items that stays open until midnight right next to that.It is not the Marriott or the Westin. It is an older timeshare hotel. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was clean. The kitchenette had a sink, a microwave, a coffeemaker, 2 burners and glasses, dishes, and silverware.If the room air conditioner had been a little quieter I would have given it 5 stars.I would recommend it to friends and definitely I will stay there again.,ADA: there is no elevator, it is 3 stories, if you are in a wheelchair they have accessible rooms on the first floor.

Our family is staying here for the second time. Our room, is small but clean. The staff are all very friendly and responsive. We are happy wi our choice, but we are in a newer building. Free Internet poolside or lobby. Good cable.

A place of comfort and Serenity. Perfect Honolulu escape. Close to Waikiki beach, shopping centers and all the wonderful restaurants Waikiki has to offer. Staff was more than helpful, the atmosphere just felt like Hawaii.

I f you want the 5star quality for a low price this is not for you.It is however a nice cosy little part of Waikiki for a reasonable price with basic amenities.The real highlight of this White Sands Hotel is the staff.The front desk gives real Aloha care and kindness from the heart.Our maid was good and very polite and a hard worker[Marylin] as well as George who was quick to service anything that needed attention.The big plus was that the people here make you feel like family.Hats off to Christean and Christina-they did so much for us way over the top!If we come back again it will be because of your care and kindness.

First of all, almost $200 for a "pool view" of a filthy courtyard with tiny pool and packed with people. The decent looking hot tub was even roped off and closed - what a bummer as it was VERY cold when we were there. Yes central location, but literally street walkers out the back door. If my boyfriend wasn't with me, I would be worried about break-ins for sure. The room was flea-bag, and they falsely advertise wifi, when it's only available in the hotel lobby or at the pool. What? That is ice-age stuff. OH! and one last thing. They charge you for COFFEE. YES. you heard me. The first day is complimentary, and the additional days of your stay they make you PAY for coffee in your room. I've stayed in motel 6's that were more generous. Thumbs down.

We stayed here for 5 nights at the end of Feb 2013, it was fabulous. Christine Ann and Jason were awesome staff members, always happy and nothing was a problem. Really made us feel at home. The hotel is within walking distance to everything. Waikiki beach is 2 blocks away, supermarkets, lots and lots of different bars, restaurants all close by. Extremely central. Fantastic hotel for the value, right in the middle of Waikiki. Would def stay here again.

The white sands is not luxury hotel but it definitely was a true representation of aloha! All the staff I had the pleasure of dealing with we're polite, friendly and helpful. The room needs some updating but it had everything I needed. The bed wasn't very comfortable but that is easily correctable. It's located in a great spot with everything within walking distance.

We read the reviews and thought this would be a great place to stay when we arrived for our first visit to Hawaii. We were greeted warmly at the front desk and our 50 pound suitcases were quickly carried up the three flights of stairs to our room. The hotel is in a great location, in the middle of the block, quiet and relaxing. We were surprised to find a small refrigerator with a microwave on top, and a coffee pot on top of the microwave! We had to unplug the little refrigerator each time we wanted to make a pot of coffee. Water for the coffee came from the bathroom sink. We could deal with that, except that we noticed that every evening ants would walk across the kitchen table! When we checked in, the dishes, cups and flatwear were in the refrigerator. We never did cook in the room because of the ants. When we reported the ants to the front desk we were told they would spray. Each of the 4 nights we watched the march of the ants across the table top.Other than the problem with the ants we were pleased with the location and the staff. The bar next door was never a problem - we saw a bouncer ensuring the patrons of the bar kept away from the hotel parking lot.

My wife and I do not spend much time at the hotels. To us they are places to drop our bags and a place to sleep. Has such the White Sands met our requirements. Friendly staff to be sure. Only a block from the International Market place. Lots of places within walking distance to eat.At night the area becomes a little seeded with "working girls" but the wife and I never felt unsafe. At night the hotel has a guard, a comfort to us,Having a mini stove, ice box, and microwave was a plus.

We only stayed here one night on the way back from Maui. It was not a great experience. To start with, it costs $25 per day to park here, which I was not aware of. It wasn't a huge deal because I was only there for one night.The lobby and hotel are kind of quaint and cute. However, the room smelled musty and moldy and didn't seem to have a cleanliness that I would expect, thought I wouldn't say it was outright dirty.

My husband and I enjoyed our two week holiday at the White Sands Hotel. It is a smaller hotel located with in walking distance of the beach. It is a older hotel but very clean and well looked after. Our room had new carpets and new tiles in the shower and bathroom. The kitchenette had dishes, glasses and pots. I loved sitting around the pool in the afternoon. There was enough trees to encourage the birds. It was very peaceful listening to them while relaxing. The area around the pool had many chairs and tables also lounge chairs. There was enough room in this area to have privacy or to mingle with other guests. The staff was very friendly and helpful.they always greeted you and made you feel welcome. We are looking forward to staying again in the future.

This is not your Grandfather's Chain Hotel. Nothing wrong with Chains. I go to one and I could be anywhere. The White Sands has character, interest and and personality. The personality may or may not be to your liking. But you will know that you are not in a cookie cutter chain. Staying at the White Sands puts me in the mind of my stays at "The Red Caboose Motel" near Lancaster, PA, or "The Kona Tiki" on the Big Island. Character. I know that I am staying someplace special. I remember the place fondly and I look forward to my return this spring. The whole time we were there I did not once have to wait for an elevator. The Bell Captain happily moved my bags. And given the foods available in Waikiki, I can sure use the exercise of a flight or two. I do not fly 10 hours for a sterile, wishy-washy experience. I can stay closer to home and have that. At White Sands I know that I am in Hawaii. And when a local's bumper sticker reads, "Got Aloha?" I can answer, "Yes."Not the least are the staff people. These folks were so friendly that at first I thought it was phoney. But after they helped me out time and again, I came to realize that thier friendliness was sincere. They really cared about the quality of our experience. And for that I thank them.

We just got back from a week's stay at the White Sands Hotel in Oahu. It is not a fancy place but it was quaint. I liked that it was a smaller hotel and that the rooms circled around the pool area. The best thing I liked about it was that it was quiet. Last August we stayed at a place right on Kuhio and I was awakened every morning at 6 am by the sounds of back up alarms on garbage trucks. And the sound of squealing brakes on buses and trolleys was constant as well at that place. We did have a glich on the first night when we found the room they gave us had two twin beds! They did switched us to room with a full bed the next day but I find it absurd that you have to specify you want a room without twin beds. I also wish they offered free wifi. But they made up for that by providing us with free beach chairs and mats to take to the beach all week. Since our daughter is attending UH for the next 4 years, we do plan to go back every year and we will stay at the White Sands again. But we will be sure to ask for a room without twin beds!

I just recently stayed at the White Sands Waikiki with my family on my recent trip to Honolulu. I am a travel agent and normally splurge a bit when i am on Vacation and stay at a fancy property. We wanted to do this trip on more of a budget. I had a really good look at all of the properties that could be found in this price range. I read mixed reviews and heard a lot of mixed things from my clients that I book to stay in Hawaii. I finally came upon a review for this property and was intrigued. I was really happy in my decision to stay at this property. From the moment that we Arrived the Manager Paul and Receptionist Christian really made us feel like a member of their family. There was always a kind greeting and smile a the front desk. Christian was also quite knowledgeable about day trips and fun things to do in Waikiki. We loved the location of our room. We had a pool view with small kitchenette right above the hotel Lobby. This is a great location for your room if you want to use wifi since it is located in the lobby and the signal doesn't reach all the rooms. We had quite a strong signal in our room. We loved the garden feel to the resort. It was like a hidden oasis surrounded by tall palm trees and a beautiful pool. There is a waterfall and Chinese garden located in the back of the property and the waterfall gave a calming effect while I sat out on my patio. The rooms were very basic but clean. You can get a queen bed and a twin bed if you have a child. We used our kitchen almost everyday which saved us a ton of money since eating in Waikiki can be quite expensive. There is a grocery store about two blocks away called the food pantry if you want to fill up your kitchen. There was only two downsides in my opinion was the bar located in the next hotel it quite often had people smoking on the street our front and drunk people out on the street at night. The beds were also a bit uncomfortable as well. All in all We had a really good time and I will defiantly stay here again. I will be recommending this property to my clients that are looking to do Waikiki on a Budget.

We are quite hesitant to share this spot; because this is our new home in Waikiki and we do not want any problems getting a room or have another price increase. If I had bottomless pockets I would stay at the Outrigger Reef on the beach but this place offers a tranquillty that cannot be found at the Reef. All the staff are gracious and hospitable. There is no more hot tub due to changes in the ADA law. Properties must have hot tubs that people can step into, so bye bye hot tubs at all smaller sites. There are 3 -3 story buildings {no elevator} surrounding the pool, tables and chairs, neat waterfall and the hot tub area which might become a wishing well-{rumor has it}, around the entire inside area is heaps of greenery that gets daily attention. There is a back exit onto Nahua street that gets you to Starbucks or the grocery store quicker. Walking back all one sees is concrete buildings and then the oasis of the greenery of white sands beckons. It is a condo unit, with a stove top, refrig, microwave and utensils for 4. There is a lot of storage space as there are many long term guests of 2 or 3 months. They offer a free DAILY paper, including Sunday. They have internet service for $4.50 for 24 hours of use that must be used up in 12 days-that would be super if there was full reception. It is quite a hassle to only have access outside your room, but it is cheap yet intermittent service. They also offer light housekeeping, I don't think they change the sheets, it's up to you. Like coffee, the 1st packet is on them and then you buy your own. There is a laundry room. There were only about 20 people who hung out on a daily basis, very quiet place indeed. Now for the downside, this is not a new or pristine property, it is old school. The carpets are quite tired, the units are old and in need of some tender loving care but if you can look past the superficial, this is THE BEST place to recharge your batteries. I have stayed at 23 hotels in Waikiki over the past few years and this by far is the only 1 that offer a true old style relaxing Hawaiian experience. It is on Nohonani, so I needs to deal with all the "colorful characters of Kuhio, as I call them" This is a strip where there are many bars/clubs, ladies of the pm and possible drunks; we have never been bothered and have stayed on this area for 15 years. You are a short walk to the beach, 1 block to the International marketplace that has not only goodies to buy but also a faboo food court in the back that will keep many different food cravings happy. Overall I would not hesitate to go back tomorrow and claim my chair by the pool. Such a wonderful, restorative spot I hate to share it, lest it lose it's charm. At the same tie, I want them to be successful so i can go back. It is only for those seeking a calm spot that is not fancy, doesn't have room service, doesn't offer meals or have a bar, but all is very close at hand.

We had stayed at a much more expensive hotel in Honolulu and then moved to the White Sands.The hotel has first class service. It is private and quiet. The grounds are meticulously maintained.It is close to Waikiki and Starbucks (very important to this Seattle girl!) We had NOTHING to complain about. The pool and spa are surrounded by garden and palm trees and the wind soughing through the palms made for vacation magic.I am returning in April and do not plan to ever stay at any other hotel now that I have found the White Sands. (Thanks Paul and Christieann!)

A big thank you to the white sands stuff, especially Christieann, Ron, Jason, Virgie, Christina, George, Aubra, Angelita & Marily. Very close to Waikiki Beach, perfect for swimming, shopping, dinning and sightseeing.

Wow, I am currently sitting on the patio overlooking the cool hexagonal pool, lined by eighty eight foot palm trees gently caressing the midnight sky and protecting the hidden paradise below. A calm breeze rushes through the rustling fans of the bushes, as a waterfall glistens in the near distance. Peace, Tranquility, Love... and I am a big Dude! What more can you expect as you arrive at the quaint gem in the heart of Honolulu's Waikiki area. The entrance seems magical as you enter under the iron rod trellis, clad with beautiful greenery to accent what awaits you within their clan-descent gates. The front desk is staffed by wonderful people who are quick to great you with an "aloha" as you proceed through an open lobby into the heart of the wonderfully crafted property. Three separate, three story buildings form a triangle which resonates a certain feng shui if you will. The lights that line the trees glisten over the pool as brightly as the infinite grains of sand which line the world's most beautiful beaches. The quaint rooms provide much need space for all of your worldly pocessions and include my favorite thing of all time... A Kitchen !!! Complete with a mini fridge in order to house a plethora of your alcoholic and food related addictions. A fully stocked cupboard and two range burners allow for an effort free preparation of breakfast, lunch and dinner needs, as well as late night calzones. I would most definitely return to this hummbly blessed aboad in order to partake of its luscious sweet nectar. Mahalo from Van City. Peace

The hotel rooms were just right for our needs, as well as the great Location to everything. The staff at the hotel were great and both Christieann and Christina at the front desk were fantastic.She has a great recall about us and our needs four years running. They both have a way to make sure we felt like returning family back home on Oahu, White Sands.Christieann is the best good will ambassador for the White Sands Hotel. She is a Jem! Mahalo!

My stay here was quite memorable. As a middle-aged female traveling solo, my only request was to be on an upper floor. I was pleasantly surprised to be upgraded, at no extra charge, to the top floor (there are only 3) with a kitchenette and pool view. My room, though not so new, was clean and my bed was very comfortable. I felt very safe here; doors in lobby were locked every night at 10pm. Security patrol at night. Staff (Christie Anne, Jason and my house keeping lady (sorry forgot her name) were very friendly and went out of their way to help if there were concerns or problems with ANYTHING; assist, make phone calls, book a tour - you name it. The hotel is hidden down a side street off of Kuhio, one of the main drags. But, not to worry - everything is at your finger tips: Food Pantry, Starbucks, restaurants, International Market only a few steps away. Waikiki Beach (and the police station) less than a 10 minute walk. Lots to see and do, if you want, or don't want. Some afternoons I spent around the pool - it was always so peaceful there. A private oasis away from the crowds. I would recommend this hotel to any traveler that enjoys quiet time away from all the excitement and hustle bustle. Ideal for anyone traveling solo, families, couples. If you are looking for a friendly atmosphere, sprinkled with down home charm, no frills, you've come to the right place. I am looking forward to coming back!

I read many of the previous reviews before our trip and The White Sands was not what we expected. We had booked 2 nights at the White Sands but only stayed one. Although the hotel seemed quite charming when we arrived (cute vintage 3 story motel with an inviting courtyard and pool) we were very disappointed with our room. We were supposedly 'upgraded' to a pool view room on the 3rd floor (no elevator). The room was very dated and a bit dirty (stain on the lamp shade). The 2 single beds we were given (not very romantic) were uncomfortable, had cheap bedding, and were on wheels. The kitchenette area and bathroom needed updated cabinets. The only positives I can give is that the front desk staff was very cooperative when we left and did not try to charge us for the 2nd night. In addition the motel was quiet for the hours between 10pm and 7am as requested on the paperwork. The only other concern was safety walking at night to and from the hotel. A half block away was a bar where a number of patrons stood outside drinking which made us feel uncomfortable when walking home from dinner near the beach.

Spent two nights there just before this past MLK weekend. Got a suite as a free upgrade, spacious, relatively clean. This was more like a motel the way it looked. The age of the room was obvious everywhere. There was a very old safe inside a closet and it needed a key to operate on it. I couldn't find the key and asked the front desk. They said there was a small charge ($2 a day), but they were unable to locate the key either, So I gave up. They also charged $20 a day for parking in their small front yard. They said that street parking there would be free between 7 pm and 7 am if you could find a spot. I guess you should be able to find one if you got back late enough as I saw some empty spots early in the morning. However, I had a rental car and didn't want risk leaving it out in the street.The location was very good, two streets away from the Wakiki beach (not a real beach but just play grounds for hotels). A lot of feeding places around and shops, open market, and an upscale mall, plus all those brand name stores.

Nice small hotel, friendly people, Christieann is the best front desk girl to help you, one thing me and my wife really liked from this hotel is that was very quiet for the location is at especially the rooms inside towards the pool. If you want to save some money and be in an hotel with a small kitchen this is ideal.

The hotel rooms were OK, Great Location to everything.The staff at the hotel were great and we can't say enough about Christieann from reception who was fantastic...........She went out of her way to make sure we knew where we were going on our day trips and night trips as well.Christieann went out of her way to find us other accomodation when we wanted to stay longer but the hotel was fully booked.

Here is the scoop; Clean - Yes. Cheap - Yes. Safe - Yes. Staff - Excellent. Location - Very Good. Room - Clean & comfy. Beds - Firm & restful. Washroom - clean, shower, hot & strong. Pool, Spa - Cleaned & maintained daily. Quiet - pleasant waterfall in courtyard drowns out the 'Waikiki hum'. Would we stay again? - Definitely! We arrived New Year's Eve and were met by the security person who helped us in, but not before enjoying the fireworks that could be seen between the towers of the major hotels that flank Waikiki beach. A pretty special moment to start 2013. The White Sands is unassuming with it's three storey motel look and parking lot in front. Once at the front desk we knew we had made a good decision to stay here for our vacation. A courtyard with pool, babbling waterfall and mature garden filled with lush vegetation looked like a throw back to a Waikiki of yesteryear. The check-in was fast. We looked through the sliding doors of our room which connected to the courtyard and wondered if there may had been some mistake. The price seemed low for a room like this in high season. A welcome Picnic Bag filled with lovely Hawaiian treats was waiting to greet us. The insulated 'Aqua Hotels & Resorts' bag served as a perfect lunch tote for our trips to the beach. The kitchenette worked perfectly, we loved our room #104 having breakfast on the "Lanai" every morning. The ability to have dinner or even just a cold wine at our finger tips takes away the fuss of heading out to a restaurant for everything. The Spa was always available, and we had no problem finding chairs at the pool anytime. A propane barbecue for guests was setup near the pool and the ice machine was always full. The room was cleaned at our convenience, we tipped 2$ a day and it was appreciated. Any extra towels or necessities were provided cheerfully. We could get beach towels at the front desk for free. Internet services was available. The hotel had a family feel with many customers staying months at a time, The staff was pleasant and seemed to enjoy working at the Sands. The tv monitor behind the front desk had traditional Island music and dancing on it anytime we dropped by, just seemed nice! A cold water setup near the entrance was always refreshing. You could find newer and older hotels on the same street priced accordingly but the White Sands seems to be the one to stay at. The sister hotels to The White Sands, all part of the Aqua Group are just the next street over but they didn't seem to have the charm that this little hotel does. 'The Hawaiian' next door has a Pub, liquor/convenience store. The Bus, the back entrance to The International Market and most conveniences are the end of the block. Waikiki public beach is a 10 minute zig zag walk away.

We stayed here for two nights in January of 2013. It is an excellent hotel at a fair and reasonable price. Great location and staff. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to anyone traveling to the Honolulu/Waikiki area.

The Good: Great budget minded hotel in Waikiki...Its really an OLD hotel, looks like it came out of the 70's.......The check in was great...the 2 girls that work the registration check in were really helpful, and seem to work together...The rooms were a bit outdated, had a kitchenette inside which was a nice touch... 10% off the rate with AAA......If you are kamaaina, then 12% off...Rooms were a bit outdated, but then again all i was looking for was somewhere clean to lay my head, wasnt planning on living there..and this satisfied all my needs...The Bad: Limited parking, which is on a first come first serve basis. I believe there are 15 parking spaces i could be off by a couple..If you park across the street in the limited paid parking lot there is a no security to watch your car...Parking is not free at the hotel and must be paid for also...The hotel is located about 2.5 blocks away from the beach...Now if you could just pick up the hotel and move it closer to the ocean would be greatThe ugly: The bar next door has to go!!! The hotel is not really in a bad neighborhood, but the dive bar next door brings down the area...It can bring some some unsavory characters...Never saw any trouble, but yet it still brings down the area......For a budget minded traveller, this is a great hotel to stay at and would highly recommend....

Loved the centrality of the hotel. it's not fancy, but we weren't looking for fancy. we wanted comfortable, not too pricey, good staff, friendliness, kitchenette... and we got all that. the a/c was a little noisy at times, and other times there were no problems. would definitely stay there again and recommend it to others who are looking for the same amenities we were.

Stayed here for my first trip to Hawaii. Inexpensive but still very nice, the staff were very helpful and pleasant. Would surely stay here again. Pool and hot tub were very inviting. Close to all the action.

Our room has 2 twin beds. The carpet and bathroom curling had water damage. The shower head leaked out the back spraying on the ceiling and out of the shower until I wrapped a washrag around it. Room was very musty smelling. Air conditioner was noisy

I have stayed @ this property in the past and I really have liked it then! Like the other reviewers have said. The staff are great, the rooms are big and its very central to anything on Waikiki. Beach is only 3 blocks away. International Marketplace is 2 blocks away, bus stop are 2 blocks away as well! I love the new place now too since they have updated the rooms with flat screen tv's and alarm clocks etc.  I really am glad that I stayed here again. I'd like to thank Mr Paul (manager) for being considerate and giving me a special room and rate! Mahalo. You have the best staff, and your quaint, homey property even makes it a better stay in Waikiki !  Looking forward to stay with my second "home" whenever I will be in Waikiki! If you are traveling with a group! Room 132 is HUGE and I had it for myself! It had 2 bathrooms, 2 double beds in adjacent rooms with another sofa bed! With a Full kitchen!

We stayed at this hotel for five nights after Christmas and had an excellent time. It is definately an older hotel, with mostly original fixtures, but if you are not going to Hawaii for a luxury hotel experience this is the perfect place. The hotel staff were just amazing. They went out of their way to accomodate any requests we had and always with a genuine smile - even if it was to install a router in our son's room at 10 pm so that he could watch the World Junior's game at 2 am. We had a room on the ground floor, which was great because we could just step outside into the courtyard to have coffee every morning. There is plenty of seating in the courtyard for guests to lounge around and just enjoy the pool, hot tub, pond and the lush plants and trees. "Oasis" is the word we used many times as we sat and enjoyed being there. The International Market is only half a block from the hotel and the beach about one and a half blocks. Thank you to all the staff and especially to Christieann and Jason for making us feel so welcome! We would definately stay there again.

We stayed here & really enjoyed it.The older hotel rooms are larger than the newer ones.Our patio had a good view of the grounds & everything in the room was clean & working.This hotel is only three blocks from Wakiki beach & restaurants.

We were really happy with our stay. We felt the hotel was a special oasis hidden amongst the high rises. It made us feel very clever for finding it. A real charmer, good hot tub, clean, comfortable and the staff were really helpful and had lots of time for us. Had the room had wifi, it would have been perfect. And a great location. It was our first time to Hawaii, and we will definitely stay there again.

I was really scared that this was going to be a skeezy hotel but I was pleasantly surprised. The room was big and so was the bathroom. We had a "moderate view room" facing the pool but the view was obstructed by big trees. There was a fridge, microwave, coffee maker, and hair dryer in the room. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Just a couple blocks away were a bunch of shops and restaurants (like The Cheesecake Factory which was amazing!) The only downsides were the parking lot which was very small and you have to pay $25 a day to park there and also they do not have an elevator but luckily there's only 3 levels. If you're looking for a cheap place to rest your head at night this is the perfect place!

The White Sands gets better and better, and I eagerly look forward to my usual two week Thanksgiving stay. It's cozy and comfy, with a wonderful staff and friendly guests. It's a bit of old Hawaii, with tropical plants, a pleasant waterfall, all surrounding a swimming pool. A recent upgrade has a phone in each room with free local calls. It's a short walk to the beach and shopping, with excellent bus service less than a block away. Some visitors rent cars and pay extra for parking; I have never wanted a car and love the freedom of walking and taking the bus. It's not brand new or deluxe, which is why I say very good. To me, however, it's the only place I want to be. My November arrival feels like a homecoming.------Christi Ann, Aurora, Virgie, and George are excellent employees, but they are also friends that I greet each year.

If you could pick up this hotel & put it nearer the beach, it would be 100% perfect! My son & I just had a great stay here and highly recommend it for "budget folks" like us. If you can do without having a view of the beach from your balcony and don't mind a long walk to Wkk Beach, then you'll be pretty happy here. Pros: Staff friendly, everything clean & in working order, comfortable beds, lovely patio/pool area, adequate parking lot. We had a nice kitchenette room with new TV. Decent pricing. Bus line nearby.Cons: We realize why people might think the hotel is in an unsavory neighborhood, as there is a skanky tavern nextdoor. While I never felt unsafe as I walked past it in daytime, I probably wouldn't try that alone at night. There were absolutely no scary street people around though.If you can overlook the hotel's less than perfect location, you'll find a little bit of paradise inside!

ALOHA! I have been a Flight Attendant for 31 years and throughout my career I have been fortunate to stay at Hotels many people couild not even dream of staying. This includes Hotels provided by the company while on a layover and others where I received a substantial discount. Last November I began to plan my first trip to Hawaii as a full paying guest. At first I was very disillusioned as I realized how much money I would now need to put towards my room.Then by chance I came across THE WHITE SANDS HOTEL, It sounded to good to be true!~A CLASSIC 3 story HAWAIIAN HOTEL nestled in between the towering high rises of WAIKIKI. It sounded homey and AFFORDABLE. From the moment I arrived I was treated so well and welcomed. with REAL ALOHA! I am a single female traveling alone and I am very sensitive to safety. I felt very comfortable and safe after checking in. Then I proceeded to my room. All of a sudden I felt like I had my own little studio apartment in Waikiki! I love having the sliding doors open and right off my balcony were the most beautiful palm trees and the view of the pool!I turned around unpacked and honestly was torn between just enjoying the room and the view or to go out and take in Waikiki! I did both!! Here it is one year later and I am back at the WHITE SANDS and still behind the front desk are CHRISTIANNE and CHRISTINA. They are wonderful and I feel like I have friends who work here. On my way to check in today Christieanne WELCOMED ME HOME...twice!! This truly meant a lot to me. In addition the MANAGER, Paul made me feel like a very special guest.The WHITE SANDS is a charming clean safe hotel that allows you to feel like you are getting away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki while just being steps away from THE INTERNATIONAL MARKET PLACE and just a few more to Waikiki BEACH. It is also a hotel that you can clearly sees CARES about it's enviroment and about their guests. ABSOLUTELY! Make a RESERVATION at THE WHITE SANDS and see for yourself!! One last thought...Not only do I feel welcome and at home but I also feel valued.. In this world it is difficult to find people who do not make you feel like they are just too busy to talk to you. Not the case here!! Christina and I have shared several conversation ranging from yoga to job hunting!! Along with Ron who also works at night...WHITE SANDS has NO' KA OI STAFF!!!ALOHA and MAHALIO!! BOOK IT and ENJOY!1

Wonderful little oasis in the midst of a busy city. We stayed for 2 weeks in a pool facing room with a kitchentte. One plug in didn't work and they came and fixed it immediatly.Our room was always cleaned well and was spotless when we arrived.The front desk people are so helpful and friendly, much better than in a big hotel.There was a wonderful mix of people staying there even some international students who were fun to meet.We will return again, it is within walking distance of shops and the beach

The pictures that you may see on line do not in any way resemble the real hotel. We had booked a week in this hotel??? from Australia. When we arrived it was located in some back street ghetto.There were people hanging off balconies playing loud music and drinking. I think there were some dead beat permanents living/squatting there. When we were shown our pool front room my wife stood inside the door and cried. It was by far the oldest, dirtiest and ill kept hotel room we had ever set eyes on.We took photos off the mould in the bathroom, the paint peeling off the walls. Lounge you could not even sit on. Bed with a big dip in the middle, stains all over the carpet (blood stains?) I would not send my dog in there. I have travelled all over Asia and this place is the pits. It is really strange but I cant find a picture of my room on line. Strange. I think the photos on line have been touched up. We ran from the hotel so fast.

I stayed here for 10 weeks as a Student and it was awesome! Very friendly and helpful staff, great central location, clean and comfortable rooms with daily roomservice, big lcd TV, own kitchen with stove, oven, microwave, fridge and more. The Roomservice cleans all the dirty dishes for no extra charge!!! Big Bathroom with Shower an big Mirror. In the Lobby is a BBQ Area with Pool and Jacuzzi! All in all perfect for the price!

My husband and I loved our experience at the white sand hotel. The people, the locations Was just perfect. Food,activity,shopping all at your finger tips. Not to mention the fabulous staff .We were so pleased that we booked our rooms for the summer before we check out. It's the best value for your money.

Review of White Sands HotelWhite Sands Hotel431 Nohonani Street Honolulu, Hawaii,96815+18089247263Good hotel for a budget stay in Waikiki if your not too concerned with high end luxury. This hotel is located approximately 1 and half blocks from Waikiki Beach and half a block from the International Market Place and about 15 miles from Honolulu International Airport. This location is also a block from the Royal Hawaiian Shopping Center and Waikiki Shopping Plaza and half a mile from Honolulu Zoo. Check in at Hotel was fast and staff at front desk were always friendly. Front desk staff at my check in was lady name of Christie I believe. Very nice and helpful. Give high praise for her great efforts and customer service skillsLocation is within walkind distance to Waikiki beach and many places of shopping and eating. There is a convenience store just one second from hotel and a bar next door to which makes it all very close. Room had a balcony that was nice. Also rooms were very nice and big and clean. Nice tv and beds very comfortable. There is a nice pool with hot tub for all guests.However staying here like other properties in Waikiki the costs go very high.Parking you pay $25 a day and get a small spot that is only on first come first serve. However keep in mind that this is Hawaii, as other properties charge way more for their services.You are getting a good deal at this property.You are not guaranteed a spot everytime.Parking lot is very small, and when full almost impossible to park. It is so small I got into a small accident with another guest’s car at hotel. Was not a pretty scene. However not hotel’s fault.That being only one negative of this property. I like mention some more positives.Very welcoming property and nice place to relax after a long day of exploring the island of Oahu. Close to all entertainment and easy to find when arriving into Honolulu, especially if your driving. Was not hard to find using GPS or even regular map.Overall I would recommend this property to other travelers to Hawaii. Would recommend to singles, couples and groups. And even families.Really its a good place to stay for someone watching their budget.I would stay at this property again and recommend this to other people as well.

We really enjoyed staying at the White Sands Hotel. This is an older hotel, with a great staff and a relaxed atmosphere. There is a courtyard with pool, palm trees, fish pond and flowers, yet we were in the heart of shops, restaurants, and activities. The International Market, the King's Village, and the beach were close by. The free Hilo Hattie shuttle was just around the corner as well as bus transportation. The price was very reasonable and included a microwave and refrigerator. The beds were comfortable and clean. We would be delighted to stay here on our next visit.

I had only one night stay there at this nice little hotel. However, I wish I could have more nights stayed there. It was on a very good location, near to all the beautiful shoppes and nice restaurants. It is extremely convenient. Surprisingly, with my very competitive price, I have got even a little kitchen. This is a surplus to people like me, who likes to cook and eat my own breakfast. My college daughter came over and we had each a large bed (although I booked only for myself). She was surprised as well, and said to me:'mom, I wish we could stay here longer." Well, next time. I told her that we will come back again to this little white sand hotel. I like the pool as well, but we love the most, is the workers at White Sand Hotel, they are very friendly and warm. We felt like we have been there a million times, although that was our first time. Only thing we found out a little disappointing is that there was not a white sand at all. "Why it's called white sand." she said. We will go back again in the future for sure! 4 Star hotel services without a star rate. It's absolutely wonderful!

We stayed for two 4 night stays while in transit and found the Hotel office staff to be very helpful. We had a ground Floor Pool View room which we found to be ideal. The hotel is very handy to Restaurants and Shopping Complexes, and only a short walk to Waikiki Beach. The beds were Comfy and the Linen Clean and in good condition.had everything that was necessary in the Kitchen. We would definitely stay again, and will recommend the White Sands Hotel to our friends back in New Zealand

When I find a treasure I generally like to keep it to myself but this one I will share. The White Sands Hotel was a great surprise. Booked unseen and last minute, I didn’t know what to expect. I absolutely loved the “vintage Waikiki” atmosphere. The room with a well-stocked kitchenette was spacious, clean, and extremely comfortable. Even better, the price was reasonable. Additionally, the location is to die for. It is within walking distance to the beach and a morning run to Starbucks, evening strolls along Waikiki and ease of access to any of the driving lanes for other island undertaking. I will most definitely be back!

This hotel offers great value for money in an excellent location, close to everything, beach, shops, restaurants, bus stop.... Rooms were older, but felt nice and clean and our bed was very comfortable. Definitely recommend the courtyard/pool facing rooms, but probably not the city/street facing rooms - definitely worth paying a little extra for a nicer outlook and quieter room. Staff are the real highlight here - very friendly, welcoming and helpful - a special thanks for Christieann for her fabulous positivity, cheefulness and can do attitude :-)
user_name:
Christine P
Nelson, Nelson, New Zealand

review_body: good distance from everywhere. has a nice 7ft pool. the 1st floor rooms have a sliding door that goes straight to the pool/patio. outside the sliding door has 2 chairs n a table. inside the room has a good a/c and a small kitchen w/ a fridge, microwave, coffeemaker, and sink. staff is friendly and quick. housekeeping does a fine job. i put a ding on cleanliness because it seems older than other hotels so it had an "old" smell when i first got inside the room, though, it quickly dissipated. i didnt see/use a restaurant/gym so i put average on ratings for both. but like the title said, i will be back for sure.

We booked thru Orbitz. Air and Hotel for a week in Honolulu At the White Sands Hotel. The white Sands is an Older but still very nice 3 story hotel. The room was nice with a small but usable kitchenette. Microwave, small fridge and we asked for a toaster and they gave us one. The rooms have nice balconies and the grounds are lush with beautiful vegitation and a Pool and Hot Tub. Pool is open till 10 at nite. Centrally located in Waikiki and within walking distance of most places you wish to go.Very friendly staff, thanks to Christieann, Christina, Paul D and Ron and of course all the service staff for making our trip a very special and memorable one. We would stay here again and again if only time and money would permit.

Excellent location. Close to Waikiki and all shops and restaurants. Not glamorous by any means but great for price. We had a room with a garden view and it was lovely. Super friendly and helpful staff.

I guess I am a little confused by many of the positive reviews. Our experience here was not as great. We started out our honeymoon the first night at this hotel. We had reserved a queen bed and walked in to 2 single beds. Okay, not the end of the world. We were tired and just wanted to get to bed. I hopped into bed and knew immediately that it was going to be a long night. The bed was not only extremely hard, but I could feel every spring in the mattress. It was not a restful night. There were also dark hairs on the sheets, and I do not have dark hair. That grossed me out a little. We had the same problem in the bathroom with dark hair on the floor and sink. Since the hotel was booked, there was no hope of a different room. So, the next night, we asked for several blankets to pile on the bed so that the springs could not be felt. This did help, and staff was very willing to help us out with the extra blankets. I will say that people were friendly there. The room in general was not very clean and most importantly, the bed was truly awful!

My wife and I were recently in Waikiki and we stayed at the White Sands Hotel. We've been to Waikiki 8 times now and have always attempted to find a good deal on our hotel room. (The lower our overal cost, the more frequently we can go back). This hotel fit our budget perfectly and actually offered more than some of the more expensive places we've stayed at. Our room was spacious, had a nice big bathroom, kitchenette with everything we'd need to cook and a beautiful lanai overlooking the courtyard/pool area. The room was clean and housekeeping staff kept it that way. The pool was very nice and there was a covered jacuzzi surrounded by trees...... that was a nice touch right before bedtime. The staff were very accommodating and friendly. Jason and Christieann made us feel especially welcome and seemed more like friends than just another couple of employees. I would have preferred a hallway entrance to our room instead of an outside door, but it was no big deal. This is an older property, but that didn't bother us at all. We spend our time out and about as opposed to sitting in our room looking at the amenities. If you want gleeming chandeliers and lobby floors polished like mirrors, there are plenty of places in Honolulu that have those things and they will be more than happy to take your $200 - $300 for every night you hang around. I would certainly recommend this hotel, but be sure to request a room on the courtyard side. All-in-all, we liked it.

We have an Awesome vacation with White Sands with great service from whole staff and great place for all ages and this hotel has a great location on everything beaches, restaurants, shopping centers and groceries stores.

After having great pre-arrival customer service, I knew the stay would not be a let down. Our check-in was very quick and even though the two rooms I booked wasn't next to each other, they made sure to put them on the same floor. They even made it a pool view (taking it from a city view)! To bad the manager was on vacation cause I wanted to thank him for having one of the best front desk staffs I've ever delt with. The housekeeping staff was great as well. I was shocked when she washed our dirty dishes. My daughters LOVED that our room was right in front of the hot tub!

Great smaller hotel, very good location, tropical setting, very helpful staff. Most enjyable stay, great shopping and dining close by.We would cetainly recommend this hotel to friends in the over 60's - shops and pub nearby.The tropical Garden and pool really set the scene fot his beach/shopping holiday.Easy walk to main shopping street and beach front restaurants in very swish hotels.We couldn't fault the hotel - secure access at night.All in all a wonderful experience which we would be happy to repeat at any time.Internet access was available at a small charge and there was a very convenient ice dispenser.I can't think of anything more to say but I must get to 200 words or I can't finish! so so so so so here I go go go go just making up upu up the space space space Cheerio!!!!

I really shouldn't be writing a review because I've been coming here since 1989 and would not stay anywhere else. You never have to get in an elevator, the oasis of the courtyard, someone always smiling at the desk, the location - OMG - St. Germaine's Bakery & Starbucks a short walk away, and getting to that beautiful ocean is so very easy. We had wonderful communication with the service staff, always eager to please, and the unit was always clean. I could go on. I love this quaint little place, even if it's showing a little wear. Friends joined us that had never been before and they were very pleased. Two things: I wish they would keep the pool and hot tub open a little later. We were having a quiet swim on a weekend night, and were shooed out of the pool. How about 11 p.m., at least on weekends? Also, I didn't get to meet Paul! Mahalo nui loa - a hui hou kakou.

The White Sands is an affordable option in the very overpriced Waikiki area. The rooms are basic and not impeccable, but definitely acceptable and the cleaning staff are really careful and good. The whole staff actually is really nice and really efficient.Rooms have kitchens in them, which is great. The pool is really nice and the location couldn't be better.No free wifi, though, which is a major unsympathetic thing to do nowadays and, although I didn't have a car during my stay, I saw a lot of guests having to spend some time on that issue since parking spaces go away quickly.The only big issue is the 3 pm check-in which is soooooo late and a bummer, specially if you consider that a vast majority of people that arrive in Honolulu are coming from quite far away and are really tired.

My son and I stayed here on two separate occasions on our trip from the west coast to and from Asia and I wanted to share our experience here. Overall the room was very comfortable and the staff extremely friendly and helpful. Keep in mind that this is an older facility and has no elevator nor real luxury amenities. What it does have are clean comfortable rooms with kitchenettes, AC, and large lanais. It is somewhat of a throwback to old time Waikiki, when the area was populated by low rise bungalows instead of the high rise luxury resorts that predominate today.Although we didn't take advantage of the common area facilities, the pool appeared to be well maintained and there was a gas grill available in the patio if you wanted to grill your own steaks or teri chicken. The Food Pantry is a block away if you want to shop for your own food. In our case, we bought a few cans of spam, a dozen eggs, a few potatoes, and some orange juice and were able to start off each day with a good hearty and inexpensive breakfast.Free newspapers, hot showers, clean towels, comfortable beds, large lanai, and friendly staff. And the location is within a few blocks of all the major Waikiki attractions. This place is not for the traveler who is seeking luxury accommodations, but for someone seeking a comfortable quiet place to sleep in between enjoying the various island activities. And if you want some luxury, use the money saved on your room to pamper yourself to some nice meals or drinks.Overall a very enjoyable experience and I will definitely stay here in the future.
user_name:
John K
San Diego, California, United States

review_body: This being our 4th trip to Hawaii, we usually stayed at a different hotel, but thought we'd try something different. We loved the White Sands for these reasons,..........Great price.........super location for us.......rather than having to walk a little further than our previous hotel stays required. My son lived in the pool which was a lot bigger than we previously had at our other hotel stays. The front desk people I encountered, Christina, Christieanna, & Jason were extreamly helpful & quite nice & made sure everything was O.K. for us. Room was more than sufficient for my son & I. I will definatly stay here again when I go back to Hawaii. I guess I could not really find one thing wrong with this hotel if I were asked to. The only thing that I would say that would make it better, would be to offer a small breakfast.......coffee, juice, milk, toast, waffles...etc. Nothing big.........although I didn't mind the walk to McDonalds in the beautiful Hawaiian weather......Thank You White Sands.......

When you are 3 blocks from Waikiki Beach and every hotel is your haven, amongst the crowds this little old fashion triple decker motel has a pool, hot tub, waterfalls and old palm trees hidden inside. The price is right. Clean but not pristine. Excellent laundry, and reception a joy. My room was made up everyday, and these are not big time linens, there is a bigtime beach out there, a kitchette, excellent shower, couch, and door out to hot tub. No matter how warm the mighty Pacific, you need warmth afterwards, and not riding a elevator 29 floors down corridors, here the joyful hot tub is 30 feet away.. And, comment on the hula video its on all the time, like a fish aquarium... oh, oh, Apple Store 2 blocks away!

We stayed here for one night at the end of our trip. Pool and courtyard with plants, flowers and little waterfall were wonderful. Room was clean but extremely musty smelling with heavy odor of bleach. I had a headache all the next day after sleeping there. Rooms definitely need an overhaul. Blanket on my bed was faded and had a cigarette burn. Staff is very friendly and accommodating. I wish the owners would invest a bit in this very cute hotel. I wouldn't stay there again unless it was updated.

I was pleasantly surprised when I arrived at White Sands Hotel in Waikiki. It is a very well kept property and the staff is so accommodating and friendly. The rooms are a nice size with a kitchen. Sitting on my deck while sipping coffee, looking over the pool with the pleasant sounds of a rain forest, was my favorite thing to do each morning. The plants, flowers, trees, waterfalls and lovely birds surrounding the pool and hot tub was a very peaceful way to end the day. You seemed to forget that you are right in the middle of the city Waikiki, but when you exit the property you are in the the perfect location to walk to anything in Waikiki. I definitely will be returning to White Sands and highly recommend this Quaint affordable Hotel.

If you want to spend time in Honolulu and Waikiki and do not want to spend a lot of money this hotel might be right for you. Location is great. Hotel is very clean, and simple. Staff are very nice. The north east side of island has nicer beaches but traffic sucks:)

I stayed at the property one night and it was one of the dirtiest hotels I have ever stayed at. I chose it based on all the "wonderful" reviews here and it was nothing like I expected. This was the end of trip which started in Honolulu and I stayed at another property that was in the same price range BUT so much nicer. (See Waikiki Sand Villa)The hotel is older and everything had a worn look to it. That I can live with, BUT when there is grime in all the corners and surfaces than its just neglect. We kept our shoes on at all time, including in the shower. If it wasn’t for the fact that it was one night we would have left and gone somewhere else.We were “upgraded” to a pool view. That was a laugh – the “pool view” actually gave us a sliver of the pool if we looked hard left and wonderful view of the residential property next door. AND as a bonus it is a three story walk up and the stairs overlook the alley where they stored all sorts of stuff.The area was also a little questionable. I am use to a city environment and would not recommend the location for anyone who is not.

I repeatedly go back to White Sands Hotel because the staff is ALWAYS kind and helpful, and the rooms are sized well, with kitchens. The pool is always maintained and sits in the middle of a tropical wonderland. Flowers and trees are always groomed. There is a well maintained hot tub, and a beautiful waterfall for peace of mind. They have a laundry room. Ask the people at the front desk about where to go or what to eat and they always show aloha in helping you. The rooms are cleaned daily and fresh towels are always ready for you. I cannot explain how great the front desk people are. Christianne, Christina, Ron, Josh are always smiling and want to help every guest. You can easily walk to the beach, the International Market, grocery store, restaurants or any other entertainment. They provide various kitchen cookware along with dishes and microwave (remember theres a stove too). The small refrigerator is just the right size to hold you groceries.Do keep in mind and ask about the parking, because in Honolulu parking almost always costs. So don't be surprised when you have an additional charge if you request parking conveniently at the hotel.The only thing I hated about the hotel was leaving. I wanted to stay.

The “White Sands” hotel is just in the middle of Waikiki although in a very quiet street. It is not the Hilton but the quality/price ratio is excellent. It is kind of singular as it is not the usual tall buildings all over Waikiki. It is only a three-story hotel and it is full of trees and plants and it also has a small Japanese garden. Add to this that people at the reception desk are friendly and helpful, we would like to thank specially Cristina for her help and kindness, and the conclusion is that “White Sands” hotel is a very good choice if you go to Waikiki.

It's one of a kind to be with during our long time planned vacation in this state and we were absolutely amazed in return of our expectations are well over it.The staffs are all helpful especially Kristina Hunt at the front desk she is well deserved to be in her post with all her smiles that gives us more relax to stay I guess that's what they call Aloha Spirit, where I can spread the word to all my friends and families that if ever they will be planning to visit Hawaii I would definitely recommend them Waikiki white sands hotel and I believe they will be smiling back home happily, I guaranty you that. Our experience of stay here is so much appreciated thanks to the managers of this property to hire good people to work for them.The pool is right there, jacuzzi and we can even set a party by the pool when some friends came by for a small get together drinking beers but we know our limits so it was really a good one. There's no restaurant inside but that's not a problem at all just take a short walk and we can find everything , so much to talk about, I can't ask for more, well be back again... Thank you so much
user_name:
Su C
Hong Kong, null, Hong Kong

review_body: Thank you all for making our stay at your hotel so very nice! The rooms are clean with a nice kitchenette with everything needed to cook. We had balcony with pool view where we looked into a nice garden with plants and palm trees :) My Daughter and I are so glad we choose this hotel while our stay on Waikiki for 2 weeks. I would really recommend this hotel to all families and couples :-)Also the staff are great, all of them and especially Cristina who I will meet again when I will be back in January :-)Helle from Norway

This hotel was a great surprise. Because I didn't anticipate staying in the hotel room very long during my vacation (just to sleep and shower) I decided to opt for a lower cost hotel. I thought for the price something would be severely out of order or that service would be lacking. We were pleasantly surprised. We had a nice sized, quiet room with all the amenities other hotels provide. We were greeted by nice employees. Christieann and Cristina were so nice and so was their supervisor Paul. The room we had faced Nohonani street which wasn't a great view but we had a balcony and we enjoyed a few quiet mornings out there. The location is perfect too. Near great restaurants and the beach. When I come back, I will be staying here.

My wife and I recently stayed in Honolulu for a few days to visit friends before heading to one of the other islands for a week. Since we were only going to be on Oahu for three nights and didn't plan on spending much time at the hotel I didn't want to spend a lot. I've stayed in Honolulu many times, am very familiar with the area. I ended up choosing the White Sands because of the price, amenities and locations, mainly because it has a small kitchenette in the room. The first thing I noticed was the friendliness of the check-in staff, particularly Jason. The service was fast and efficient, and the friendliness was genuine, not forced or phony. Jason seemed to go out of his way to make us feel welcome. Pluses: the room was older but clean. the outdoor area is very nice, pool and hot tub well maintained. My wife enjoyed lounging by the pool with some wine while I went scuba diving. (Center Ring Diving, check them out!) They have free WiFi, which the more expensive hotels charge for. Another plus, the location is fantastic, just a few hundred yards away from the International Marketplace, and about a 5 minute walk to the beach at Waikiki.Really just a couple of negatives: first, at least in our room, the AC was a small, old and tired window unit. We were there during a particularly warm week and the AC had a really tough time keeping up with it. Another downer: this is an older, lower priced hotel and it showed in the beds. They were on the hard side, it's time for new ones.Note: They have their own parking lot, but it is small. Call to reserve a spot when you book a room. Otherwise, there is public parking nearby.

The hotel is located at 10 minutes (walking) from Waikiki beach. It is near the bus stop (Kuhio Ave/ Seaside Ave) to reach Honolulu downtown, and Diamond Head or other beaches like Sandy Beach or Hanauma Bay (Bus 22). The hotel should be renovated, but it is clean and the room I occupied was near the swimming pool (room 104a). There is also a Jacuzzi near the swimming pool. WiFi is free but it do not work fast in the room. You have to go outside near the convivial zone around the swimming pool. I used it from the room using a slower connection. Every days the towels were changed. Receptionists were very friendly.

Me and my mom decided to stay at the White Sands Hotel. This hotel was small but it was filled with helpful staff like Cristina Hunt. All of the staff here helped us through of where to go and they gave us directions. The White Sands Hotel is very convenient and it is very close to some places like Waikiki Beach, The International Market Place and more. Around the International Market Place you will see some exciting things at night. There will be performers, magicians and more! Me and my mom suggest you to stay at the White Sands Hotel because it is very convenient, and the staff here are very friendly and there's a swimming pool and jacuzzi here too!

convenient for Waikiki, luggage room very useful, Paul and other staff very helpful. Nice to be allowed to use pool after checking out while waiting for shuttle which was on time. Wifi was available on ground level only I think.
user_name:
david s
Pago Pago, American Samoa

review_body: The staff who were in (Paul, Christieann and Jason) were helpful, smiling,we were able to stay at the pool until the shuttle came, even if it was after check out. Did not have to ask they offer, great!They put our luggage in the luggage's room, when we had to go back to pick up something from our bags, they stay around smiling until we were done. Thank you.

We stayed at the White Sands Hotel in Waikiki and found it an excellent choice. Paul, the manager, and the staff (including Ron, Christieann, Cristine, Jason, and Rogie) were very friendly and helpful. We need an accessible room and the White Sands was a great choice. My wife needed an ambulance late one night and the night staff were right on it. Everything turned out fine and the White Sands staff were very considerate and caring.

As a resident of Oahu, my partner and I love taking "staycations" and we don't want to break the bank. White Sands is the perfect venue with its ample parking (a must for us on staycations) and its friendly staff, especially Paul. He has fabulous suggestions, and I thought I knew Waikiki, his ideas were creative. Check out the White Sands whether you are on a staycation or a vacation, its so relaxing!

I recently visited Waikiki & had a local friend suggest the white sands hotel in the heart of downtown Waikiki. the location is absolutely perfect if you enjoy the downtown scene & nightlife, & prefer to cut down on driving & cab rides. From the moment i checked in to the White Sands Hotel, i was impressed. They went out of their way to accommodate us & make us feel extremely welcome. every single member of the staff was extremely friendly & helpful, although i mostly dealt with the night staff. The night security, Ray, was very helpful when i got lost & needed assistance. who knows where i may have ended up... Christie Ann, Paul, Jason, & Ese were all very friendly & pleasant to interact with also! No matter how many times i needed towels, they were always happy to give them to me.  One of the best parts of my stay was the price! I was amazed to find such a reasonably priced hotel so close to downtown Waikiki, or anywhere in Hawaii for that matter! The rooms were very clean, spacious, & comfortable. The kitchenette space was good sized, & the beds were very comfortable. Even though we were excited to go to Maui, i really didn't want to leave. I really felt @ home @ the White Sands Hotel, & i very much look forward to returning in the fall & i will certainly return. I definitely recommend this hotel, or any of their properties to anyone looking to stay in Waikiki, including the Ewa hotel, as i've also stayed there the visit previous.
user_name:
Austin A
Portland, Oregon, United States

review_body: This inexpensive hotel is friendly, clean and located in the heart of Waikiki. I recommend this little gem.

My partner and I spent 2 weeks traveling around Hawaii and this was easily our favourite hotel! The staff were very friendly and helpful. The location is central Waikiki (2 minute walk from the beach) the buses stop at the end of the road. Would highly recommend the hotel to anyone!

My family and I stayed here for a week whilst we were in Waikiki celebrating my Mum's birthday. We booked two rooms with kitchenettes, we had one room with a kitchenette and the other with a fridge and a microwave- the two rooms did not warrant the same price and were not as described, luckily the rooms were reasonably closeby so shared keys and used the one kitchen, although not ideal.I had emailed the hotel before our arrival and told them it was a special trip for my Mum's birthday and requested rooms closeby with a nice view if possible. The rooms overlooked the car park and flats opposite- not my idea of a great view but then apart from looking out over the swimming pool there wasn't a nice view.The rooms were comfortable to sleep in although noise was an issue at night as doors constantly slammed and we could hear the traffic at night. We were woken up most mornings by the rubbish collection which came really early at about 5am, I sleep very deeply and it even woke me up. Not my idea of sleeping in paradise!The housekeepers came daily but the room was not clean when we arrived and was never actually cleaned! Seriously, there were bits of food on the floor not just under the sofa and bed but all over. We even found a sandal down the back of the sofa and a sock just on the floor behind a chair. The bathroom floor was disgusting especially by the toilet and there were weird stains on the walls which was really disgusting. We never felt clean in the rooms and couldn't walk round barefoot. The only way we knew the cleaners had been in the room was because our rubbish had been emptied and taken even if it wasn't put in the bin (that means it wasn't rubbish!)The man at the front desk was always very miserable and didn't seem to want to help us but Christie Ann was really friendly, happy and always helpful. Aside from the location and the pool and hot tub facilities she really is the only other positive about this hotel.I would not stop someone from booking this hotel as it was reasonably priced and is in quite a good location but just so you know what you are getting. After spending a week in Maui in a similarly priced hotel which was amazing to come to this hotel was really quite a shock and we wished it had been the other way around but we weren't to know.

White Sands is a great little hotel in the middle of Waikiki. All of the staff were super friendly and helpful with everything while we were there. The pool area is great, and it was very convenient to have a kitchenette in the room. A "budget friendly" hotel with better staff than a lot of pricier hotels that I have stayed at. Definitely recommend it to anyone looking for a convenient and reasonably priced place to stay in Waikiki!
