I am so excited to be staying at the White Sands. I have read all the reviews and taken in the bad with the good. And the good seem rule! I love that everyone raves about the staff. It is so important to be able to have great communication and friendly faces. I look forward to meeting you all very soon!Maria and the clan!

I've being going to Hawaii every two years for some time now and saw this place while staying at another hotel near by. I chose this place this time due to price. Once I booked and paid the deposit, I noticed that I was charged twice for one of the two rooms I booked. I called and it was QUICKLY corrected. If have/had a question about the rooms (if they were close to each other/ could they be close) it was answered very fast and nicely. I CANNOT wait to get here to enjoy my vacation on 7/5/12 through 7/10/12.

9-11 June 2012. Upon Check- in we reieved a happy Aloha greeting by The Desk agent Christieanii. Nice pool in the back. Rooms clean , beds were nice to sleep in. A nice Hawaiian budget hotel to stay in. Located on a quite side street. We had no parking problem. Both of us enjoyed our weekend stay Because of the Hotel Staff and Their welcoming Hawaiin Spirit. Michael and Linda.

let me start by saying this hotel was perfect. Pricing was good,the staff was pleasant and our room was even upgraded. The kitchen was awesome,the shower was hot and the room i must say was clean.My only issue is i was charged for parking our first night but didn't have a stall to park in.The security guard did manage to find me a parking on the street for the night but I still had to get up by 7 a.m. to feed the meter, not my idea of a vacation,and also the bed needs to be changed, I could feel the springs.

This hotel was in an amazing location, the pool area is top notch! They have a bbq for you to use to cook dinner if you choose. The room was a room... Shower, bed. Nice they had a microwave, frig, and coffee maker in the room. My only draw back was the room needed a little deep cleaning... dusting of the fixtures and picture frames.... I finally took a wash cloth and did it my self... but maybe I am too picky. I loved the staff and were always friendly and kind. I will be staying here on my vacations to Hawaii in the future!
user_name:
Gary H
Gresham, Oregon, United States

review_body: This was our first time to Hawaii and we weren't sure where to stay but found the White Sands and was impressed with the price. The rooms were dated but very clean except the carpets could be replaced.The location was great being so close to everything and a nice little oais in the middle of it all. The staff Paul-manager ,Christieann M,Cristina H, Christina B,Rogie C, and Ron G were helpful,curtious, and so pleasant. Our last day there while waiting for the shuttle to the airport we met Craig Matsuura area director of facilities and had a great visit with this charming man who told us his wife had a health issue and we sincerely hope things are improving everyday and she is doing well. God Bless both of them. Sincerely Gary/ Pam Spurrell Mahalo
user_name:
Gary S
Clay City, Kentucky, United States

review_body: Now, first and foremost, I'm not the typical American who knit picks and complains about a cup not being placed in the cupboard upon arrival (although this surely wasn't the case)....but before I came, I looked for the most reasonably priced hotel in Waikiki. This was my best bet and might I say I'm very fortunate for choosing this place. Front desk concierge (Christieann) provided the best customer service I've experienced in USA. Bubbly, always smiling, always laughing, excellent and accurate in directions...most importantly, knew where the hotspots in Waikiki were. Hotel was upgraded and I had a mega sized room with steamy hot water that lasted for the longest. Pool right outside, central to everything, fridge, balcony, everything your perfect hotel would have. Oh, and I was able to cook in my room. Definitely will save and stay here rather than staying at over priced hotels in the area. Mahalo White Sands!

For the price of under $100 with tax you get a clean basic room, with a good bed, fridge and coffeemaker, swimming pool and whirlpool. Hotel could use some updates. All rooms have a lanai, not necessarily over looking the pool. Road noise is not bad, close to Kuhio and about five blocks from beach access if you walk thru international market place along Duke Lane . Staff is extremely helpful and will store your bags after check out.

This was our first visit, and to my surprise it was the perfect accomodations for a basketball team. The staffwas outstanding, it fit our budget, very clean and a good location. Mahalo to Front Desk Christieann, Manager Paul and Housekeeping very efficient and friendly... Very Ohana.... We are returning in July 2012. Upcountry Kings Basketball Team, Maui
user_name:
Earlette S
Makawao, Hawaii, United States

review_body: The room was clean and the staff was great! There were locals and vistors there and will be returning soon.

We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights.For the price,nothing to say:the room was clean,the service excellent and the persons at the front desk ( Christieann and Paul) were very friendly and helped us a lot for every questions we had.Francine,Judth,Daniel and Bruno,from Sherbrooke Quebec Canada.

I was quite happy to stumble across White Sands Hotel. It has everything I need in a hotel. I like to feel at home when I travel but still have a few luxuries, like maid service and excellent customer service. The staff is very friendly and helpful and make you feel right at home. I felt like family by the time I left! The pool area is clean and very relaxing, with a beautiful waterfall flowing, surrounded by tranquil palm trees dancing in the breeze. Just across the street is lots of shopping from the Apple store to the International Market (my favorite place). A few more steps and your at Waikiki's famous aqua blue beach! A big Mahalo to all the staff, Christienne, Ron, Paul, Christina and Esse! We miss you and hope to see you all soon! -Janet and Damon

I have to admit that I had very low expectations when I first booked my stay. I went with the best price I could find and figured it would be a run down place, but I was wrong! At check in, Ron was extremely helpful and friendly. He seemed interested in what we had going on and wanted to help. I was surprised by how spacious our room was. We ended up hanging in our room much more than we anticipated because we could relax, have some drinks, and enjoy getting ready for the busy day. Our balcony over looked trees and the hot tub, which was nice. I loved having the kitchen in the room. We made breakfast every morning, which saved us some money. It is so close to shopping, bars/clubs, and the beach! It is definitely in a party area, so if you're looking for a secluded, romantic get away, you may want to look elsewhere. You can definitely still have a romantic time, but the area was best for those wanting to get out and go! The only downside was parking, but that is with any place in Waikiki. Loved my stay and I would definitely return.

White Sands is a 3 story walk up built in the 50's style.We have stayed there many times. It is now owned by Aqua and they are doing lots of needed upkeep. The staff is very good including the housekeepers, front desk, maintainence and Paul (the manager). AND--yes we are going back in 2013.

This is a small hotel on the back streets of Waikiki. I stayed there because they advertised parking for a fee and kitchenettes. There was no parking when I got there as their lot is tiny. They referred me to a private lot across the street. The ticket machine in that lot was not working so I had to park in another hotel lot on the next block that cost $25 per night. $25 per night parking is pretty standard for Waikiki. I went to use the kitchenette and found that every dinner plate in the cupboard had old food stuck too it which was disgusting. I picked up a water glass from the cupboard which was also filthy. They provided a kitchen cloth and dish towel but no detergent to clean the dishes. I would be afraid to eat off anything in those cupboards. I kicked off my shoes when I entered the room which is the Hawaiian style. After a few minutes I looked down at my socks and they were black. The floors were also very dirty. I took a cloth and wiped it across the light fixture in the bathroom it it came back full of dirt. The place is very dirty and I would not stay there again. I gave it a poor rather than terrible rating because the location is not bad and the front desk staff is very nice and really does try to help. My advice is pay a little more and stay somewhere else. I read several glowing reviews on TripAdvisor before booking. After seeing my room I checked the reviews again and noticed that many of them were written by people who had only ever done one review. This makes me wonder if they are reviews from real guests.

Staff was very nice and friendly. Hotel is in a good location, the pool area is very nice, and the rooms are kept clean. The only problem is a lack of parking spots, but otherwise I had a great stay and will definitely return.

I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights while my ship was in Pearl Harbor. Yes, it is old but for the price, it can't be beat. My room had 2 beds, a kitchenette, and a dining table. I had a balcony overlooking the pool. It was a really comfortable room. The wifi doesn't work in the rooms, you pretty much have to be on top of the router which is down in the lounge but that was okay with me. I like to relax when I come to Hawaii, not check facebook a thousand times a day. If you want more luxury, a better view, be closer to the ocean, and better wifi, you'll need to cough up a couple hundred more a night but I'll definately recommend this place to my friends and will also visit this hotel again.

If you’re not into the big box, impersonal hotels, this is the hotel for you. It is centrally located, nice room’s, great courtyard with a waterfall, pool, jacuzzi, trees and plants that gives you the most relaxing atmosphere you can have. Their best asset is there staff. They are extremely friendly and professional. One in particular is the customer service receptionist Christenna. She always has a smile and greeting for you and can help you with any questions you have about the facility or how to get to anyplace you want to go to. This hotel will definitely be my primary place to stay.

I will stay here again nice room wonderful staff price is right. no coffee maker in room, mentioned it to front desk next morning they brought me a new one. I needed to extend my stay 1 day But they were booked, Christie was wonderful and got me set up at a sister hotel across the street.Here on business traveling alone this is a bargain no frills hotel with a nice tropical courtyard and pool. perfect for me.Thank You

Just return with my wife from waikiki HI stayed white sands Hotel and was suprised, big clean room #202 the staff was awesome,check in and out excellent, of course is not a big five star hotel, but is my fourth time in hawaii and i have done Hiltons, Ali condos, Marriott, and now White Sands, and i am going back to White Sands! saved money, great attention, on a perfect quite street a spot near everything ,shops, supermarkets, busstop, International market, Wakiki beach, can't ask for more, By this mean i do want to thank the white Sands staff for making my vacations so special on a good low budget. recomend this hotel. ( this opinion is from a person whos been traveling on his vacation for17 years around the world). Jafet Hernandez PR.

We had a great time there recently. The room was big, clean, and opened onto the best little green courtyard in the middle of the otherwise concrete jungle that is Waikiki. If you have an easy-going personality and aren't expecting the Hilton, it'll work fine. It's been a while since the decor has been updated, but we really didn't care. Note: make sure you get a courtyard view - it'll make a huge difference to your stay. And we really appreciated that we had use of hotel facilities even after we checked out, as our plane didn't take off until 10:30 at night. Great experience overall.

We stay every year for a month at the White Sands. This year we brought our whole family for a week. The staff is wonderful, Christieanh is so helpful at the front desk. Always smiling and eager to help with anything we needed. The cleaning staff was very nice to us all and at one point there, was 17 of us, so they had their work cut out for them. The rooms were good, except for a few little things like not having an oven, but we were so close to all of the restaurants, it gave us a good reason to go out.

White Sands Hotel has a very friendly, helpful staff and they do make you feel very welcome to the hotel. For the location and price it is perfect. The only bad part was the condition of the room I was in. It made me feel like I was 'stuck in the 70's' with old fixtures, about a 20 inch T.V. that was probably from the 80's (not flatscreen) and the condition of the vanity cabinets was pretty bad, bed was hard too. I really think all the hotel needs are rennovations to the rooms. The location was perfect, staff VERY friendly and helpful and the price was fantastic. So if you need a place to lay your head just for a night this would be the best bet because of the location and price.

My husband and I stayed at the White Sands Hotel in Waikiki. Our first look into the hotel was the swimming pool which automatically we thought about our children and that we'd have to bring them here. The front office staff (Ron) was AMAZING! He answered our questions that we had and of course did so in a polite way. When we walked into our room it didn't stink, which is always a plus in our book. We had a queen and twin bed along with the kitchenette (which was a plus) on the third floor overing the pool and the room was cleaned everyday with fresh towels too. As an 'ohana we are planning on returning to the hotel July 2012, just before our keiki return to school. AWESOME overall experience! Location, staff, room, cleanliness, price!!

My husband and I stayed at the White Sands Hotel. The staff was great and very helpfu;. The room had everything we needed but instead of the queen size bed we had requested, we got 2 twin beds. The rooms were cleaned everyday and were clean when we arrived. The pool and hot tub was wonderful and the garden was beautiful. I would stay there again if I get the chance to go back.

The hotel is old but it's wonderful because you can breath fresh air, it's relaxing specially if you are staying at the pool view room... I love the way they treat their guests you can really feel that they are happy to serve you... Soon i'll be back again in this hotel

The White Sands Hotel is walking distance from Waikiki Beach and is one of the best inexpensive places to stay in the area except for the Hawaiian King next door. The staff is very helpful and friendly. Although the hotel is a little run down, the poolside rooms are the best, they are working hard to accommodate their guests and make improvements as they are able. I would definitely stay there again.
user_name:
Kathy T
San Luis Obispo, California

review_body: Best in Waikiki, this is truely a great little hotel, very friendly staff, great location, close to everything, clean room, wonderfull courtyard, within short walking distance to the beach. I tavel to Waikiki often have stayed at several hotels and this is truely the best. Cant wait to see you all May 7th.

Nice quite and cousy hotel with lovely garden. I liked it was not one of those skyscrapers like most of Honolulu hotels are. The room was comfortable enough and very clean. Staff was really great - absolutely friendly and helpful-made me feel like home. Very good location - walk distance to the beach and bus stop is very close, easy to get around.

Pros: Clean, quiet, cheap and excellent location, nice old fashioned motel ambience, friendly staffCons: Old, basic facilities eg no internet or hotel restaurant so in house dining not an option (although there is a very small and basic kitchenette in the room), hard bed

We stayed in March, for 5 days, then went to Maui, and came back for another 10 days. Very friendly and accomodating staff. Thanks to Paul (and all)! We had our absentee ballots sent there, and the staff was aware and they were there waiting for us when we came back from Maui. Location is terrific for Waikiki nightlife and restaurants, a few steps off Kuhio. Pool is great, with lots of sun all day, when you don't want to walk the few blocks to the beach. We actually loved the layout, one of the few examples of classic Waikiki vs the concrete towers. We were last in Hawaii in 2002, and hotel prices have gone up dramatically, but White Sands is a great value!

Me and my wife were in Honolulu for 5 nights. For $85 a night in the middle of Waikiki this is a bargin. Rooms were not luxurious but that is not what we are paying for. Walking distance to everything. Best bang for your buck! Staff is friendly and helpful. Would definitely go there again.Not very kids friendly though as there is no elevator.

both describe this place, but i dont mean negatively. if you walked in to the pool area surrounded by the hotel rooms (or years ago im sure motel), it looks like something out a 1960's spring break movie. Its in a good location in waikiki. rooms are clean, has a smal frig, 2 burner stove (at least mine did), free wifi worked well but i was close to the lobby and i dont know signal strenth someplace else. the place has a small pool that you can do lapsin and a great hot tub. cable is ok and the tv a brand i never heard of , but i didnt come to waikiki to watch tv. the place is cheaper than most and the kitchen is helpful to cut down on the bills. i rated it a 4 because the rate was good though they have raised their rates in the last year and a continuing trend in that direction may make looking at other places useful and this place no longer having frugal ambiance.HELPFUL hint 1: the bbq costs $10 to rent a day if that was factor in renting this place.helpful hint 2: if you are a lite sleeper ask for a room that doesnt face the multi story parking lot.helpful hint 3 -- the place has no elevators so unless you are into slogging your suitcases to the 3rd foor, request a room on 1 or 2. i usually rent on 2 as i prefer the lanais to the lanais on 1.helpful hint 4 -- and those under 45 owe me -- you can book at this place thru the waikiki ocean backpasckers at 1/3 less than an old guy like me can.

We stayed at White Sands just last week and had the most wonderful experience...First of all I understand that this is a budget hotel and I was worried about the location and staff and how safe it was going to be.White sands was one of two hotels we stayed in during our trip to Honolulu.We were checked in really fast and even that we were early, the room was ready.After getting into our room that was really nice and clean by the way, just had kind of an old hotel smell, but we were in Hawaii it is really humid and you will get used to that. First night was really relaxing and quiet. Second day however we had a leak and no one knew where the water was coming from, We talked to the guys at the front desk and the hotel was booked up so they couldn't move us and the moisture in the room was pretty uncomfortable. Old plumbing, old hotel. The security guard was amazing and said if we wanted to leave the door propped open he would make sure no one would walk in at night and guard it, he brought a boat load of towels and tried to dry the carpet. The next morning we came up to the front desk and we were told that the staff will move our bags into a new room and we do not have to worry about anything. and the new room was a really nice upgrade and all the staff was so apologetic... as I said it isan older hotel but the people working there are amazing and friendly and so helpful unlike most places we stayed in in Waikiki. the location of this hotel is actually pretty amazing, close to the beach, great restaurants and bus stops. Give this place a chance it is a great place with a very nice clean pool, great staff. amazing and personable manager. you won't regret your stay with The White Sands.

My partner and I were staying for a few nights until our other hotel room was ready. The rooms were pretty basic, old 70's kinda of curtains and bedding but the staff was wonderful. Our room had a leak that was coming from somewhere, they upgraded us to a better room with kitchenette and a nicer bathroom. They were more than happy to accommodate us and even gifted us a bottle of wine for the inconvenience! If you're looking for a basic room (you're gonna be out and about anyways), great customer service and smiles from the staff, this is a great choice! We will be returning to this hotel during the summer!

I stayed there recently during 2 nights. It is a low & medium budget hotel well located in Waikiki. There is a parking lot (25$ per 24 hours, which is a regurlar price for Waikiki).The staff is very sweet, friendly and helpful. Thank you all and special thanks to ChristiAnn. It definitely makes the difference.

I wanted a cheap hotel room and that is exactly what I got. Bathroom floor was disgusting -even after requesting that the floor be cleaned again-still GROSS. I ended up scrubbing it myself -cloths came up pretty darn black! The single bed was comfortable but the queen needs a new mattress-it had large 'dips" in it. Didn't rent a car so no comment on the parking charge-please remember folks that you pay for parking EVERYWHERE on the island and parking space is at a premium.Noise-well maybe I am just getting old but it think the door slamming and partying should be done by midnite.... Nope - 2:30am the "exchange students" were still out and about.. Security did get them to quiet down tho. This hotel seems to be a mecca for language students and backpackers. OR the elderly. There was lots of early 20s folk and the balance seemed to be the elderly. Saw no families here.The Location was super tho! Only one block from Kuhio Ave and about 3 blocks from the beach. Very central and easy to get to. I would stay here again -now that I know to bring earplugs and Lysol wipes.

I needed to attend a seminar for 5 days in Honalulu.Cheap Tickets connected me with White Sands and I couldn't have been happier!I was able to cook 2 meals a day in room. Had all I needed. Centrally located in Waikiki,walking distance to beach,food stores,shopping and public transportation which I used everyday!There is a sufficient pool,hot tub and the most awesome locals running this place!Once per month they celebrate their staff with a luncheon on site and include awards!Is that happening at Marriot?I would return to White Sands with out a doubt!

We had a wonderful stay at the White Sands Hotel in Waikiki. The Service desk was most kind and helpful. Cristina, Christlina and Christy-Ann were so pleasant to work with. Meeting Josiah at the tour desk was also a pleasure. Room service was especially good with the diamond jewel Harlene doing a super job for us. Ron at the service desk helped us out alot especially with the internet. Just a super experience in our lives staying at the White Sands Hotel. Kud

We were flying out at 11:30 and decided to save some extra $ by staying here. We were given a room with 3 single beds. I felt as if I was back in a dorm room. The TV was awful. Only 7 American channels came in. There was hair all over the bathroom and in the sheets. We did manage to push together two of the beds to take a nap. The $15/nt parking is just another add-on. Positive is the location is two blocks from the strip and a block from some resteraunts.

Centrally Located -- 5 minutes from Beach ! Friendly Staff ! --- Our room was old and the kitchenette area is very small -- but for 1-2 people it will do. It is NOT the cleanest place !!!. Dissapointed that the jacuzzi never worked -- and the Pool is FREEZING ! The little waterfall by the Jacuzzi was cute .But if you can get it for a descent price -- its ok !

I was looking for budget accommodations for a quick trip to Honolulu, and this hotel came up as a package option on Expedia. “Budget” doesn’t have to be synonymous with dirty or dumpy, but that’s pretty much how I’d have to sum up the White Sands Hotel.When we arrived, I discovered that the parking lot consisted of about 8 parking spaces. There was no parking garage. Even with my small economy car, it was tough to maneuver through this tight parking lot. This task was made even more difficult by someone’s long truck that was parked by the exit and hampered one’s ability to get through the tight turn. For this, you pay an extra $20 per day.We accessed our rooms by walking down a hallway with filthy carpets. It wasn’t a comforting first impression.Our “suite” came with two twin beds, a Hollywood-style daybed that doubles as a sofa, and a tiny kitchen. The beds must have had the cheapest mattresses the hotel could obtain, perched on wobbly metal frames. There was one small pillow on each bed. The scratchy blankets made me think longingly of my former Army barracks in basic training – the Army beds and blankets were more comfortable. My daughter pulled the blankets off one of the beds and slept on the daybed, as it had a slightly better mattress. The bathroom was none too clean – the floor could have used a good mopping with some strong cleaning fluid. The shower was about 30” by 30” in size. The kitchen consists of a microwave, a half-size refrigerator, a sink, and two burners. It’s very tiny, but was adequate for preparing breakfast cereal and light meals. I would have appreciated it if the kitchen had been stocked with some salt and pepper. The first night I was there, I poured some unused lemonade down the sink and didn’t notice that the sink stopper kept it from draining out of the sink. When I returned at the end of our first full day in Oahu, I noticed that the lemonade was still in the sink; the maids hadn’t drained it or cleaned it. As an experiment, I deliberately left it there the second day. It didn’t get cleaned then, either. There is a safe in the closet, which seemed like a good idea for security purposes, but you have to go to the lobby and obtain a key for $2/day for the privilege of using it. Better hotels have safes with combination locks that you can set yourself, and they don’t charge you for their use.The lanai “view” was non-existent, and there are no sheer curtains. It’s either reveal yourself to the world or have your room plunged into darkness by the drapes.The HVAC unit appeared to have a thermostat, but the A/C ran constantly, despite the setting.The wireless internet seemed to work adequately.The only reason that I ranked this hotel two stars is because one star is the minimum on TripAdvisor, and I’ve stayed at two other motels in my lifetime that have been worse. Since the locks and deadbolts worked, I didn’t feel overly worried about my safety, and at least the maids had made an attempt to clean the unit before our arrival. And the air conditioning worked, so we didn’t roast. I have to admit that the hotel was surprisingly un-noisy for its location in a busy urban section of Waikiki. If all you want is a place to crash, this might be OK, but I think there must be better budget options out there.

We stayed here for a week in Sept. 2011 & really enjoyed it. We were upgraded free to a large double room with a view of the hot tub & swimming pool. Everything in the rooms worked & the staff were friendly & very helpful! We were close to everything & had an assigned parking space. If we go back to Oahu we'll surely stay here again!!!!!
Pros: Has a fridge and stove. Quiet. PriceCons: Dingy. Parking is $25 a night. No internet signal in my room. No elevator to third floor. I would not recommend staying here.

Loved the location--within walking distance from the beach, shops, etc. of Waikiki. The pool area was beautifully landscaped. Our balcony faced the pool so the view was excellent. The desk staff were very friendly and accomodating. Now the bad--I found several foreign hairs on the bathroom and kitchen floor when we checked in--the floors had obviously not been swept and mopped. I had to ask to have the maid to clean the floor in order for it to get cleaned at all during our stay. The hall carpets of this hotel are ratty and stained. Nobody clued us in that we had to use the computer cord in the room to access WIFI--when we initially asked why we couldn't get it in the room the staff told us we could only access it in the lobby near the wireless router on the front desk. The last day of our trip we realized we could have had WIFI the whole time! I would probably stay elsewhere my next trip.

We were looking for cheap central accommodation, we wanted a kitchenette so we could be independant. We asked for a pool view, and when we asked for a balcony also they happily changed us. We enjoyed the privacay and although we lost the pool side, it was a good move as it was quieter. The place was tired, but had everything we needed. A pool to cool down in, a spa for tired feet, internet, and friendly people. Our room was well equipped with all we could need. Very good position for pick-ups for tours, buses,and walking distance.It was good value for what we wanted to spend.

This hotel was okay for our budget holiday in Oahu. Can't beat the price for location and a pretty good pool. Booked the cheapest room and had a view of a wall but that's the way it goes for $80 in Waikiki. Kitchenette was a bonus but could of used a better cleaning, room was good size, 26" tv, ice maker and laundry in lobby. Wifi in lobby and at pool and maybe in some pool view rooms. Easy walking distance to most things in Waikiki and there are some cheaper restaurants close by, the busiest nightclubs are 2 blocks away. We paid $18 a day for parking and the lot was full on the weekend, never saw any empty street parking stalls in five days so best to reserve a spot. Overall a good stay but we new not to expect anything special. If you have never stayed in a budget hotel before you might be disappointed but I feel it is one of best deals in Waikiki.

if your not looking for fancy ocean front hotel and you want a good location on a budget the White Sands is a fair place. looks like it used to be an apratment complex, pool in center courtyard is nice with pretty trees! rooms are fine ours had a little kitchenette too with a lanai overlooking the pool! not too modern but on a budget its fine, fairly clean but again older buildings,walking distance to everywhere, friendly staff also!

As a long time Hawaiiana customer I was thrilled to find that the entire staff had gone to work at the White Sands Hotel, formerly known as Celebrity Resorts. I was uncomfortable with the location after dark, but seeing the same familiar faces year after year is the draw for me, especially Lisa and Christieann. I had two stays at White Sands since the closing of the Hawaiiana and had two more planned. I was disappointed to find that a management company was hired and Lisa was let go with one days notice. I cannot support a business that treats its long time loyal employees with such insensitivity. I cancelled my reservation and will not be staying there again. I am currently trying to find a new place to call "home" if anyone has any recommendations.

Paid over 100 dollars to stay in a dirty hotel room, but above all the management was terrible. No bathroom for me to use upon check in and the room was ready. Then they informed me I needed to put down a 500 dollar security deposit ( after paying for the room)! This proved to be money hungry management because when I asked to see this is there policy it was no where to be found. I was told t was a new rule, but no where was it written in the policy. Needless to say after an hour of them trying to get my 500 extra dollars they didn't make me pay it.Also they are running a hostel out of this hotel!?And there are women selling themselves on the street it's on. Don't stay here.

Stayed at White Sands for 6 nights in September 2010 and will stay again. This hotel is 4 stories high without an elevator. I stayed on the second floor with a room overlooking the pool area.Pros:- 4 blocks from Waikiki beach - Large rooms with kitchen (fridge, 2-burner stove, sinkm 2-person dining table)- Air conditioned- Small pool w/BBQ area- TV w/cable- Fold out couch- Coin-op laundry- Cleaning service everyday. Never saw a bug- No street noise- Large lanaiCons:- Older hotel- No elevator (but not a problem since we were on the 2nd floor)- Smoke detector chirped in the hallway like it needed batteries replaced. Told the front desk but it was never fixed. Slept with earplugs.- No bathtub (but nice walk in shower)Overall we're very happy with the room. It's an oldie but goodie and the price was excellent. If we can get the same price in the future we'll be staying there again. It's on Nohonani between the International Market and the canal. It's a great location and we had no problem getting around. We took Robert's shuttle from the airport to the hotel (drop off at Ilima which is next door to the White Sands) and walked or took the Bus everywhere. If you need to rent a car there's an Enterprise across the street which is convenient for pick up and drop off but the prices are more expensive than if you had rented from the airport. Tip - Pick up those tourist magazines, there are a lot of coupons in them.

when we first arrived we were coming 4 a anniversery it almost turned into a divorce party..But as things went on they got nothing but better. The staff was a- Ok . First nite we got lost 4 3 Hrs. Thanx Briane could,nt have made it without/u you da man.And lady Catheryn girl u can really lay out a game plan. Arron truly the cooliest brother on th e beach And last But certainl not lease the Mayor George and the first lady megd. Much love Al and phyllis Akron,Ohio 4 sho Oh, YeaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaH !!!!!!!!!!!!!!

About to plan our 4th trip to Celebrity Resort Waikiki, stayed 3 times in 2008. Just checked online and they don't appear to be operating under this name anymore, does anyone know if they are still operating?Basic accommodation, but great value and fantastic location in the heart of Waikiki. Staff are great too.

Celebrity Resort WaikikiApril 6-15, 2009. Room 327. STOP! Unless you are staying at the Celebrity for free … and even then...don’t even think about it. I am at a loss as to why so many people give this place a decent rating. It’s run down and in serious need of a small, controlled fire. You can easily find other properties in Waikiki for the same price. Still not convinced? Read on.Before I go any further, in agreement with some of the other reviews, I have to say that the staff here are great. The desk staff are generally happy and helpful and the room staff keep the rooms clean..and that is no small task given the condition of the things.So…The Celebrity Resort is one of those quintessential 1950s-era block motels that you really want to like. The pics on their website show the décor and the prices (starting at $79/night for a studio) clue you into the fact that this place is not high-end and that’s fine. Honolulu is full of over-priced tower hotels so finding a small, cool motel in Waikiki would be great. However, the Celebrity is not it. The website offers the following quote.. “Situated amongst the hustle and bustle of metropolis Waikiki, the resort maintains the ambiance of Hawaii as it used to be 40 years ago - where the surf, sun and sea lull you into a tropical euphoria.” Sounds great. You’re thinking Ernest Hemingway’s Hawaii and a lush plantation resort on the ocean, right? Ok, let me translate that into plain, brutally honest English for you. “Set back on a dirty street within walking distance of a bunch of crappy souvenir stores and cheap bars, but nowhere near close enough to hear or see the suff the resort, which has not been updated in 40 years –offers noise, odors and rundown interiors which send you into a catatonic state.” We stayed in room 327 and 327a. These two rooms, a studio with kitchenette and a single hotel room have an adjoining door and are combined to make a 1 bedroom/ 2 bath suite though there is nothing sweet about it. Rooms 321-335 (odd numbers) on this side of the property face the street and they are both loud and not at all private. The garbage trucks (plural… I counted three) start about 6am and then it’s non-stop noise well into the night. However, if you’re into being an exhibitionist and fool enough to stay here…these rooms are perfect as no less than 100 apartments across the street have a clear view directly into these rooms and on the patios. The beds and the furnishing in the rooms (at least 327 and 327a) are bad, thread-bare and stained. The bathrooms are outdated and the tile in the showers is cracked and perma-stained. The water pressure is quite good so there’s something positive. Both rooms have a separate AC unit to keep the place cool if you need to chill for a bit and they are loud enough to block out the traffic noise.The kitchenette in the studio has a coffee pot, microwave, toaster oven, two burner stove top and a small mini-fridge. There are glasses, plates, knives and flatware. Not great stuff but it does the job if you want to stay in and cook something simple. The common areas of the hotel are a little better but still outdated and generally borderline junk. Yes, there is a pool in the center courtyard and if you have small children they will think it’s great. The beach is about a 3-5 minute walk away and you end up beach front at the Royal Hawaiian. The front desk at the Celebrity will give you towels, beach mats, etc. Just ask.I like to stay at a variety of places and I generally prefer to steer clear of the big name hotel chains as I traveled for business for a good 10 years and stayed in them too much. I like to find smaller, more hands-on hotels and motels that offer something out of the norm. But again, this place is not it. It’s just plain bad. Do your homework. If you want to stay in Waikiki there are a number of other properties in the same price range that have invested in updating and offer good quality interiors and furnishings.

The hotel is decent - we didn't expect anything more for the price we paid. The staff was friendly and the location is convenient to the city and Waikiki beach. We went on to another island and returned home 7 days after we left Celebrity Resort Waikiki. There was a message on my answering machine from Celebrity Resort which said we broke a lamp so they charged $55 to our credit card. I called the hotel, talked to Judy who was no longer friendly after I tried to explain to her that it might be a staff mistake because we didn't break anything. She said the charge is a done deal and I need to call the credit card company to dispute if I don't agree, then asked me to call back if I wanted to talk more because she had another call coming in. I understand that she has probably dealt with more of these phone calls than she'd like but she is in service industry, what happened to customers first? I wish Judy would put herself in my shoes to understand that a) no one likes to be accused of something they didn't do and b) it's okay to stay on the line to listen me (after all, I was the first caller) instead of brushing me off. I DO NOT recommend this hotel because of poor customer service after they got our money.

We stayed at the Celebrity in March for 8 days. We didn't get the room we had hoped for, but upon arrival accomodated us nicely and now we have a new favorite room! The place is very homey and comfortable. Close to everything and has everything you need close at hand. We have been here twice now and hope to come back again.The staff are wonderful and accomodating and the hotel is kept wonderfully clean. Aaron is a real gem! Used the bbq, the hall computer, pool and laundry facilites. So much nicer than the high rise we stayed at before. We walked everywhere. I pray they don't tear this place down and build a high rise in its place. God bless all of you may this place continue to thrive as it is.Miriam- Toronto Canada
As usual, our stay at the Celebrity was wonderful. Nice pool and hot tub. Very clean and attentive cheerful staff.

We stayed at the Celebrity from January 26th - Feb 16/2009This hotel is perfect. It is very old but well kept. There are always people walking around picking up falling leaves and cleaning the pool. There is no other place that I would stay in Waikiki. It is 3 floors max and no elevators to wait for.All rooms come with a small kitchen that is perfect if you are wanting to save a few buck. There are also 2 gas BBQ's on site (which was awesome). The hot tub is perfect but the pool was a bit cold...never stopped my kids from jumping in.They also have a computer to use there and coffee down stairs every morning from 7am to 10am. There is a laundry room there that has 2 washers & 2 dryers.The staff was perfect..I have never been treated so good in all my life...Would I stay here again...No questions about it....This is the best place to stay in Hawaii. If you are expecting the Hilton, you will be dissapointed. But if you love beautiful grounds (Back yard feeling) you will love this place..

I was a guest at the Celebrity for eight nights(Jan.21 to Jan 28,2009)My review title includes " at home" and that is what it was like to be a guest at this great 'oasis' type accomodation.The rooms are spacious,very clean with a great bed,kitchen,sofa and large bathroom.The property itself is very much like an oasis conventiently located to the beach,food and shoping.Minutes of walking to any of these locations.The staff are exceptional. Friendly,helpful,courteous and extremely accomodatiing. I found it difficult to leave such a friendly atmosphere.Its a must stay if you are travelling to Honolulu and want to be near the beach. A very safe area.I highly recommend this exceptional property.

I stayed there from January 18-25. For me, the pros outweighed the cons. The hotel room was clean and the staff was really helpful for finding places to go out and eat, shop and do activities. By the way, check with them on what discounts the hotel gives for certain stores. You get an 11% discount at Macy's and found out about it after I had been there! Whenever I go to a hotel, I have to use the pool and hot tub. I found both to be very clean and the hot tub was especially nice at night. Everyone was afraid to swim in the pool since it isn't heated, but I found a way around that. I went in the hot tub for about 15 minutes and then jumped in the pool. It was really refreshing. One of the nights, I did some night swimming. You get used to the water after about a minute. Another thing that I liked about the hotel was the fact that the kitchenette was well stocked and we were able to go to sam's club and buy some rib eye steaks to make on the grill. You couldn't get a steak that size at a restaurant for the price we got ours at Sams! One thing that's annoying is that you can only talk for 30 minutes per night long distance in the hotel rooms. If you need to talk longer, one of the staff members will tell you about this little mom&pop store that you can get a 5 dollar calling card from. It's way cheaper than the ones at the ABC stores (which are EVERYWHERE!). With my card, I was able to talk for 17 hours. That made me happy :-). When you walk out of the main entrance of the hotel, take a left and it should be on the left side. You'll walk past a bar and another hotel but it will be on the same block. You can't miss it. Another downside that annoyed the living cr*p out of me was that the shower head is only about 5 feet from the floor of the shower so even most women will get really frustrated with trying to take a shower in any of the rooms. This might be a deal breaker for some people but I was willing to put up with the inconvenience. Although, I'm 5'9 and I was SO happy to get home and take a "tall person" shower. Another downside to this place is the location. There is a bar right next to it and I think there are some other bars that are close to the hotel as well. The noise at night can get unbearable if you insist on leaving your window open. This is especially true if your room has a balcony facing the street. And if you don't have a time-share at this hotel, you won't know what room you'll get until you arrive with your luggage. At night, my dad insisted on leaving the window open :-(. At about 2am you'll hear lots of drunkards screaming their head off as they walk down the street. Believe me, you won't miss it. But wait! The noise isn't over yet! At about 6 in the morning, every morning, you'll hear a truck backing in to some hotel and it's the loudest beeping noise you'll ever hear. Believe me, if you're an early riser when you're on vacation, this 6am alarm won't fail you. BEEP BEEP BEEP BEEP (x6)The last thing that I'd like to point out is if you're not used to being in a warm climate and you think it might be a nice idea to take an evening walk since the air is warm and breezy, think about what safety precautions you would take in any major city. I was naive about it and decided to take a walk at 10pm in my shorts and t-shirt. It was 75 degrees and the breeze was going. When I was heading back to the hotel, I think I almost got jumped. I was walking down the same street (nohonani street) the the hotel was on and I glanced over and there was a Hawaiian guy across the street from me walking in the same direction as I was going. I glanced over and then he looked at me. Then I glanced again and he was still staring at me. The faster I walked, the faster he walked. Then I started walking across the street because that was where the hotel was and then he starts walking to the middle of the street like he wants to catch up with me. Then I started running to the hotel and I started cursing because it was that time of night where you need to stick your key into a slot to get the main hotel door open. If you want to go out at night, ask a friend to go with you and keep your cellphone where you can reach it quickly. Also, start getting your room key out about a block before you get to the hotel. I think they close the doors at 9, but sometimes it's earlier than that. If you can, leave your ID and other important cards in the safe an only bring as much cash as you think you'll need. Another thing, the street by the canal is pretty deserted at night and I would stay away from their especially if you insist on walking alone. It sounds like simple advice but everyone overlooks tips like these sometime in their lives. I hope I didn't scare too many people from staying at this hotel. If you can get over the noise, the low showers, and be very cautious when walking out at night, it's a good place to stay. The hotel is a 10 minute walk from Waikiki beach and it felt really good to get that exercise and not have to drive. Aside from the noise and the scary incident that happened to me that one night, I had a good time. And remember, check with staff if there are any discounts to the stores you'll be going to.

From the outside, it loooks like a cheap budget motel, but we were amazed as we walked through the lobby which opens up into a beautiful courtyard, with a smimming pool, jaccuzi, and waterfalls. You feel like you're in some hidden resort in the middle of the jungle. There is also 2 barbeques for the guests to use free of charge. (most hotels don't have any, or charge you per use.)The rooms were average, but clean and spacious. We've stayed in other hotels in the area, that were half the size, but cost more. The courtyard view is based on availability, and can't be booked in advance, . They assign the rooms as you check in. If you're lucky, you can get a room facing the pool at no extra charge. If you don't get one, don't be disappointed. You will still enjoy your stay, and the staff are awesome.We ended up getting a room with a city view, but it's only 10 feet to the pool, and the resort is only 5 minutes to the beach. In my opinion, you shouldn't come to Hawaii, and spend your entire day looking at the other guests in the pool, when you're a block from the beach anyway!Brian and Aaron at the front desk were the best. Both were so friendly, and they helped us so much. They introduced us all the best restaurants and all of the hot spots to go at night. They also have a great conceirge that can help you book the best luaus and dinner cruises, and they don't try to rip you offf, or upsell you on the higher ticket activities like some do.The only disadvantage was the parking. They only have 12 stalls, which are always full, but they have alternate parking right across the street for the same price. Overall, our stay was with a large grocery store just a block out the back gate. We would highly recommend the resort, and plan on staying again next time were were in town.

Despite the fancy pictures on the corporate website - this property is in dire conditions. The desk staff and folks working there are very nice but that's where the nice stops. We did not know that this property is actually part of a time-share collection. If I paid time-share prices for a week here - I would be pissed off! The "resort" is old and very run down. The furniture is used to the point of non-functional. There is no elevator, so be prepared to drag your luggage up 2-3 flights of stairs. The carpet in the rooms and halls are just gross. Will not ever return to this hotel or recommend to others.

My boyfriend and I stayed at Celebrity Resorts for six nights in June. We were in the market for a Waikiki hotel that was budget-friendly and centrally located. We had also decided that since we were traveling so far, for such a short period of time, we were going to spend as much time out and about as we could - we didn't intend to spend a lot of time in a hotel room. Essentially, we were looking for a decent place to sleep and a safe place to store our things. We were met at the front desk by Aaron and Joemar. I asked if they had a room on the courtyard side available. Aaron said they had one, but it was a smoking room. He offered to take me to see it before finalizing our transaction. I was afraid it was going to have a stale smoky smell, but much to my surprise, it was fine - no trace of smoke, and truthfully, I don't recall even having seen an ashtray in the room. We have nothing to complain about our stay there. The front desk staff was friendly, the poolside pancake breakfast was fun, the concierge service was a plus - I can't remember the young lady's name, I want to say it was Kealia - I'm so sorry I can't remember the spelling - but she was so sweet, and so helpful in getting us tickets for a sunset catamaran cruise, and tickets for Pearl Harbor. They have a small hut where they store pool toys and boogie boards - guests are welcome to take those boogie boards over to Waikiki Beach. On the Sunday we were there, we decided we were going to explore the beaches on the eastern coast, and in Kailua, we bought 2 boogie boards of our own. Since we knew we wouldn't be able to bring them back on the plane, we left them as a thank you to the staff for the awesome time we had there, and also in the hopes that other guests would have as much fun boogie boarding as we did. We only had a car for 3 days of our trip, parking at the resort was unavailable, but parking garages are nearby, albeit rather expensive, and with time limits. One morning, my boyfriend was up at 5:00 AM in order to move the car to a different location. If you don't need a car, don't get one - public transportation is reliable, efficient and inexpensive. If you're expecting the Ritz, you're going to be disappointed and I recommend you keep going, but, if you're looking for a safe, clean, reasonably priced place to stay, where the staff greets you by name, please try Celebrity Resorts. We'll definitely consider it again if we're fortunate enough to return.

My wife and I have just returned from a family visit in Honolulu, Hawaii.We stayed at the Celebrity resorts Waikiki. We have traveled extensively and have been visiting the Island since 1969. If your tired of the mega roomed hotels that have upscaled the cost and not the experience then this is the place to be. The laid back atmosphere and tropical area around the pool is just what you have been looking for. But most important is the staff. They treat everyone as a person not just a guest. They are the greatest asset of all. Thank you all Marie, Joemar, Brian, And Aarron. With a big HUG and thanks to Judy the manager.

This place was perfect for my family. I stayed in the 1 bedroom with 5 other family members and we fit comfortably. There is 2 bathrooms, 2 patios and 3 beds. The pricing was unreal. Very cheap and yet the staff was very friendly and the resort was well kept and clean. We were right next to everything that Waikiki has to offer and 2 blocks from the beach. I would definitely recommend this place to any of my friends.My only complaint would be there is no elevator but there is only 3 floors and we stayed on the 2nd.

Second time there, so we knew what we were getting for the money. Room overlooking nicely landscaped pool area; hot tub; two gas grills around many umbrella-topped tables; full lanai; fully-equipped kitchen; central laundry room; great staff; beach/dining/shopping/food stores within 1-3 blocks. Saved enough money here to do all those romantic dinners, sunset cruises, night spots, tours, and car rentals to the North and East Shores, etc. Got some shrimp, steaks, and wine, and had two of the best dinners of the trip right there. Things to note - A/C unit in each room - ours was noisy and not too strong; not 'full' maid service each day; no elevators (3 story max); some rooms face out to street (not too pretty); two blocks to beach (easy walk); $4/day fee for safe, coffee, phone added; pool a bit chilly (but ocean is perfect!); sun for about 5 hours/day (10-3) in pool area (but ocean is perfect!). Overall, as long as you know what you are getting for the money, this is the best deal in Waikiki we know of.

Booked a 1 Bedroom Suite and was impressed with the size. It had 2 bathrooms 2 balconies large lounge with kitchen area bedroom was same size as lounge. the Hotel was located just off the main street area convenient for the excelent bus service and shopping.If you are in any doubt about the value for money just compare with other hotels and you will see the others only give you a small room for a lot more money.This hotel may not look the best from the outside but don't let this put you off it is clean and tidy on the inside and staff are A1

We stayed here November 1-8, 2008. The reviews I read were decidedly mixed but in spite of this I booked a stay in a 1 bedroom suite. The suite consists of 2 hotel rooms with a connecting door. One room is set up as a bedroom with a bath, the queen sized bed looks tiny in the room, the other room is set up as a living room and a kitchen as well as a bath. The living room has 2 couches that are pullouts that are serviceable but not great beds. The rooms were clean and the maid service was exactly as the hotel described. The staff was very friendly and helpful. When we checked in we were given a very complete run-down of the activities and services the hotel provides. Wireless internet is provided as part of the 3.99 per night resort fee as is access to the "business center" computer and printer.If you are looking for luxury and ocean view, keep looking, if you are looking for value and expect to spend your days at the beach or seeing the many sites this is the place for you.

Our stay at this resort is a result of an exchange via RCI. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Lobby had a computer which we could use to check email or surf the internet. Coffee is served every morning. Pool is small but during our stay there we never seem to see more than a couple of people swimming. Chairs and recliners around the pool make a good relaxing place to relax and read a book. You can even borrow some chairs and floats to take to the beach.Parking is the worst part. Be ready to pay $18/day. Tiny spaces so if you have a big car or truck...good luck trying to make it fit! Only a few spaces available on site but you can park at the covered garage across the street for the same price. We parked across the street and it may be a better deal if you don't mind the walk. Parking is plentyful and covered. We had a one bedroom and a living room that faces the pool. The rooms were clean. The bed was quite comfortable although it may need to be changed soon as it is starting to sag towards the middle. The bathrooms are small but clean and shower area tiny. A/C had no problem cooling the rooms, 1 in the bedroom and 1 in the kitchen/dining/living room area. The freezer in our ref had a big gash/hole on it but didn't have a problem freezing the water in our water bottles.Location I believe is the best part. Walking distance to the beach, International Market, Starbucks, Jack in the Box, Mc Donald's, IHOP, Denny's and other local restaurants.

I was a little bit worried after reading some review of the Celebrity Resort, but what a fantastic stay we had there.We were a party of 5 and they gave us an accomodtion with two rooms two bathrooms. Everthing is very clean, too bad we did not had a view of the pool, but at least we used the room just to sleep.The accomodation is very spacious and the staff so friendly.When you get into the place immediatly you forget to be in the hussle of Waikiki, and if you think the rate you get (130 USD per day for the five of us) there is no doubt that Celebrity Waikiki is a very good choice.Of course you don't have to expect a five star accomodation, but everthing you need is there: free coffee in the morning, free Internet. The only problem is the parking, if there is space avaibale you pay about 10 USD at the Resort, otherwise you have a parking place very close which cost about 22 USD per day. (but also in the other accomodation in Wakiki parking has to be paid !)An additonal fee of 3 USD per day is added to the room for the complementary service.But believe me, no doubt that this is the best choice for an excellent accomodation in Waikiki without spending a fortune.I am very happy we stayed here and it will be definitly our choiche if we will be back in Ohau.

Celebrity Resorts Waikiki was a good place to stay. Low rise, not fancy, fewer people, inviting courtyard and pool area, friendly staff are all plusses. The secret to this place seems to be getting a room on the inner courtyard, not on the periphery. We booked a n/s 1 bdr for 2 adults/2 kids. There are smoking rooms/floors as well as non-smoking, but the inner courtyard area is non-smoking. Smokers have an area provided in the parking lot. Service: We checked in late, so there wasn't much available except a room facing Nohonani St. Staff was very friendly, helpful and efficient. Thank you to Judy, Marie, Joemar, Brian, Jocelyn and the always-smiling Aaron! The staff were happy to book shuttles, give dining advice, etc. Late check-out was provided, and other travellers were able to use common areas until their very late departure.Most of the guests were friendly and courteous, although we encountered two self-centred jet-lagged parents who let their toddler scream loudly on the lanai at 3:30 am. The security person was already out there when I opened the balcony door. I tried to get their attention by leaning over and waving and yelling, but said oblivious parent was too busy watching TV to notice some stranger near their kid on the balcony. The security lady ended up knocking on their door and asked them to respect the quiet hours rule.Room: The 1 bdr was large, but we were disappointed that it wasn't a courtyard/pool view room. Although I asked daily about changing, it was a busy week. Facing the street, it wasn't terribly private, but it was bright if you opened the curtains. 2 queen sofabeds in the living area, so both kids got their own bed. The bedroom's queen bed was comfortable enough but seemed small. Loved the many extra pillows in the room! TVs in both the living area and bedroom, but limited TV channels. DVD player & DVDs can be rented at the front desk. The safe in the room was useful, although it will not hold a laptop computer. Air conditioning in each room was noisy, as were the garbage trucks that hit various buildings in the area. We counted 4 on Wed. (from 6 am on), and 1 each day except Sunday. The earliest one was at 5:36 am, and the driver was banging the dumpster around with vengeance. As a light sleeper I definitely needed earplugs, but the rest of the family was fine.Kitchenette: small beer fridge (used the crisper drawer for milk) with ice cube tray, 2 burner stove, microwave oven, toaster oven, cutlery (& steak knives!) and dishes. Coffee maker & filters provided, but it was more convenient and fun to have Kona and Vanilla Macnut coffee out by the pool (avail. 7-10 am). Salt & pepper provided; sugar and coffee whitener avail. at morning coffee. No dishwasher, only a dishrack.Bathrooms: the 1 bdr had 2 identical bathrooms on each side of the unit. Toilets flush loudly and run long. Shower pressure and temperature were great in the morning, although one afternoon the temp was only warm. The shower heads were really low at 5'4", so at 5'6" I had to bend my knees to wash my hair.Housekeeping: according to something I read at the hotel, Heavy housekeeping was done on Wed. & Sat., including changing sheets & washing dishes. We washed our own. Lite housekeeping involved making beds & changing towels on all other days. For some inexplicable reason, the maid never left extra shampoo or soap in either bathroom. We had one soap for the shower and sink area until I went downstairs to ask for more.Amenities: small, warm, deep swimming pool (4-7 ft). Pool and beach toys available in pool shack (air mattresses, tubes, boogie boards, beach chairs, umbrellas, beach mats, pails and shovels). Beach and pool towels are signed out at the front desk.Plenty of tables with umbrellas by the pool, although it gets very busy during the pancake breakfast on Thurs. morning. Lounge chairs by pool. Hot tub secluded in far part of courtyard, hidden by palm trees, plants, and waterfall. NY Pizza/cheesecake night is on Tuesdays.Internet access in lobby was useful for quick inquiries. Did not use the booking agent, but it seemed convenient to have that service available. Neighborhood: Within a block of the hotel on Kuhio, you can find fast food: Subway, Jack in the Box (all day breakfast), sushi, Pukadog, Starbucks, Fatty's Chinese, Denny's, McDonald's (2 blks west), St. Germain bakery with cheap, appealing sandwiches and pastries. More formal restaurants are within a few blocks. Shopping: ABC store (with booze), Payless shoes, pharmacy (one block east), Food Pantry (2 blocks east). The International Marketplace is within the block, full of cheap "Let's make a deal" souvenir merchandise and a small food court. Kalakaua, the action packed main drag is a quick 5 minutes away, and free entertainment abounds at night, including street performers, fancy stores and restaurants (Cheesecake Factory, CPK, etc). Kuhio Beach (Duke's statue) is the big main beach.Just north is the Ala Wai canal - good for a walk or run. We never felt unsafe, but then, we never stayed out very late, either. The hotel is secured after 8 pm, and key cards are a must. There is an exit at the back of the complex as well.I have recommended this hotel to similar-minded travellers and will return, hopefully in the off-season.

We really enjoyed our stay here. Before arriving I was a little nervous after reading some of the negative reviews but it didn't take long to feel right at home. These accommodations are by no means perfect but I'm giving it 5 stars because it was my experience that within just a few hours we were able to make this apartment-style hotel room a home away from home. Upon arriving we went to the front desk where Joemar and Aaron helped check us in. They were both incredibly helpful and friendly. In fact, I would say their smiles were contagious. We requested a room facing the pool area and were fortunate enough to get one. We ended up with a room overlooking the pond and spa which turned out to be perfect because it was a little more private and it was right next to the back entrance for easy in and out access. Before raving more about the good I think it's only fair to align any future expectations with the reality of a 2.5 star hotel. When we first walked into our room it's fair to say my roach motel fears didn't vanish immediately. It definitely had an unappealing musty smell. The bedroom floor had a huge iron burn on the carpet (it was literally the full size and shape of the bottom of an iron). Not once did we see any bugs of any kind inside our suite but one of our 7 mornings there we did see a single, but live, roach in the hallway. Housekeeping was pretty good but you should expect to do your own dishes (we left $3 on average for tip each day) and one of the 8 days we were there our bed looked made but the sheets under the comforter had not been touched and were in complete disarray. Now, you are probably asking yourself how I could possibly rate it a 5 after all that but let me explain. First off, never have I made myself so at home at any other hotel I've ever stayed in. By day 2 my friend and I had literally unpacked everything in our suitcases. Shirts and shorts were hanging in the 2 closets, our bathroom amenities were each stowed away in our own separate bathroom mirror cabinets. We stayed in one of the Bedroom Suites. It had a sitting room with two pullouts, a full kitchen, a bedroom and 2 full bathrooms. Since it was just the 2 of us we didn't really need the 2 bathrooms but it certainly ended up being convenient to have all the extra counter and storage space. Once the AC is running a while the smell goes away and you won't think about it again. Since we really did feel at home it didn't bother us when our dishes didn't get cleaned or the one time our sheets weren't perfect. My friend in particular is pretty anal when it comes to cleanliness and other than the initial smell and the partially made bed she had no complaints. The first night we got in we went to the grocery store down the road and filled up our fridge with sandwich stuff, eggs, yogurt, etc. Most of the days we'd get up early, eat breakfast, spend the day out and then come back to the room for dinner on the lanai and then spend the rest of the day walking Waikiki Beach or sitting by the pool. It was a very welcoming and relaxing place to return to after a long day of sightseeing and sunbathing.If we come back we'll definitely be looking up Celebrity Resorts Waikiki again.

Nice hotel for the money. We were a bit cramped with 4 people in the room and all of our luggage; used the bed and the pull out sofa bed. There is a small kitchenette which adequately served our needs: had a small refrigerator, microwave, cooktop and coffee maker. All rooms have some type of patio or balcony. Unfortunately we were assigned a room with no view so we did not use this feature. Request a room with a pool view. There are various brews of free coffee in the morning by the pool area where you can sit and relax and enjoy your coffee. Very limited parking accommodations even though you pay a daily fee to park (but this seems to be the norm and not the exception these days on Oahu). Once they run out of parking spaces at this hotel they have an agreement where you can use a hotel's parking garage across the street at a reduced fee but still higher than the fee that you pay to park in this hotel's lot. Even though we prepaid for this hotel, was charged an additional $3.99/day for a resort fee. I must say that the pool area is very nice, the hotel is located close to Kuhio Avenue (major shopping on this street; close to International Market), and not that far from the beach and the great public transportation that this island offers. The hotel has pizza parties and other activites that the hotel guests can participate in (for a fee). The absolute best thing about this hotel is the front desk staff....they were extremely kind, pleasant, professional and courteous all of the time! Although there is a desktop computer located across from the front desk that can be used by the hotel guests the front desk staff was able to provide directions and answer all questions. If they already didn't have preprinted directions available they were more than glad to print up whatever you requested. The people behind the front desk are gems! Overall, a nice hotel for the price.

My family stayed here for eight nights and could not have been more pleased. We stayed in a one-bedroom suite overlooking the garden and pool. The suite was large enough for four adults (six one night). The place was very clean, had a well stocked kitchen and a large lanai. Both the bed in the bedroom and the one in the living room were very comfortable. There was a queen size sofa pullout as well. The staff was super helpful and friendly. Morning coffee and free internet with printing was provided. The location was close to everything. We walked or took the bus to most of the major attractions on Oahu. We rented a car for day trips from the Enterprise rental office located right across the street for exploring the North Shore. I would definitely stay here again .

When we first arrived, I was a bit disappointed in this hotel. I was judging it by it's age and side street location, but I couldn't have been more wrong. We were here last week for my daughter's wedding and I had my whole family staying here, her dad's whole family and the in laws. What a pleasant surprise the whole thing turned out to be! First-I have stayed in some of the best hotels in Hawaii including the Grand Wailea and Hyatts on two islands and I have never had the service that I received from the whole Celebrity front desk crew-especially Aaron and Judy. We were tired and stressed when we arrived and ended up switching rooms after arrival in order to get a bigger room. After explaining the reason we were there and the stressful trip getting there-they did EVERYTHING to help us out. Two days later-the bride's dad arrived with his wife and 4 kids and they checked into their condo in Waikiki. I met them the next morning and the condo had been a disaster-no blakets, dirty room-just gross! I called Marie at the front desk of the Celebrity and they went out of their way to help him and got him booked into a one bedroom there. They were so relieved after a terrible first night at the condo.We ended up making full use of the bbq facilities-entertaining 40 people who were here for the wedding, not once, but two nights. The staff didn't blink an eye-just let us know our guests were their guests for the evening. I can't say enough good things about this place-it is a perfect little gem for a family. If you are looking for a fancy hotel this isn't it. If you are looking for a home away from home then this is perfect.The only downside is the parking situation. There is VERY limited parking at the hotel. We had to park across the street for $18 a day. However, parking is at a premium in Waikiki and I know most of the hotels are $22-30 a day.The kitchenettes were very well stocked and there is a market within walking distance. It is one street behind the main street through Waikiki, so everything is within walking distance. There are also laundry facilities there and beach chairs, umbrellas, floats etc for your day at the beach on a first come basis. They also had a $3 all you can eat pancake breakfast one morning that was so fun.

I chose this hotel after reading a lot of positive reviews on TripAdvisor. A lot of things about the hotel are true. The service is great....when we checked in, Judy let us check out a couple of different rooms when we asked if we could get a room with a view of the courtyard. She let us check the one that was available with a view, although she said it was smaller than what we were supposed to have. Then she let us check out the room we were supposed to get that had a view of the parking lot. We ended up going with the smaller room with a view as we didn't need the pullout sofa. Aaron and Joemar also helped us out during our stay by giving directions to certain sights and helping us get our taxi to the airport. They were all very courteous and happy to help. We had no problems with housekeeping either, and our room was always clean when we came back in the evening. The coffee in the morning was nice, and the place seemed to have lots of activities for the people staying there although we didn't really take advantage of that. There is a computer in the lobby to use the internet, as well as an activities desk. The room itself....was just ok. It is obviously an older room, and it was pretty small, although it had a small kitchen, and we only really used the fridge. There was no tub (only a shower) in both the rooms we looked at. The bed was just ok to sleep in, but after a long day, it doesn't matter as long as you have a place to sleep. We pretty much kept the A/C on all day so it only smelled a little funny when you walked in, but otherwise the smell went away. The location of the hotel itself is fine. It is across the street from the International Marketplace and is just a short walk to the beach. We rented a car for one day, and fortunately found street parking on Ala Wai Blvd because we were told there were no more spots left for our car. It would have been a problem had we rented for more than one day. Overall, this is a place to crash for the night. We pretty much spent all of our time outside of the hotel, so it was fine, but if people prefer to hang out in their rooms to relax, this probably isn't the place you want to do that.

My family and I stayed at Celebrity Resorts-Waikiki for 6 nights in May 2008. To start:The check-in went pretty good.The location -I don't think- is good at all. It is a block from a strip-club and at night street walkers and dive bars are right around the corner. The resort staff was a bit over whelming for my family, but they were nice. I don't think that you should have to pay $10/day for parking, seems a bit much. Also they charge a $3.99/day fee for coffee in the AM and the safe, both of which we did not use. The room. REALLY outdated. It was pretty clean, had an old smell and a window AC unit. It had to run full balst to remain cool. Small fridge in our room. Beds are small and not comfortable. Overall, this was not my ideal Hawaiian vacation and would not recommend this location. I have stayed at other Celebrity Resorts (CO) and they were MUCH nicer. If you are literally looking for a place to sleep, this is your place. If you are looking for anything else, I would search elsewhere.

Have just been staying for 3 nights at this hotel. As a woman travelling alone, I must say that it has been ideal: I got the room type that I requested (2nd floor, with lanai, facing pool courtyard). Room has basic cooking facilities - very handy. Staff are friendly and helpful, activities desk is excellent, free coffee in the morning. Best thing is the location: on a quiet side street just off of Kuhio. Amazing bakery & an ABC Store at the corner, larger Food Pantry (pricey but OK for short time) up the road, zillions of shops of all types within minutes' walk, including market stalls (beware predatory stallholders! if you act interested, they will pounce!). Walking distance to the beach, too.Only criticisms are: room security could be improved (in-room safe but no chain on door & only very basic door lock; and only 1 simple up/down lock on sliding door to lanai). Also, there is a musty smell in the room when you first enter, but this disappears when a/c is run. Room was well cleaned, no problems with sheets, towels, etc. Am staying here again in a couple of weeks, so will report back if experience is any different. BTW, hotel recommended Reliable Shuttle for airport transport, and they were also excellent. All in all, a very pleasant place, esp. for people looking for something smaller and friendlier than a high-rise.

We booked the Celebrity Resorts Waikiki after reading the reviews from other travellers. I had to switch rooms after my first night. The pull out bed was blood stained and the small lanai faced an apartment building with a view of the tenants' garbage. The first front desk clerk I spoke to said there were no rooms available to switch. But after my travel agent contacted them, there were two rooms available that they could move us to. We were moved to another room that seemed cleaner but a similar view.Another front desk clerk, Aaron, was helpful the rest of the trip offering suggestions for dining, etc. He made an effort to learn guests' names, acknowledged anyone who walked through the lobby and offered my daughter flowers on the last day. He was a gem!I did not have trouble with housekeeping as previously inidicated by another guest. A nice little touch was a white board in the room so if you had any requests or comments for housekeeping, you could indicate it on the white board. What a great idea!The location was good, the staff were helpful (except our first night), they have free internet use with a 10 minute limit, and an activities desk to get information on the area. They also offered free scuba lessons in the pool on Tuesdays. However, the rooms were not what I expected. We ended up being in three different studio rooms during our stay (we paid $10 to use a room to shower in on our last day after we had already checked out), and none of them were the same. The "shower room" that we used was cleaner, bigger kitchenette, bigger lanai and bigger bathroom. I think you have to be very specific on your needs when selecting a room or you will be disappointed.

This hidden gem is the best place I've found to stay in Waikiki. In December, 2007 I made my sixth trip to Hawaii and I stayed for two weeks at this hotel. What can I say? The hotel is just steps away for the International Market place and only a block and a half to the beach. The prices are fantastic. I had a two room suite consisting of a living room/kitchen and a master bedroom and the suite had two bathrooms. For all that I paid approximately $130.00 per night. Everything was immaculate in the hotel common areas and the rooms. This is the only place I've ever heard of where the spreads are changed for clean ones every time the room turns over to another guest. I am semi-handicapped and they saw to it that my needs were met in that regard. The staff is fantastic, from Judy, the manager to Aaron and the other desk clerks to the maids and maintainence men. By the time you've been there for a day, they know your name! I was there for my birthday and they gave me a present. None of the big hotels in Waikiki give that kind of service. I will never stay anywhere else again when I go to Hawaii.Carol

The room was very dated, & smelled of mildew as per previous reviews. We asked for a room facing the courtyard as per previous travellors suggestions, but they were not able to honour that. I decided to go with celebrity because of the kitchenette facilities, but it was not worth it. I think we got one of the older rooms & it faced another apartment.
