Our AC made a lot of load noises, and the mattress took a little getting used to. The head of the bed was against the wall that separated us from the hallway. Each morning, we would hear all the noises of the hallway. The hotel did suggest we ask the manager to have our room changed, but we were settled with alot of groceries, so it would have been more bothersome to lug all of that stuff to another room. Housekeeping was horrible & inconsistent. The first day, we left $2 tip & our bed sheets were not changed, our dishes were not washed, nor was the place vacuumed. Thus the next day, we left $1 tip, but our sheets were changed, & our dishes were washed (no vacuuming though). The next couple of days, we were sick & stayed in, missing housekeeping. When we finally were well enough again to explore Hawaii, we left $3 tip (because the place was very messy), but no bed sheets were changed, no dishes were washed, kitchen garbage bin was untouched (with 2 days worth of old food in there), but somehow we got vacuuming. I was so disgusted with housekeeping @ this point. The only good thing about the hotel is the front desk staff. The friendliest, courteous, most helpful staff I've encountered, making the stay more acceptable.Good things about the location of the hotel 1) close to a breakfast place that served cheap breakfasts2) close to the beach & international market place (yes do bargain with them)3) an agent on site to arrange for tours etc4) close to the food pantry market, but very expensive & not the freshest stuff i.e. purchased bagels & found them to be moldy (the staff @ the hotel can direct you to a local Walmart)

My stay at the Celebrity Waikiki confirmed the reviews I read on TripAdvisor. While the rooms are not of the same level as the new mega hotels, the rooms were pleasant, clean, and gigantic. Both smoking and non-smoking rooms are available.The Celebrity is convenient to shopping and dining. The inner courtyard and pool area are a refreshing oasis from the hustle and bustle of Honolulu.The front desk staff were, perhaps, the most pleasant and helpful staff I have ever encountered.The next time I am in Honolulu, I will be staying at the Celebrity Waikiki.

If you are looking for inexpensive apartment-style accommodation with full kitchen facilities, this is a great option, just 2 short blocks from the infamous Waikiki beach. While there were certainly no celebrities staying at THIS hotel, we got a nice, very clean one bedroom apartment in this rather oddly named hotel for $119 per night. Very friendly, excellent tourist advisor on site, they even let you take their boards and inflatable pool toys down to the beach!

I booked this hotel through Hotwire thinking that I was getting a different hotel. Hotwire has been inaccurate with 2 of my recent bookings. When referring to Tripadvisor ratings, which they do for some of their listings, they'll be off (by up to a month) as to when the last review was posted or how many points the listing has on Tripadvisor.Anyway, I was worried about this booking because the last review that had been posted at that time indicated a horrible stay. Lots of great reviews though, so in my review I'll just focus on what stood out to me. The hotel has a 2 1/2 star rating I believe, and I'd say this is fairly accurate. If the AC in the room wasn't running there was a mildewy smell. The AC was a little noisy so I had to sleep with earplugs every night but I am a sensitive sleeper.The room was spacious enough, had a nice little kitchenette, and we did get a room with a lanai overlooking the pool as I had requested. The staff were quite nice, and Aaron (sp?) at the front desk was exceptional. He was nice and funny, always in a great mood.I always read through all of the reviews on Tripadvisor before going to a hotel and I was disappointed that they no longer have Monday night hula dancing as some other reviewers had referred to. I asked about it at the front desk and the staff member said they had stopped the show months ago. They did still have Thursday morning pancakes but no pizza/cheescake on Thursday nights.Even though I booked this on Hotwire I later found other listings that were rated with more stars and were available for less money. I probably wouldn't stay at this hotel again, but I enjoyed my stay.If you like to do a lot of active and touristy things on your vacation I highly recommend purchasing the Go Oahu card (Google it) ahead of time. I bought a 5 day pass (we were there for a total of 7 days) and not only did we save a ton of money, but we got some great ideas for things to do.

This is a late review - didn't realize I hadn't left one before this. We spent approximately a week at Celebrity Resorts in the fall of 06 while visiting our son who was stationed at one of the military bases on Oahu. What a wonderful, relaxing time! The staff at CR was exceptional, very helpful and friendly. We had 2 different rooms, first a 2 person suite, then a suite w/sofabed when our son stayed with us. Both were more than adequate and clean. The showers are VERY small. Rooms are also tight but that's what you get when real estate is as pricey as it is in Wakiki. Every inch counts. We didn't go all the way to Hawaii to stay in our room anyway. CR is conveniently located. We usually walked wherever we were going, even to the zoo, as we enjoy hikes and the weather was perfect. We did take the bus a couple of times, over to Chinatown and up to the base. The base connections weren't the best but it was way cheaper than a taxi. We made breakfast in our room with groceries from the store down the street ($4 for a loaf of bread!). The pool area is very nice; Hawaiian music in that area is a plus, adding to the tropical mood along with the waterfall. Had a note in our room that Lost would be filming there one day during our stay and to please keep towels off the balcony for that. The next day, their schedule changed so it didn't happen. Bummer! Staff is top shelf. Not one grumpy word was heard the whole week. Do yourself a favor and don't rent a car though - the parking is so tight it looks painful and is also very limited. It's just not worth it.

As a solo traveler I arrived on a late flight and was given a very nice unit on the third floor overlooking the garden and waterfall.I had two nights here, before moving onto another property, and wished my whole stay was here after the experience!I awoke to birds singing, and the sound of the waterfall, not of garbage trucks in the concrete jungle of Waikiki. It was so relaxing and enjoyable to start the morning with morning doves and songbirds. The hotel provides coffee in the morning around the pool, and everyone was congenial, and staff helpful.The unit itself was quiet, no real traffic noise, and being a small place I thought I would hear the neighbors. The walls are concrete and solid and provided a perfect sleep.Everything was provided for in the the little kitchenette, and the towels were nice and fluffy.The beach was a five minute walk straight through the fun International Market Place and I spent most of my days on the beach. In the late afternoon a nap on the lounger at the pool was perfect, falling asleep to gentle Hawaiian contemporary music.People were playing cards, sharing stories and engrossed in books around the pool in the last rays of the day.The sun does not filter in until midmorning to this property, so start your day with a brisk walk in the sun.Great water pressure in the shower, and completely clean throughout. This is a great little hotel for the money... and save by booking at their website.

We were surprised that the hotel was so good. The room was spacious (not the cheapest room though) and clean. The kitchen and bathroom were in very good condition. We enjoyed being in a small hotel where we didn't have to go up and down lifts all the time, and where the staff were friendly and very helpful. Loved being able to walk out of the room and have breakfast sitting around the pool with a great cup of coffee provided. It was only five minutes to the beach through the International Markets (which did slow us down because we kept looking) and the bus stop was around the corner. Hint: catch the bus everywhere for $2 and don't waste your time and money on tours.

We spent a week at the Celebrity Resorts this Christmas. I had read the reviews and was pleased that they were accurate (the positive ones) We're a family of 5 (two teenage boys and a 9 year old girl) the only challenge was when we first arrived (very late at night) there was no cot available for us. We made due by putting the couch cushions on the floor at night and creating a comfortable bed for our 13 year old. For the price it was worth it! As other reviews noted, the place was clean, spacious, location convenient and service fantastic and friendly. Our daughter loved the pool and meeting other kids. We didn't bother with a rental car as everything was accessible on foot or by bus. I have already recommended this resort to friends.

If you don't like huge hotels, or want to save some money this IS the place. We called and made sure to reserve a room facing the pool, and got one. The staff was helpful, the rooms adequate, no smells or problems. The only suggestion I would make is to plan on making use of the kitchenette. It has everything you need, and there is a store just a block or so away. Also there are grills around the pool area that might as well be used.

Before choosing one of three hotels presented to us by our travel agent I checked the reviews at Trip Advisor and found that Celebrity Resorts had the best review of the three. Well, I have to agree with the reviews! The outside of the hotel isn't much to look at, nor the street it's on but once you walk into the hotel, it's a mini-Paradise. The hotel staff are friendly, knowledgeable and treat you like Ohana. The room was clean, quiet and just the right size for two of us. It was SO convenient having a kitchenette in the room. My sister-in-law and I saved a lot of money by going to the bakery and ABC store just around the corner, and by making meals in our room. The location was FABULOUS!!! It's only about a 7 minute walk to the beach (and there's a Starbucks around the corner). For all of you shop-a-holics, it's conveniently located down the street from the International Market Place. I would definitely stay here again.

Little more than a motel with prices that match many of the big, beautiful hotels, this was the biggest disappointment of our trip. The rooms were small and smelled mildewy. The only positive was the staff who were friendly and accomodating.

My sister and I stayed in Waikiki for the first time, for 4 nights prior to going North Shore for a longer stay. The front desk staff at the Celebrity Resort was super friendly and warm, in a very genuine way; this was in fact the only place where I really felt aloha or ohana on this trip. The room was neither larger or smaller than other hotels, but was very efficiently laid out and clean; there was a very sweet and funny greeting left for us on the whiteboard by the room info. The courtyard is a real oasis of calm and peace in the hustle-bustle of Waikiki - it was a pleasure to hang out there. The location is excellent if you don't mind being off the beach - very close to the International Market and Duke's Lane, so the landmarks are great. Close to the buses, groceries and dining, and walking distance to just about everything in Waikiki. If I ever come back to Waikiki, I will definitely stay in this sweet little jewel tucked in amongst the behemoths!

This was our first visit to Celebrity Resorts, and it will not be the last. Upon first entering the front desk area, we were made to feel right at home. Aaron was on duty, what a wonderful gentleman. Judy the Front Desk Manager runs a tight, and efficient operation. George the Facility Manager was very congenial, and friendly.The house keeping, and grounds keepers were busy, and kept the resort looking its 100%. The pool was nice, and the hot tub even nicer. Not too hot, but just right. The Thursday pancake breakfast was a real treat, it was our first day on the island, and gave us a chance to meet some of the other guests.The room was very comfortable, clean, with all the necessities of home. The kitchenette was most useful. The Resort is very close to the International Marketplace, and other restaurants are close by. The bus stop, along with the pickup point for our excursions was 3/4 of a block away. We will definitely stay againR Penrod Bakersfield CA

Great place for those on a budget and even better for those who aren't; so you can safe your money for better things (SHOPPING). Only a block away from the main strip which makes it very peaceful when you need those evening to catch up on sleep or a long day of activities at the beach. I will most definitely be staying here only when visiting Waikiki because the staffs are very friends and the house cleaning is top rate. Can't imagine any other place I would stay because what it boils down to is a clean and safe place to lay your head after a long day of fun.

We spent one night in Honolulu before heading to a resort in Kauai. I needed a place that wasn't too expensive and not a dump. I was happy with this hotel. The rooms were a little small but the resort staff were very helpful and nice and the price was great. There is no elevator so getting to the 2nd floor with all our luggage was not convenient and they didn't have any bell boys to help. Otherwise, it was a pleasant stay. I wouldn't advise this for someone spending more than a few days unless you don't plan on being in the room much. The pool area was very nice and cozy. It is within walking distance of the beach as well as lots of street shopping. Good hotel for what we paid.

I read all of these positive reviews and believe that we must have gotten one of the undesireable rooms. We booked this location for 4 nights on an RCI exchange. We stayed on the 3rd floor (Rm 306??). It was an efficiency unit.  I must say that we were uncomfortable from the moment we checked into our room. We spent most of our time figuring out how not to spend any time in the room. First , the layout of the room: You open the door to the room. The headboard of the bed was right next to the door as you open it. About 3 steps later to the left is the bathoroom/closet. We came to be more horrified with this design when we actually utilized our bathroom. The bathroom has zero ventilation (if you get my drift)!!! No ventilation fan, no bathtub, just shower with shower curtain. Toilet is about 2 feet from the wet shower curtain. And your clothes share your bathroom space!! There is somewhat of a slatted door on the "closet". The other side of the room consisted of a sofa, kitchenette and balcony. There is air conditioniong. However, when you opened the balcony sliding door, the door bangs against the air conditioner. f you sit on the balcony, you get to listen to your and your neighbors' air conditioner. The kitchenette was nice, not in the bathroom. (Sorry, couldn't resist the humor). However the tightness of the room and the co-mingled space, literally makes you not want to deal with food in the room. The carpet was an old fashioned dark green color. It's ok when you first check-in, but as the hours go by, you notice that this color shows every grain of sand, every light colored speck, etc. Too tight of a space. Dated surroundings. Didn't feel that the room was clean. My husband misplaced his glasses. We still laugh at how horrified we were that they might have fallen under the bed. Neither of us wanted to check under or behind the bed. Luckily we found them before needing to do this. I'm sorry to say that we checked out of this hotel after 2 days. We're not hotel snobs. Our vacation just wasn't worth the hassle. I woke up both days thinking "How can I spend as little time in this room today, as possible?" Due to other positive reviews, which I relied on, my advice is to try get a "good" room. If that guarantee is not possible, I would not risk my vacation time being uncomfortable. Book something that you can be sure about. I didn't see any of the other rooms.On a positive note, the hotel staff very hospitable. Starbucks is close by. Galaxy Restaurant is also close by and has a great breakfast special ($2.99).

Stayed at the Celebrity Resorts on the way to and back from California. In our nine nights we managed to stay in a suite, a four person studio and two person studio. All the accomodationwas excellent and considering what we paid, great value for money. The one bedroom suite was huge and would suit families as there is two bathrooms and more importantly two TVs! It also has a very good kitchen.The four person studio had a much larger bathroom than the two person one but both rooms were larger than an average hotel room and had a kitchenette which had all the pans, plates and utensils you could need.All the staff were very friendly and the location and condition of the hotel was great. In summing up we paid a lot more for hotels on our travels but none were as good as The Celebrity Resorts.

It was a low price for a Waikiki hotel, not too far from the beach, close to everything (shopping, public transport, etc.). The rooms were very nice, very clean. Friendly and helpful staff. I would definitely stay there again.We did have to walk up the stairs (3rd floor) but it was fine for us. But do keep it in mind.
user_name:
barbara1105
New York City, New York

review_body: Very, very clean, good service. Maid washed my dishes. Comfortable beds. Nicely layout. Only problem we had was the shower which was about 1 ft. off the ground and kind of low, I asked about this and was told that all showers are the same. They taught my husband how to do the Hula (photo). Management was very nice. Would stay again.

This is probably the best kept secret in Hawaii.Not one of those high priced ritzy hotels with 40 floors.We went there for our 40th anniversary and loved every minute. So much, we booked for 7 nights and stayed for 11. Very helpful and friendly staff. Very clean and well maintained. Close to everything, but when lounging by the pool you never new you were. Honestly loved it and thank you Celebrity Resorts!

My wife and I stayed at Celebrity Resorts for two days in July because it appeared to be the best value in the area near Duke’s Lane and the International Marketplace. We wanted to book a double room, but only a suite was available. The suite was worth the extra $20 a day, and it still cost less than a standard room at the Ilima Hotel next door. The hotel is served by a wireless Internet service called Wanderport that charges guests of this and other hotels $10 for 24 hours. It would have been a good deal if the service didn't get oversubscribed starting at about 9:30 a.m. The Internet unclogs again at night. Fortunately there is a good Internet cafe with reliable Internet access on Nahua Street, accessible through the back gate (room key can open the gate). We loved the round-the-clock availability of various kinds of coffee near the pool and the $3 all-you-can eat pancake and orange juice breakfast served every Thursday. Rooms were clean, and everything worked. The reception and cleaning staff were helpful, happy and friendly. We plan to stay there the next time we return to Waikiki.

This place was clean and cheap. Well situated in the middle of Waikiki. Not ocean view but you aren't paying for that. If you have to be in Oahu and in Waikiki, this would be a good bargain place to stay. The front desk staff are very nice, helpful and friendly. Even more friendly than some of the brass and glass places I've stayed in the past.

Flying in from Australia, we were a little timid, not having stayed here before. We had booked Celebrity Resorts Waikiki based on the consistently good reviews from Trip Advisor. (Wondered if some of the Celebrity staff had submitted some of their own good comments(kidding!).) First the price was perfect for us holidaying on a budget but wanting to feel special anyway. Tears came to my eyes when we walked into our very large one bedroom suite. Spotlessly clean, very well appointed and with two bathrooms, two living areas, a small and neat kitchen, two TVs. Perfect for my partner and two children. Our glass sliding doors opened onto the courtyard pool area. Privacy for us all. Very lush tropical paradise. This little slice of heaven - only 3 floors tall - the little David amongst the skyscraper Goliaths. We didn't hear any traffic whatsoever. So, ok all of you reading this will appreciate the amenities and close proximity to the beach but hey... what about the customer service? More kudos for Judy (manager) and staff. Obviously they love people, take pride in their work and there are little extras that just delighted us. A range of free delicious flavoured coffees,each morning to choose from, an all-you-can-eat pancake and sausage breakfast on Thursday mornings and - yes - feel free to take the little beach chairs to the beach. There is a feeling of family and community here. We loved that. As we walked along Waikiki Beach at sunset, looking at the huge 5 star hotels, we felt like the lucky ones. Just one hesitation in writing this review - what if it becomes booked out and we can't get in next year? We will be very disappointed! Judy - if you read this, an extra thank you for your sincere graciousness and that of your delightful staff. 10 out of 10.

The value for the price cannot be beat! Staff was great! It's a small hotel where you get to know other guests around the pool under the tropical foilage. The seperate concierge service was just great helping us book a car and tours. It felt like a home away from home. I highly recommend this hotel for the bargain hunter.

This was my husbands first time to Hawaii and therefore, I really wanted to make it special. We were on a really tight budget and couldn't afford the luxury of a 5 star hotel. We were looking for something comfortable and affordable. I found Celebrity Resorts through Hotels.com and went on trip Advisor to see what reviews were written about the place. There were mostly positive reviews and I'd have to agree 100% with all of them. The bed was comforatable, the room was very clean and it came with a stove and fridge, so we were able to cook breakfast and dinner when we didn't have the money to eat out. It was literally less than a block away from the main street where all the shopping and restaurants were. It's a short bus ride down to the main mall. We also got tickets to "Germaine's Luau" and the pick up spot was a block away from the hotel. The staff was so friendly and accomodating. They answered all of our questions and when we needed more towels or directions..they were very prompt. We took advatange of the swimming pool and hot tub which were very clean and relaxing after a long day of walking and site seeing. They have these beautiful Palm Trees surrounding the pool area...makes you feel like you're swimming in the middle of a tropical forest. We absolutely loved our stay and will definitely return if we plan on visiting Honolulu again.

At the expense of perhaps not getting my requested exchange of RCI back to Celebrity Resorts Waikiki next year, it's only fair that I share this secret with readers of tripadvisor.com, as I have benefited from the generous contribution of others in the past.This is not a gold crown resort in RCI's books, but it's as good as one. Two strong points are: location and service.Long before I even set foot in the resort, I was impressed by the helpfulness of the staff. Judy ( front desk manager) and Marie were very patient with my questions, such as availability of wireless internet, rice cooker ( which was sitting on the dinner table when I first entered the room ) and arranging the same room as my RCI excahnge for those three add-on days, There is no surprise that one side of the building has better view than the other, and they were very nice in accomodating my request since it was made months in advance. During my stay, I met these two ladies plus Aaron and Joemar, who were all as pleasant and competent as previous posts ahd described. Aaron mentioned that he's been with the resort for only a few short years, and look forward to many more years of association. How often do you come across a front line worker saying that? It shows that these people are happy and take pride in their work.You just can't beat this location. I chose to use an internet cafe, and there's one just outside the back door, called Paradise Internet, on Nuhua St. It takes longer for me to get from my room to the front lobby of many big timeshare condos , such as Hilton Grand Vacation Club. For those who intend to do a fair bit of their own meal preparation, there's a decent grocery store two to three blocks away on Walina and Kuhio called the Food Pantry, which has most of what you need for a one week stay, and it's open almost all the time when I'm awake. Bus stops very conveniently located on Kuhio Ave half a block away. $20 for a visitor 4-day bus pass gets you virtually everywhere, so a car is really unnecessary unless you have a tight touring schedule and has little time to spare going from one site to another.The units have been renovated , as I noted new curtains and bedspreads. I tried hard to sniff but really cannot detect any trace of smoke. Wife is asthmatic and very sensitive to even the slightest hint of smoke. The unit itself is very clean, superior to that of Hilton grand Vacation Club. Last year, before I discovered Celebrity Resort, I stayed twice at the Ilima next door in a comparable one bedroom unit. It was nowhere as well kept, and 50% pricier.In 2007, we have stayed at Ritz-Carlton in Santiago, Four Seasons in Buenos Aires, Fairmont Banff Springs in Banff, Alberta, Chateau Lake Louise in Lake Louise, Alberta,( I have to add that the last three I got free upgrades to one bedroon suite, it's just been a lucky quarter of travelling) all arguably rated # 1 in their region, and yet I felt the most comfortable at Celebrity resort Wakiki. You bet I want to go back there.

We were really concerned what the resorts rooms were going to look like after viewing the website. We had 2 studio rooms, when viewing on the website it looked like the shower was in the kitchen. Needless to say they were not.Everyone at the resort was extremely kind and helpful. They would do everything they could to find answers to questions for you. Where to find I climbed Diamond Head tshirts, where was good places to eat. They were extremely good at directions. I just cant say enough nice things about the people that work at this resort.It really is close to so many things, must of the time we walked. There is a charge of 10.00 dollars a day to park at the resort, and is best to let them know ahead of time if you will be needing a space, because parking is very limited. The first night we had to park across the street at another resort and there it cost us 18.00 dollars.Cass and Theresa were very helpful in helping to plan tours, luas and day trips. We went to the Paradise Cove Lua at the suggestion of Cass and it was well worth the money. The food was great.We took a day trip over to Maui with Poylnesian Tours. We were picked up out in front of the resort and taken to the airport and then we flew to maui where we were met by a nother rep. The day was great. Our flight back was early. There was a rep there to great us and take us to the waiting tour bus. The wait on the tour bus and return trip to the hotel took longer than the flight. First we had to wait at least 30 minutes before we even started to leave the airport. Then the driver circled around and went back to the airport, picked up 1 passanger, then we left again, only to circle back again to the airport again. Where they loaded more passangers on, by this time was had been on the bus for over an hour. They had more passengers then seats, so then they had to make most of the ones they loaded get off. Finally we got on the road. The driver didn't act very knowledgble about where hotels were. He just stared hollarring out street names and asking if your hotel was close to that road. We ended up getting off about 2 blocks from our hotel and walking. Long story short I don't think i would go on another tour with this company

At $68 per night we booked for this hotel with some trepidation telling ourselves even if it was a total dump we usually spend most of our time in Oahu out and about so it was worth a shot. What a wonderful suprise this hotel turned out to be! The ambience of the place is true Waikiki 60's style. From the minute you walk in the front door past the "Welcome Home sign" you know you are on to a winner. The lobby immeadiately transports you back in time with it's cane furniture, vintage Hawiian music and decor - all scrupulously clean. The staff are friendly and welcoming and the view to the pool screams Hawaii.Check in was a dream and we were in our room within minutes of arrival.The room was spacious and clean with all the amenitites you need to self service meals although with so many great eateries within walking distance who could be bothered!The maids did a great job of cleaning each day - including any dishes (which has not been our experience in other Oahu hotels in the area).One of the things I found interesting in previous TripAdvisor reviews stating the views were either great or terrible. This was easily explained once we arrived as half the rooms overlook the gorgeous coutyard with the pool, SPA and greenery and the other half overlook neighbouring alleys which are essentially the back of other shops and hotels. If you get the chance when booking definitely ask for a courtyard facing room. Ala the concierge was an absolute gem and arranged all our bookings in her friendly manner. It was lovely to meet her around the hotel over the next few days with her warm hello - she is a real asset to the hotel.It is worth checking the hotel price regularly in the days leading up to your stay as it varies depending on vacancy rate. We added on an extra night after we arrived and paid $89 for that night as it was close to the memorial day weekend.HIGHLIGHTS: a block to Waikiki beach, 2 minutes walk to Macy's, 1 minute walk to the International Market, bus stop on the corner, great pool, great SPA, lovely abience, scrupulously clean airconditioned rooms, friendly staff, car rental place literally across the street, CHEAP!DOWNSIDES: noise from a bar down the street (we were only woken twicxe in 8 nights so not as bad as it sounds), awful views if you have a room facing the alleys (ask for a courtyard facing room), musty smeall until we asked to have the airconditioner serviced then it was fine.Overall this hotel was fantastic and the best kept secret in Oahu. We will definitely be staying there again in future.

We stayed for 9 days,5 of us all women.We had a unit with a connecting door one of us had to sleep on the sofa very uncomfortable.The rooms were very big and clean we had everything we needed there,the rooms were cleaned every day and very well.The staff were very helpful Arron and Diana were a great help for anything we needed.We loved the location central to everything markets,food,shopping (we loved the shopping )cant wait to go back....

This is a fantastic place if you are doing Waikiki on a budget. Our group of 4 stayed in one of the "1 bedroom" suites. It was actually 2 rooms adjoined by a door. The only downfall is that one room has a queen bed and the other room has two pull-out sofa's. Since our travel companion was 4 months pregnant, she took the queen bed and my wife and I each took a couch as the pull-out was dreadfully painful.It was great having a kitchen to do our own cooking, and the two weber bbq's by the pool are top notch.It's not even two blocks away from the beach, and very close to restaurants, stores, transit, etc. As said before, the staff are FANTASTIC. Aaron and Judy were extremely helpful with everything. Since our flights didn't leave until 10:30pm, the let us store all of our luggage and even let us use a room to shower up after squeezing in one last visit to the beach.Oh, and the free coffee every morning was great. Grab some fresh baked croissants or danishes across the street at St. Germains Bakery and you've got a delicious and cheap breakfast on the go.

We just returned from Celebrity Resorts for a six day stay. We travel to Hawaii a lot and this was the best place we have stayed at ever. The staff is wonderful Words can not explain how wonderful they are. Living in Las Vegas NV and working with people all day, I was so empressed with Judy the manager who is terriffic and Arron the front desk clerk who is wonderful. I have never experienced such friendly staff every day. Everyone at this hotel , all staff get an A.The room are clean and the maid servic is terriffic. They have everything you would want in a resort. Close to the beach, market and even have coffee for free in the mornings. Pancake breakfest, pizza night etc.Don't miss out on this one!!

Celebrity Resorts Hotel in Waikiki, is outstanding. I read all of the reviews on Expedia, and I thought that this Hotel should have been ranked much higher. There is no elevator, which to my husband and I was not a big deal what so ever, but the staff was outstanding, and very helpful. The housekeeping service came everyday, if you wanted, and cleaned everything. Even any dishes that might have been left in the sink. We stayed 4 nights, and that was not nearly enough. We will be going back to Hawaii in December of this year, 2007, and guess where we are staying, yep, you guessed it. Celebrity Resorts. In fact, we are going to talk to them about a time share.

Absolutely beautiful! The staff are exceptional ! Greg is the perfect host and the hotel staff were so helpful and so down to earth they made our stay The lobby was like old Hawaii and the pool was perfect with privacy from the busy streets. Central location to the beach and shopping! Activities are planned if you want to join in or not. I highly recommend joining in it was alot of fun! Kids loved it too and felt very safe in their surroundings. Rooms are very clean and comfortable! Loved it and would defineatly come back and stay with the folks who call you family while you are at your home away from home. Thankyou to all of you for making our family feel welcome !

This three story giant among hotel behemoths proved to be homey and welcoming. The staff was knowledgeable and friendly.The two studios we stayed in were perfect and had everything. There is now wireless internet being offered. Pool area was furnished well and even had two gas grills for charring burgers if that's your pleasure.Every room has a balcony but you could end up overlooking and alley or looking directly into someone's apartment. This air conditioning was little weak but if you took a fan with you that would make it perfect.The beds could use a mattress pad or replacement.That being written, I will be returning to Celebrity Resorts Waikiki when we return at the same time next year. At $74.00 a night it couldn't be beat.By the way, tip the maid a couple of dollars a day and they'll take care of your room, they're sweet ladies.

We booked this hotel on absolute last minute and I have to say we didn't get what we expected...in a good way. The room was HUGE (we got the suite, which is two rooms with a door in between) this room was way too big for just the two of us but it was still very nice and I couldn't believe what we got for the price, such a bargain. Everything was clean and tidy. About two blocks to Waikiki and lots of restaurants, shops and a nice little grocery store close by. We had a wonderful stay. On the last day checkout was at 11am and our plane didnt leave until the evening, they held our baggage and let us use a room that afternoon to shower in after a day at the beach, it was a great help and a lot more comfortable than showering at the beach!The only negative thing I would mention is make sure you reserve your parking if you rent a car. It is $10 a day if you park at the hotel BUT if they are out of spaces (there aren't very many!!) you get sent across the road to another hotel parking space where it is $18 a day!!! We booked this trip very last minute however, so lack of parking could mostly have been our fault, just make sure you've got a spot if you need one.

This was a small scale (3 story) hotel with not much of a view, but other than that, it was a great home away from home. The staff made you feel welcome, the location was just as great as any other hotel (close to everything) and their jacuzzi area is surrounded by plants and trees to make it very romantic. It appears to be a timeshare resort (signs mention guests and owners) and the guests we encountered usually seemed to be older couples. It was a nice quiet, comfortable place to stay with the little extras (like the kitchen) that make it a great deal for the price. It's not glamourous or fancy, but it has everything you need to relax after a day of swimming, sun or fun. They even have fun activities available on a daily basis, like a pizza party, scuba lessons, coconut painting, etc.

PERFECT. My Boyfriend and I just returned from our first trip to oahu, and we stayed 5 nights in this hotel. It was the perfect choice. The staff is really nice, they help with all my questions. The studio room is perfect for 2 people. 1 bed, 1 sofa, a small kitchen with all you need, including microwave, toaster and blender. After 1 day we allready felt like we were home. Our plane was departing saturday night, and it was great that the hotel has a baggage room so after we chek out we left our things there and went all day to the beach, and when we got back they even lend us a shower and towels. I really recomend this hotel, it´s in the center of waikiki, 1 block from shoping (international market place, waikiki shoping center, royal hawaiian), half block from all the restaurants, 2 blocks from the beach, and half block from the bus stop.

Can't begin to explain how happy We were with our stay. This place is a hidden gem. Sure its not the four seasons, but for what we paid it certainly seemed like it. Stayed 4 nights in September over labor day weekend. Loved it. Right in the middle of everthing waikiki has to offer. Staff was great. Special thanks to Judy(manager), and Brian and Diana(front desk staff), they really made our stay pleasant. Nice grounds in the courtyard. Only negative I would say is the parking situation. It's tight. But thats waikiki. Since this was our first trip I now know that a car really isn't needed. Cab it and rent a car for maybe a day or two max. There are buses and trolleys everywhere but pretty much everthing can be reached on foot. I would definitely stay there again.

I've been coming to Hawaii twice a year for the last ten years and I've stayed in so many hotels and Celebrity Resorts has got to be one of the best place I've stayed at. Conveniently located in the middle of everything, clean and the staff are the best. I highly recommend this place and I can't wait to come back to this hotel/resort. I love the daily programs that they offer, especially the all you can eat pancakes on Thursday !!! If you've read any bad reviews about this hotel, well let me tell you that they are wrong. This hotel/resort is one of the best in Waikiki and as i've mentioned I can't wait to come back here ...

The reviews posted here only begin to describe the warm, friendly, helpful and cooperative staff who are always available to answer all of the innumerable questions and requests. As others have said ignore the outside of the hotel. Walk in through the open air lobby and immediately take a deep breath. The atmostphere is very relaxing, paradise like. Adjacent to the lobby is an open air courtyard with the pool and hot tub in the middle. The three wings of the hotel surround the pool. Yes there are no elevators, but with the exception of dragging travel bags upstairs when arriving this isn't really a concern. A concierge is available most of the time. Each concierge was also knowledgeable and helpful about what to see and do. The location is great, across from Duke's Lane. From cross then next street for beach access and Cheesecake Factory. Its a great value for the price, I would easily stay there again if I were to return to Honolulu.

The reason I'm rating this above average and not excellent is because this is an older and smaller establishment than others in Waikiki and some renovations are due. The most wonderful part about this establisment is the staff!! I can't express this enough. I live on Oahu and my husband and I take "mini-vacations" several times a year. We love Celebrity Resorts because No. 1, the staff, and it's a homey-cozy kind of place. It has a pool, pool toys (rafts, balls, "volleyball net", etc. There is a hot tub in a romantic tree lined setting, close proximity to beach and shopping & free morning coffee. There are no elevators, 3 floors (not too bad), and the air conditioners and plumbing could use a little work. Especially appreciate Diana (great sense of humor) & Judy (warm and knowledgeable). We definetly will stay again if we can get in! It books up quite fast and early for most holidays. Much Mahalo, we truly felt like "ohana". See you soon!!!

This review has been delayed a bit but the wife and I stayed here for the week of March 22nd, 2006 during Oahu's worst rain storm in 50 years...Aside from the weather, we had an excellent time and enjoyed most of our stay at the Celebrity Resorts property.Features: Pool / Spa / Onsite laundry (coin op) / Free Coffee in the morning / Poolside activities / Tour Desk with friendly staffPros: Centrally located to the shopping and close to the cool bars and clubs. Small and quaint. Not too many kids as this is a timeshare property (exchanges through RCI are available) / Liquor store next door (and a bar) / kitchenette was adequately equipped / gas BBQs available for usage / Excellent maid service / No elevators (3 stories)Cons: Furnishings and decor could use an update / Beds were hard as wood / Showers smell of mold after a couple days / Musty smell in hotel hallways / No elevators / Views (if you aren't an owner of a timeshare you will not be happy)To elaborate on the view thing.... we got lucky because we have RCI so we are considered owners.... hence, we got a room with a view..... of the pool area. Others aren't so fortunate and get to look out onto the rundown apartment complexes next door or onto Nohonani Ave which is not bad but doesn't ring up "vacation" when you look out the window. I need visual stimulation. The pool area view at least has some scenery that is somewaht pleasant.The rooms have an old Hawaiian seafoam green carpet that has overstayed it's welcome and is probably due for an update. There is a snack machine available. No restaurant on site. Delivery services are available and the rooms come with a ton of restaurant flyers to order from.Our room was equipped with a safe, ironing board, pullout sofa, TV w/ cable, alarm clock, mini fridge and a kitchenette w/ cookware and place settings for 4.I would probably stay here again if it was our only choice like it was this last time. I travel to Hawaii 5 or 6 times a year and this is a good spot if you are looking to save a few dollars.The best part about this place was probably the friendly staff, and the location. This is a great spot to be if you want to be in the center of it all but for less money.

This place is a vacation paradise. It is a little hidden place on Oahu. The hotel is older than most but has so much more to offer than any other place that we have stayed. To begin with the front desk staff that checks you in is so friendly that they have already taken you into their "Ohana". From the moment that you check in until you check out they will help you with anything that you need as well as give you directions, tell you their opinion of what is good or bad places to see. I cannot say enough about Judy (the front desk manager) and her staff.The hotel has an exceptional housekeeping staff also. The grounds and the rooms are very clean. The staff is always busy cleaning and hustling, almost like being at Disneyland because they clean, clean, clean.The only problem that we had was with the General Manager. This man has a short fuse and goes off on his employees at a whim. He does it in front of the guests. Lucky that he spends most of his time in his office so we rarely saw him.

Really enjoyed our stay here. Selected the hotel based on the reviews at Trip Advisor and it met expectations. Location is great, close to everything. Yes - it's fairly basic but it's a home away from home and just right for budget travellers. It's friendly, clean and value for money so if you value these features - stay here.

Older style Hotel. Absolutely wonderful staff. Very helpful with a wonderful sense of humour especially once they got nearly used to my Kiwi (New Zealand) accent. Stayed 5 nights. Found a wonderful Bar across the road ($2.oo Maitais...hope the spelling is correct) from the Back Entrance and also a very well run and friendly internet cafe. The swimmingpool was great.

I've stayed at this resort before while trading a timeshare. It seems to be the only Honolulu timeshare location that ever has space available. When I was there the first time they said they were "renovating" so the hallways were pretty torn up. I thought that would explain its run down look. I was wrong about that.This time the room was even smaller it seemed than before, there is no bathtub -- only showers, the walls are quite thin, no elevators and there was a dead cockroach on the floor when we first walked in (not a killer for me - since it is Hawaii after all). The message light on our phone (right next to the bed) remained on and VERY bright throughout our stay. We were told that was the way it was supposed to be. Our A/C unit was very loud and one day it stopped working. I called about it and they said they'd send someone up. Turned out it had created a block of ice that was stopping the air from coming through. So we turned it off until it melted and then it worked again. No one ever came up to fix it nor did we hear from anyone.There is only one building that is non-smoking, but people smoked in it anyway. Our neighbor's smoke and voices came through the vents (as well as the wall).Our view? About 10 feet away from the wall and balcony of an apartment building next door, plus an unkempt alley. No point in using the balcony.I didn't find the pool or the hottub to be particularly clean so I didn't want to use them.The staff wasn't particularly helpful with the few things that I needed. The parking is very limited and it is first come, first served for the passes. So if you are one of the lucky one's whose flight comes in early you'll get one.The best part of this motel (not a hotel and not a resort) is its location. Walking distance to everything.RCI calls this an RCI Resort of International Distinction. Scares me to think what a regular timeshare would be like then. I traded a week of a Gold Crown resort for this.In the future, I'd prefer to pay for a hotel elsewhere.If you just want a shower and a bed, this may be the place for you.

We got to use a week of my parents' timeshare as a wedding present. At first, the Celebrity Resorts looked kinda shady. From the outside it looked old & run down. After checking in however, we were plesantly surprised at how wonderful everything was!We had a 1 bedroom/1 bath on the 2nd floor. We were at the end of our building & our view was of the hot tub (but the foliage pretty much covered everything).Our room was big & the kitchen was nice. We slept on the bed in the living room (there was a seperate bedroom, but we didn't use it). There was also a sleeper sofa.The staff was SO friendly. The 'daily' events were fun & well put together. The pool was small, but rarely were many people in it. Everything is within walking distance. We did not rent a car (you don't need to in Waikiki). I'd HIGHLY recommend staying here if you have the chance. We'd stayed a other Waikiki area hotels before (the big ones), but this was our favorite. It was personal & low-key. It was a pleasure staying here -- Loved it!

My wife and I stayed here a week during the second half of July '05; it was a timeshare gift so it didn't cost us anything except for incidentals. The hotel (they call it a resort, which is a stretch) is located in Waikiki about 10 miles from the airport. Parking is minimal (we didn't have a car anyway, parking is limited everywhere in Waikiki and it is expensive). It is an older three story, central courtyard hotel with no elevator. The rules sign on the room door had old Ramada Inn markings on it, so I suspect at one point that chain owned it.As for the Pros: it is centrally located - you can walk to almost everything in Waikiki. The rooms are clean, basic, but clean. Our room had a kitchenette which we stocked with some items by walking to the many stores located nearby. The staff was very helpful, they do try to make your stay enjoyable. There are daily activities for the guests. The hotel has a laundry room which was good to use before going home.The cons: the building is old and shows its age. The first impression I had (and other seem to have too) is that the building is run down. The reason for that impression is that the exterior concrete is worn and dirty. The courtyard and pool concrete is also worn. The pool is small. NO ELEVATORS. parking is limited.The hotel is perfect for budget travelers, families with small children, singles/groups travelling on a tighter budget, or people looking to save money while in Waikiki and are looking for a clean place to sleep after spending the day out-and-about. I don't think honeymooners, couples on a romantic getaway, or people looking for the "hawaii resort" experience would want to stay here.

This was my first trip to Hawaii and I went with 5 of my friends because we had all just graduated. When I told people where we were staying, no one had ever heard of the place, so I was a little scared. Upon arriving at this small, quaint resort, I thought it was not going to be a nice place. But when you see the lights in the pool area lit up, and the way the lobby is decorated made it very cute & intimate. We had a 1 bdrm suite with a kitchenette, 1 queen & 2 sofa beds. The kitchenette was fully stocked, had a microwave, fridge, burner and a dining table. Although the suite looks old (in fact this resort is one of the original 7 in Waikiki before all the high rise buildings were established), it is a fairly good size. I loved how they gave us 2 bathrooms (we really needed it, there were 6 girls!). The sofa beds were not that comfortable. However, the staff were AMAZING! They were extremely nice, in fact the front desk helped us plan our driving route around the island the first day we were there. They have great activities that go on: everyday is something new, whether its free breakfast (NOT gross continental), or live entertainment. Thanks to their activities center, we were able to go on this amazing tour (its called Hawaiian Isle Adventures for those who would like to see historic spots that many tourists dont normally see & go snorkeling & body boarding). Although the room itself was not all that great, I absolutely loved the environment at this place. We had a great time thanks to the staff there!

The Celebrity Resorts Waikiki is not the great Hawaiian resort that you may imagine it to be. However, it is very affordable, clean & the staff is very helpful. The rooms are very large & come w/ a kitchen. Our 1BR also had 2 full bathrooms. They are great in helping w/ plans/excursions/etc. They also arrange activities throughout the week. We enjoyed their little pool & hottub. Everything is clean, but a little outdated. It is a great deal of a place in Waikiki. You are not spending the extreme amounts of $$$$ that you would fork-out elsewhere. And besides, you don't really stay in your room that much anyways, you are in Hawaii!!! Overall we were very satisfied w/ our experience & would recommend it to those on a tighter budget.

Celebrity Resorts of Waikiki Beach is a timeshare building that rents it's unoccupied units to non-timeshare owners. The slightly dated, three story complex is surrounded by impersonal highrise units that tower above the beautiful palms and foilage that surround the community pool and spa area. This is a quiet, clean and relatively small building that had everything we needed for our one week stay. Our rate was around $100 a night for an approximately 600 sq foot studio with a well-outfitted kitchen and private balcony, just five minutes walking distance from the clear, warm, turquoise waters of Waikiki Beach! Oh, and the bed was so comfortable! The desk and concierge staff was courteous, professional, and friendly. Lots of enjoyable activities like live music, coconut painting, a pancake breakfast and visits from local tour guides. This is a pleasant little place that offered us an assigned parking place for a nominal $10 per day.

Although an older, small hotel, the front desk staff more than made up for any shortcomings. I was very pleased with their help and advice; they are to be commended.Thank you for making our vacation so enjoyable!!

Do not stay at this resort if you are looking for an "Hawaiian paradise", because this is a small, older resort in the middle of a busy neighborhood and does not offer a resort atmosphere. The room was clean and pleasant and the grounds were well maintained. Shopping and Waikiki beach are within a short walking distance, as are a variety of restaurants. The staff were very pleasant and helpful also. Our only complaint was the small parking area.

I was so happy with the staff at this resort. We exchanged our timeshare from Orlando to this resort. I was disappointed at the first glance of the place. I am so glad we stayed there. Our teenage sons met a lot of great people,and they got to learn to hula dance,snorkel and have pool partys, which were all set up and covered through the resort. Our boys want to come back there this coming July, but I was told by RCI that the resort is booked for 2years. We will return. Thanks a lot to George, Greg, K.C.,Wilson, and Krissy for making us feel like family instead of like guests, Mahalo, and Aloha.

Celebrity Resorts Waikiki was more than what we expected it to be.The staff, the atmosphere, the location were all great. That is a really quiet resort, it kind of brings you back to old Hawaii. This is the only Resort that has not invested in elevators but it is very relaxing and beautiful, with a swimming pool, a hot tub, flowers and shrubs all around, coconut trees, you couldn't ask for anything more quaint. If you are looking for something more loud and obnoxious Celebrity Resorts Waikiki is not where you want to be. Some of people that you meet there have been staying at that Resort for more than 20yrs. So naturally all the people there are friendly. You will really have a great time if your looking for a more family oriented place. Now, if you are looking for something a little more upper calss, where you get checked in and checked out and none of the staff/guests know you or even want to know you then you should definately not stay at Celebrity Resorts Waikiki.

We just returned from a one week December vacation and found the Celebrity Resorts to be very convenient, clean and quiet. The resort manager, George, and his staff were very friendly, knowledgeable and caring. We enjoyed our stay in Honolulu and would consider returning to the Celebrity Resorts again.

We traded our timeshare into this "resort" and were so disgusted with the condition of the property and our room, that we checked out after only one night. We paid for a hotel in Waikiki (at $100+ per night) rather than stay here.Only redeeming qualities are it's location in downtown Waikiki and that it is close to Waikiki beach and shopping. Property is similar to an old motel: three stories, no elevator, outside stairways with nice views of trash. Rooms small, worn, overall poor condition. Whole property in need of major renovation. Even "free", this property was not a good value! After flying from the east coast and arriving to this, my wife cried. Do yourself a favor, go somewhere else!
